description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June (Reuters)  Venezuela's oil production for the first five months of this year averaged 1.99 million barrels a day, decrease of 12.63 percent compared with output in the similar period last year, the Ministry of Mines reported today.

title: Excessive Paperwork Leads to Disbanding of Police Plainclothes Unit
description: Eight months after it was established as a supposedly permanent unit, the New York City Police Department's elite Anticrime Enforcement Squad has been quietly disbandeda casualty, in part, of the paperwork its success had generated.

title: U.S. and Canada, in Fishing Dispute, Politely Bar Each Other's Vessels
description: DETROIT, June 5The United States and Canada began excluding each other's fishing vessels from their respective waters at noon today in a dispute over rights to fishing grounds.

title: Rangers Happy to Show Off Two Swedish Stars
description: Two hockey players wearing Nos. 15 and 11 hit town yesterday, and suddenly Ranger morale doubled. That's how Anders Hedberg (15) and Ulf Nilsson (11), the club's new Swedish acquisitions, are affecting the New York team four months before the National Hockey League season opens.

title: Gov. Grasso Signs Bill Requiring Most Stores to Close on Sundays
description: HARTFORD, June 5Expressing concern for employees, Gov. Ella T. Grasso sIgned a bill requiring nearly all stores in the state to be closed on Sundays.

title: Kathleen L. Brelsford Wed to William Mcllwain
description: Kathleen Louise Brelsford, a thirdyear student at the Boston University School of Medicine, was married yesterday to William Franklin Mcl!wain, an author, and editor of The Boston Herald American. The Rev. Neil Sweet, pastor of the Bryantville United Methodist Church, performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Bergenheim in I)uxhury, Mass.

title: England Defeats .Pakistan In First Cricket Test
description: BIRMINGHAM. England. June 5 (Reuters)England beat Pakistan by an inning and 57 runs with a day to spare n the first cricket. test at Edgbaston here, dismissing its rival for 231 today in its second innings.

title: Nets
description: Roy L. M. Boe's sale of the New Jersey Nets appeared imminent yesterday and the leading candidate for the purchase of the debtridden National Basketball Association franchise was believed to be Arthur D. Imperatore, a New Jersey trucking millionaire.

title: State Senator Bloom Opens Drive Challenging Carey for Governor
description: State Senator Jeremiah B. Bloom set out yesterday on a statewide tour to publicize his campaign for the Democratic nomination for Governor of New York and said it would be a sign of weakness if party leders did not vote to put him on the primary election ballot.

title: Carnegie Ticket Chief Ousted
description: The head ticket seller at Carnegie Hall, Nathan Posnick, has resigned, at his employer's request, after having been implicated in the alleged illicit sale of 300 Vladimir Horowitz concert tickets at more than the official, boxoffice price, Carnegie Hall's general counsel said yesterday.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: FROM Casque d'Or through Madame Rosa, Simone Signoret has left her imprint on film as a strong, determined and resilient woman and actress. As

title: Television
description: Mickey Rooney and Elizabeth Taylor in the first half of the 1945 film National Velvet, 8 P.M. on Channel 2.

title: In Memoriam
description: TREITLER(Benny). Happy Writ day, dearest friend, beloved soul Fondly, P.L.

title: Yankees Defeated by Mariners, 73
description: SEATTLE, June 5Slipping deeper into their slump, the New York Yankees took a 73 beating from the Seattle Mariners in the Kingdome tonight, as Ed Figueroa got knocked out, Manager Billy Martin and Lou Piniella got thrown out, and the Yankee hitters got put out by Tom House and Enrique - Romo. It was New York's sixth loss in the last seven games.

title: Lorimer Rich, 86, an Architect
description: Lorimer Rich, the architect who designed the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in the National Cemetery at Arlington, Va., died Friday in a nursing home in Rome, N.Y. He was 86 years old and lived in Camden, N.Y.

title: Buddy Gilmour Indicted On Income Tax Charge
description: William (Buddy) Gilmour. one of the nation's leading harness drivers, was indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of evading taxes on income of nearly $200,000 over a threeyear period starting in 1971.

title: CITY AND UNIONS REACH ACCORD ON A PACT FOR 200,000 WORKERS; MAYOR'S BUDGET NEAR PASSAGE
description: New York City reached a $757 million twoyear contract agreement last night with its 200,000member municipal labor coalition, a key step toward easing the city's financial problems.

title: ASSEMBLY APPROVES GHOSTSURGERY BILL
description: ALBANY, June 5  The Assembly passed a bill today designed to combat ghost surgery, the practice of having someoneother than the surgeon em ployed to perform an operationoperate on a patient without the patient's knowledge.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Markets

title: ESSEX VOTERS TO PICK TWO FOR EXECUTIVE
description: NEWARK, June 5Voters in Essex County will choose the Democratic and Republican candidates for the new, poWerful post of County Executive in the primary elections tomorrow.

title: ]Confidence Off In Economy
description: Rapidly rising prices and the fear of more ahead have sharply reduced confidence in the economy, according to a consumer survey by the Conference Board, the businessresearch group.

title: People in Sports ...
description: Tracy Tripucka, who served as interim head coach of the Fordhain basketball team after Dick Stewart was dismissed in midseason, has been named assistant coach to Jerry Pimm at the University of Utah. Fordhnm hired

title: Water Rules Expected to Bring Major Change
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Government officials call it major rulemaking activity, and it is work that the guardians of the nation's water quality are heavily involved in these days.

title: Ballet and Summer Evening on Ice
description: The party people put on their summer best (at least that's what the invitations specified) last night and trooped over to, of all places, a chilly iceskating rink on West 33d Street near. of all places, 10th Avenue.

title: Soviet Orders Two U.S. Exhibit Guides Expelled
description: MOSCOW. June. 5The Soviet Union today demanded the immediate withdrawal of two guides from a touring American agricultural exhibition for what it called incendiary activity slandering the Soviet state and social system.

title: 24 FOOD OUTLETS FAIL HEALTH-CODE INSPECTION
description: The New York City Health Department yesterday cited 24 food places that have violated the Health Code, 10 restaurants that had corrected earlier violations and one restaurant that was reopened. The following food places were cited:

title: GUILTY SENATOR TO KEEP SEAT UNTIL SENTENCING
description: ALBANY, June 5A spokesman for the State Senate said today that Senator Lloyd H. Paterson, a Niagara Falls Republican who was convicted of grand larceny and official misconduct last Friday, would not forfeit his Senate seat until after his sentencing in August.

title: Output of Steel Declines by 2%
description: Steel production for the week ended June 3 declined to 2.7 million tons, down 2 percent from the 2.8 million tons produced the week before, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Stocks Advance In Big Day
description: Stock prices bounded ahead in heavy trading yesterday to reach their best levels in nearly nine months as once-reluctant institutional investors poured money into the market. Glamour and technology issues, joining with the blue chips. led the dynamic advance.

title: E.E.C. to Lift Prices of Steel
description: BRUSSELS, June 5 (Reuters)  The European Common Market will raise prices of several grades of steel by an average of 5 percent on July 1, Common Market officials said today.

title: $13.5 BILLION BUDGET FOR CITY IS APPROVED
description: The Board of Estimate and the City Council swiftly approved Mayor Koch's ;$13.5 billion budget last night.

title: LowKey Labor Referee
description: Arvid Anderson

title: The Ph.D. Blues
description: STAMFORD, Conn. Crowded into an office, five members of my doctoral committee questioned me for two hours in a highly formalized procedure, reminiscent of a secret rite, about my masterpiece. The Ef- fect of Group Counseling on Levels of Depression Among Retired Women. My greatest fear was that a professor's sudden inspiration to make the study more meaningful might sentence me to another year of relentless research.

title: Diversity Marks Architecture Awards
description: In presenting its annual Bard Awards for excellence in architecture and urban design, which will be given at ceremonies at the City University Graduate Center tonight, the City Club of New York has made it clear that no single point of view prevails in architecture right now.

title: SixMonth Treasury Bills Drop
description: Sixmonth Treasury bills  the securities that determine the yield on new savings certificates now being sold by banks and savings institutions were auctioned yesterday at an average discount rate of 7.095 percent, down from 7.160 percent last week.

title: Baden T ells Curare Trial He Found No Cause of Death
description: said there was some skeletonization. On the fifth alleged victim, Carl Rohrbeck, Dr. Baden said there was extensive skeletonization, the body was not in ;nod state of preservation.

title: The Contract Accord
description: The odd part of the contract settlement that was reached yesterday between the cite and its unions after two months of sturm and drang was that the same agreement could have been made the night of the transit settlement if Hayor Koch had allowed it. City and union negotiators both said yesterday that they had been prepared to settle for the package of 4 percentplus 4 percent that the unions eventually got, but that Mayor Koch had insisted that the total raise could not exceed 6 percent.

title: Phils Slug Three Homers Off Blue, Top Giants, 43
description: The score was only 43, with the Philadelphia Phillies defeating the San Francisco Giants before a crowd of 37,684 and a national television audience in Philadelphia's Veterans Stadium last night. The score doesn't reflect the kind cf slugfest the game was as five home runs were belted, accounting for six of the seven runs.

title: Nippon Aide Cites Payment
description: TOKYO, June 5 (AP)  A former official of All Nippon Airways testified today that after dinner one night four years ago a Lockheed Corporation executive gave him a cardboard box contaming $400,000 as rebates for his company.

title: Mrs. King Is the Star As Apples Rout Oranges
description: Billie Jean King won her singles match, 60, and then teamed with JoAnne Russell to capture the women's doubles and propel the New York Apples to a 3215 World Team Tennis victory over the Anaheim Oranges last right in the Felt Forum.

title: Washington Journal
description: ONE lovely morning last week, while the President was over at the Kennedy Center excoriating Cuba and the Soviet Union before a gathering of NATO folks, two elderly women in white blouses were walking down an ancient brick sidewalk in Georgetown, frequently consulting the guide book they had purchased at the hotel and pointing with admiration and occasional awe at some of the fine old 19th century houses on their leisurely tour.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A second security breach in conne& tion with the College Board Entrance examination has forced the service that devises the test to ask 170 Edison students to retake the mathematics section of the exam.

title: French ExPremier Seeking to Foster Population Growth
description: PARIS. June 5Michel Debre, former Prime Minister of France, is obsessed what he calls the peril of the declining birthrate. He rails against television soap operas that portray the typical happy family as a couple with one or two children.

title: It's Basketball, Not Show Biz
description: Sports of The Times

title: EARL O. BERRY
description: Earl O. Berry died Saturday of a heart attack in the telephone recording room of The New York Times, where he worked as a recording room operator. Mr. Berry, who joined The Times in 1960, was 53 years old.

title: STRIKE AT THE NEWS IS THREATENED TODAY
description: Federal mediators strove yesterday to avert a strike scheduled for 2 P.M. today against The New York Daily News, the nation's biggest newspaper.

title: Ruling Party's Choice Apparent Victor in Colombia
description: BOGOTA, Colombia. June 5Colombia's presidential election has apparently been won by the candidate of the governing Liberal Party, Julio Cesar Turbay Ayala, in an unexpectedly tight race.

title: HERMON FARWELL,PHYSICIST SPECIALIZING IN OPTICS
description: Funeral services were held in Noroton, Conn., yesterday for Hermon W. Farwell, a physicist and Columbia University's senior emeritus professor, who died last Friday in Stamford Hospital in Stamford. He was 98 years old and lived in Darien.

title: Senate Race in Jersey Keyed to Hudson County Vote
description: With Senator Clifford P. Case expected to weather a livek,- chalienge from the conservative wing of the Republican Party today in Nev. Jersey's primary elections, most of the attention is focused on the contest for the Democratic nomination, particularly in Hudson County where it may well he decided.

title: U.S. BARRED FROM NAMING DOCTORS PAID BY MEDICARE
description: CHICAGO,June 5 (Reuters)  The American Medical Association to won a court order preventing the Fed rai Goy ernment from releasing the names of physicians who received payments from the Medicare program in 1977.

title: Liberal Voting Record
description: In Senator Montoya's successful reelection campaign in 1970, his Republican opponent, Anderson Carter, charged that in earlier years Mr. Montoya had said: The way to succeed in politics is by talking to the people and voting for the special interests.

title: Study of Lake Michigan Finds Drop in Pollution
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (Reuters)  The waters and shoreline of Lake Michigan are not as dirty so they once were, but the huge laike could be much cleaner, according to a report released today by the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Supreme Court left standing today a decision that a New Hampshire statutory rape law was unconstitutionally discriminatory because it punished men but not women. The law has since been replaced with a statute that applies equally to men and women.

title: A Champion Among Champions
description: DeWitt Clinton High School has won so many championships in so many sports that its hard to find space for all the trophies in the huge building on Mosholu Parkway in the Bronx. Nobody at the school, however, can remember the Governors winning any titles in tennis before Carl Williams.

title: Business People
description: Carlo Bordoni, the Italian financier implicated in the collapse of the Franklin National Bank in 1974, was ordered held in in lieu of $1 million bail in Federal court here yesterday. Mr. Bordoni, 49 years old, had lost his fight against extradition from Venezuela last Friday and arrived in New York Sunday night.

title: MOROCCO'S KING VOWS PROTECTION OF ZAIRE
description: MADRID, June 5King Hassan II of Morocco vowed last night to intervene in Zaire again and even la third and a fourth time to help protect the African country from further attacks by insurgents based in neighboring Angola.

title: U.S. Gives Energy Data
description: PARIS, June 5The Carter Administration has submitted new forecasts for United States energy consumption to an international agency based on an assumption that Congress will not have approved its energy program designed to slow America's growing dependence on imported oil.

description: MAKING FRIENDS: Youngster greeting one of the pedigreed cats put on display at bank at 47th Street and Madison Avenue yesterday.

title: Senator Brooke Faces Problems on Money Dealings
description: BOSTON, June 5Senator Edward W. Brooke faces thorny legal and ethical questions that have arisen with conflicting statements about a $49,000 debt and disclosures of how he handled family finances, interviews with lawyers and Government officials reveal.

title: ALAN JEWETf LOWREY
description: Alan Jewett Lowrey, a retired oil company executive and a former partner in the brokerage firm of E. F. Hutton E.: company, died last Tuesday in San Francisco. He was 88 years old.

Clothier, Bonwit Teller and Bloomingdale's, where she also served as merchandise manager, died Sunday in St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn, L.I., after a long illness. She was 34 years old and lived at 12 Montford Road, Port Washington, L.I.

description: BAY SHORE, L.I.

description: JEFFREY SIEGEL didn't exactly yawn when the New York Philharmonic called him recently and asked him to play a Mozart piano concerto because the scheduled soloist, James Levine, had backed out with severe case of tendinitis. This was

title: Notes on People
description: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the exiled Russian author now living in Vermont, is scheduled to give the commencement address at Harvard University on Thursday, The identity of the school's commencement speaker traditionally is kept secret, but several news organizations had reported the choice of Mr. Solzhenitsyn, wind a Harvard official, who asked not to be identified, confirmed the reports. It couldn't stay a secret because of security arrangements that had to be made, the official said.

title: Dance Visions 78 To Open at C.U.N.Y.
description: Dance films, videotapes and panel discussions will make up the Dance, Visions 78 festival at the City Universitl Graduate Center, 33 West 42d Street, from June 19 to 30. Rare and wellknown films on such topics as Russian ballet, cinedance, American modern and ethnic dance and the role of women in American dance will be shown each afternoon, introduced by critics, dancers and choreographers who will be on hand for informal conversation.

title: Jazz: Ella Fitzgerald Wins Ovation
description: ACONCERT by Ella Fitzgerald at Avery Fisher Hall, originally scheduled for March 19 but postponed because of her illness, was held Sunday evening with an enthusiastic audience that not only filled the hall but most of the stage as well. Miss Fitzgerald was greeted with a roaring ovation and was cheered continuously throughout her urogram.

title: A Double Blow by the Court
description: The privacy rights of the lawabiding were shabbily treated by the Supreme Court the other day when held that police may search for evidence of crime on the premises of persons who are not themselves suspected of any crime. The Fourth Amendment protects the right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers and effects against unreasonable searches, but the Court said this sort of search was reasonable. Judicial warrants may now be obtained for unannounced, wideranging searches through files, drawers - even waste baskets - without proof that such methods are needed to guard against destruction of the evidence. This decision strikes a double blow, at individual privacy and press freedom.

title: U.S. Aiding Refugees in Bangladesh
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)The United States is providing S2.6 mill:on worth of food, and a cash grant of S500,000, to help Bangladesh cope with an influx of 150,000 Moslems from neighboring Burma, the Agency for International Development announced today.

title: NewCar Sales Up 13.5% In Last 10 Days of May
description: DETROIT, June 5 Strong newcar sales by the nation's two largest car makers in the final selling period of May helped push domestic sales up 13.5 percent from yearago levels to their secondbest performance for such a period, the industry reported today.

description: TUESDAY, JUNE 6, 1.978

title: CITIES RULED LIABLE FOR EMPLOYEE ACTS
description: In a precedentsetting decision affecting courts in the New York region, a Federal Court of Appeals ruled yesterday that municipalities could be sued for the unconstitutional actions of police officers or other employees.

title: Executive Changes
description: American Standard Inc. has named William E. Kassling vice presidentcorporate planning.

title: EIGHT STATES VOTING IN PRIMARIES TODAY
description: Eight states will hold primary elections today, but more attention will be directed at a California vote cn slashing property taxes than on who wins nominations for Governor, Senator or Representative.

title: Egypt's Leftist Party Suspends Activities To Protest Restraint
description: CAIRO, Tune 5Egypt's small leftist party announced today that. it was suspending 'mass political activity in protest against newly imposed restrictions on political dissent.

title: Court Rebuffs Western Union
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  The Supreme Court refused today to review an attempt by Western Union International Inc. to eliminate what the cornpany said were $1 million-a-year increases in its business costs.

title: Energy Dept. to Propose Ending Retail Gasoline Price Controls
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Department of Energy plans to send a proposal to Congress soon to lift all price controls from gasoline at the pump, a department official said tonight.

title: Organ: Noehren Wins Accolades For Performance and Scholarship
description: THE PROGRAM notes for Robert Noehren's organ recital last night in Alice Tully Hall went out on a limb and described Olivier Messiaen as the most significant and influential composer of the 20th century. Mr. Messiaen has cer- tainly written a lot of imposing music for the king of instruments, although only an organist would probably think of making such an extravagant claim.

title: DOLE BILL WOULD RESTRICT SEARCH OF PRIVATE PAPERS
description: SHINGTON, JUNE 5 (AP)Senator Reber: Dole, Republ:can of Kansas, introduced legislation today to restrict pewer of the pel:cc to search LIncagh private papers of a person not suspected of canes..

title: Glassboro State Wins Title
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, June 5 (AP)Bob Pfeffer allowed seven hits today in pitching Glassboro State to its first National Collegiate Division HI baseball championship with a 53 triumph over Marietta College.

title: IC Offering $394 Million For Pet Inc.
description: Pet Inc., the big food company, received an unwanted takeover bid yes terday valued at $394 million in cash from IC Industries, a widely diversified holding company with interests ranging from railroads to soft drinks.

title: Cauthen, on Syntariat, Ends a Long Dry Spell
description: Steve Cauthen ended a 32race losing streakthe longest of his New York careerat Belmont yesterday when he rode Michael G. Rutherford's Syntariat to a 31/4length triumph in the eighthrace feature. A crowd of 17,456 looked on in balmy weather.

description: They are traded like baseball cards, worn on little girls ear lobes like prized jewels and collected in albums like rare postage stamps.

title: FIVE WESTERN ALLIES DISCUSS AID TO ZAIRE
description: PARIS, Tuesday, June 6Representatives of the United States and four allied nations met here through the day yesterday to discuss aid to Zaire and announced early today that they had agreed on unspecified recommendations to their Governments.

title: What New York Asks
description: In its fashion, New York City has now pulled its act together. It has squeezed more aid from New York State, held its employees to a raise that is less than half the current rate of inflation, and repaid every cent of emergency Federal loans, with interest. Before that, during three years at the edge of bankruptcy, it reduced its work force by about 20 percent, let its plant and equipment deteriorate to an appalling degree, revolutionized its bookkeeping systems, raised taxes, froze wages, increased transit fares and imposed tuition at its university. It delayed repayment of its debts and pressured its workers to invest their pension funds in the city's future.

title: Bonn Coalition Party Is Set Back In 2 West German State Elections
description: HANOVER, West Germany, June 5 (Reuters)The Free Democratic Party, junior partner in West Germany's Social Democraticled Government, has suffered a political mauling in state elections in Lower Saxony and Hamburg.

title: Vietnam Gives China Permission To Send Ships to Get Refugees
description: TOKYO, June 5 (Reuters)Vietnam told China today that it could send ships to pick up Chinese residents in Vietnam who wanted to go to China, the Vietnam News Agency reported.

title: Cinderella

title: CHINA IS SAID TO FREE 110,000 IN DETENTION SINCE '57 CRACKDOWN
description: HONG KONG, June 5A3 part of broad new effort to restore ictims of political persecution, China has recently released about 110,000 people who had hcen detained since an antirightist campaign in 1957, Chinese sources here have disclosed.

description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 5 (AP)Swarms of cropravaging locusts are invading Ethiopia, where the Government already is conducting relief operations for a severe famine affecting one million people in the northeast, it was announced today.

title: BTR Ltd. Bids For Worcester
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., June 5 (AP) BTR Ltd., a British rubber products maker, has made a $45 million bid for the Worcester Controls Corporation of Manchester, a company spokesman said today. Worcester manufacturers valves and control devises;

Weekday hours are 9:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M.

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Block Miss Little's Extradition to Raleigh

title: Bonnefous, After Injury, Enjoys Some New Steps
description: IT was nearly a year ago that JeanPierre Bonnefous of the New York City Ballet collapsed on stage at the New York State Theater in the kind of trivialseeming, unpredictable accident dreamed of by dancers. Landing slightly offbalance from a jump, he tore all the ligaments in one ankle and was carried off in midballet. Six weeks of inactivity, with his leg in a cast, followed; and since then Mr. Bonnefous has been able to perform only one limited partnering role.

title: Windfall Profits at Montclair State
description: MONTCLAIR, June 5With its three 7foot shining steel blades whirling effortlessly even in the lightest breeze, a new windmill began to pump energy today into the electrical system of Finley Hall at Montclair State College.

title: German C.D.'s Are Recalled
description: Salomoirothers confirmed yesterday that it had recalled $10 million in certificates of deposit denominated in West German marks that it sold recently to investors in the United States.  The sale of the certificates, issued by the Deutsche Genossenschaft Bank of Frankfurt. was canceled in response to pressure by the Bundesbank, West Germany's central bank.Genossenscha offered the certificates, the first such markdenominated of ferngs in the American market, through Salomon Brothers at interest rates of 3.2 percent and 3.25 percent on maturities of 30, 60 and 90 days. Salomon Brothers said the issue was sold out within a few hours.

title: 4 Officers Deny Guilt in Death

description: WHITE PLAINS. June 5The mother of Richard J. Herrin, a 24-year-old Yak University graduate accused of bludgeoning his college sweetheart to death last July, today described her son's c:irly life as one of relative poverty in R MeNIcanAmerican community of Los Angeks, and one filled with a fear of being taken away.

title: 1,058 Bombings in U.S. In 1977 Set Record

description: TRENTON, June 5The State Senate voted today to establish a state council to provide housing quotas for New Jersey's cities under court pressure to accept a fair share of the state's 1 million poor.

description: ALBANY. June 5Governor Carey dedicated the new central administration headquarters of the State University of New York today, formally ending a 30year odyssey that saw the university administration occupy dozens of cramped offices here.

title: Closing Threatens a Chicago School Praised for Its Students

title: Water Like Silver Grease
description: We got upset recently when the State Comptroller proposed to end night service on the Staten Island ferry. The Comptroller can give us all the figures he likes to show we don't need the night service, but we beg to differ. We go back a long way on the Staten Is- land ferry. Not as far as Commodore Vanderbilt, you understand, but far enough. Incidentally, Vanderbilt started it before going on to the New York Central. He charged 18 cents a ride and made a bundle. Today, you can get two rides  out and back for a quarter.

title: Faulting Nuclear Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTONSince the 1950's, Europe's major states have again become economic and political giants, but they remain American military protectorates. Tensions have been inevitable but so far manageable. But with dtente, Vietnam, Watergate, Congressional government, the oil crisis, a declining dollar and general world recession, transAtlantic relations are increasingly touchy. In one crucial area, nuclear energy, the Administration's diplomacy seems off to a bad start.

title: Film: Rise of a Servant:Love and Money
description: FOR years Maria (Andrea Ferreol) has been the faithful cook/housekeeper/domestic to a wealthy fertilizer dealer who lives outside Paris. When the old fellow dies, his nephew Jerome (Victor Lanoux), who used to play childhood games with Maria, returns to collect his legacy. Imagine his surprise when he learns that the legacythe house, the Rolls-Royce, the fortune, everythinghas been left to the servant. Maria, a maid who always wanted to be a lady, agrees that Jerome may stay on in the mansion on her terms, that is, if he becomes her servant.Thus begins, more or less, "Servant and Mistress," a first feature film by Bruno Gantillon, a French director with a good deal of style but not much on his mind. The film opens today at the Columbia II."Servant and Mistress" might possibly have been a funny film, but Mr. Gantillon takes his fancy sado-masochism quite seriously. Jerome hangs around the mansion accepting the various humiliations that Maria heaps on him. He serves her breakfast in bed. He washes the floors. He picks up purposely dropped napkins and observes her having sex with another man, all in the fond hope that one day she'll tire of the game and revert to their earlier relationship.Butare you really ready for this?he begins to fall in love with her. However, poor Maria, who dearly loves Jerome, knows she can never be a real lady (or, at least, I think that's whather conclusion is), and so these escalating humiliations must come to a sad, freeze-frame ending."Servant and Mistress" is the sort of deadly earnest, crashingly irrelevant romantic melodrama that the French are inclined to take much more seriously than we do, perhaps because they recognize in its artificialities a relationship to a kind of French boulevard comedy that's never been very popular here. "Servant and Mistress" is not comedy by any means, but it has more to do with manners than with ideas, characters, life or even sex.Miss Ferreol ("La Grande Bouffe") and Mr. Lanoux ("Cousin, Cousine"), both of whom are in much more trim shape than they were in those earlier films, are performers of wit whenever the screenplay allows, which isn't, often. Mostly they move through the movie like Siamese fighting fish in water that's begun to freeze. They are elegant but sluggish.

From now through November, American tourists in search of the perfect meal will steer by the threestar constellations of the Guide Michelin. backed by the rooster and crown of the Guide Kleber. Many of these pilgrims will make their way to one or more of the 18 restaurants that have earned those lofty accolades.

title: Panel Told Seoul Used Followers Of Sun Myung Moon for Protests
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)  House investigators today quoted United States intelligence reports as saying that the South Korean intelligence agency had used the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's followers for demonstrations in this country.

title: Diamond Shamrock: chemical company or food company? Diamond Shamrock: resourceful company.
description: You know Diamond Shamrock, quite properly, as an international chemicals company, with resourcefulness that goes beyond the laboratory, deep into the earth. Into domestically owned or controlled resources such as oil, gas, and salt the building blocks of today's chemicals ... and tomorrow's.

title: Defendant Takes Stand in White Plains Murder Trial
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 6Richard J. Herrin, taking the stand today at his trial on charges of murdering his former sweetheart, admitted bludgeoning Bonnie Jean Garland with a claw hammer last July.

title: INTELLIGENCE FUNDS VOTED, BUT THE TOTAL IS UNKNOWN
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)The House today voted new funds for intellicncc gathering even though the vast majority of represent atives had no idea how much money they were appproving.

title: Notes on People
description: AT 7:36 A.M. yesterday, at 7:37, at 7:38 and at 7:39 A.M., Sharon Prussia gave birth to babies. The two girls and two boys were delivered by Caesarian section at New York HospitalCornell Medical Center, and the babies were said to be in good condition. I'm just relieved that it's all over with and she'll come home to the other kids, said the quadruplets father, George Prussin. My wife had been in the hospital for 12 weeks. The doctors wanted to make sure she had the best of care. Mr. Prussin, a computer executive who lives with his 28-year-old wife and their other two children in Alpine, N.J., said they learned on Valentine's Day that Mrs. Prussin, who had taken fertility pills, expected four children. He said the boys would be named Ross and Jarett and the girls Alexis and Brooke.

title: Bangladesh's SoftSpoken but Strict President
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 5One hot, sultry evening two years ago, shortly after he had taken over as the military ruler of Bangladesh, Maj. Gen. Ziaur Rahman was sitting in the living room of his whitestone bungalow here

title: Theater: Premiere Of Williams Play
description: Tale of Heartbreak

title: New Online Video
description: A new online video display tube system for typographers and a new scanning system for word processing installations has been introduced by Compuscan, a manufacturer of optical character recognition systems.The basic system is sold at prices starting at $79,000, including two VDT and text procesing, formatting and file management software.

title: Casino Averaged $438,504 a Day, First Report to JeJers ey Unit Shows
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 5Resorts International reported today that in the first six days of operating the nation's first legal gambling casino outside Nevada, it took in an average of $438,504

title: Mr. Carter and the Meaning of SALT
description: The world will be listening closely when President Carter attempts to clarify American policy toward the Soviet Union at the Annapolis commencement today. His principal advisers, Cyrus Vance and Zbigniew Brzezinski, have been openly disagreeing about how to relate Soviet intrusions into Africa to the effort to conclude a second arms control treaty with Moscow. The President has seemed to side now with one, now with the other. If the country  and the Kremlin  are to be persuaded that Mr. Carter remains interested in quickly finishing the treaty, more will be needed than last week's sharp denial of the contrary.

title: Pharaon Considering Making OKC Offer
description: Ghaith R. Pharaon, the Saudi Arabian millionaire now seeking control of the National Bank of Georgia, is considering making an offer of about $21 a share for a minimum of 500,000 shares of the OKC Corporation of Dallas, a Houston lawyer said yesterday. OKC has interests in cement, oil and hydraulic dredging.

title: Wave of Violent Crime Since Civil War Is Keeping Lebanese in Their Homes at Night
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 6Sometimes I'm more scared of violence now than during the war because things were, in a way, better then, more organizedthere were sides, and you knew where to go for help, a Lebanese woman remarked the other day.

title: Turning Off The Tube
description: IT took the form of a selfhelp group. Participants united in firm solidarity to confront the problem, discuss its manifestations and devise means to combat it. A list of activities was compiled and carried by each individual at all times, so that when the urge struck, when the craving became too strong, there would be alternative things to do. Everyone agreed that only an exceptionally strongwilled person could have severed the addiction without the support and pressure of the group.

title: Bratils
description: PHILIPOlga. The Sisterhood of Temple Shaaray Tefila mourn the passing of Olga Philip, wife of our late beloved cantor Siegfried Philip, and active member of our sisterhood community.

title: Vice Adm. F. E. M. Whiting, 87, Dies
description: Vice Admiral F. E. M. Whiting, who retired in 1947 as commandant of r the Third Naval District, which is headquartered in New York, died yesterday in Rockledge, Fla., where he had moved from Manhattan a year ago. He was 87 years old.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: ACCORDING to George Gilder, a typical young black man of today is no longer an invisible man, as Ralph Ellison called him: Rather, he has become visible man. He is visible because he is in the news, his violence has attracted attention. More than any other American citizen now, he is starkly floodlit

title: I.C.C. Aide Out After Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Aformer Congressional relations officer at the Interstate Commerce Commission, who has been the subject of a Justice Department investigation, resigned today from the agency. Richard W. Kyle said he was resigning for personal reasons.

title: Bonn Reported Favoring Growth Plan
description: BONN, June 6  Authoritative Government sources said today that West Germany was ready to accept a package deal at the Western economic summit meeting here next month under which it would agree to promote faster economic growth at home if other coun- tries renounced protectionism and

title: TeenAgers
description: Teenagers use contraceptives much more effectively than is generally believed, but there is still a lot of room for improvement, according to a national survey.

title: President, Unveiling Water Policy, Seeks Strict Criteria for Projects
description: WASHINGTON, June 6  President Carter today unveiled a national water policy that would impose more restrictive criteria for determining which large Federal water and flood control projects should be built and in which order.

title: A Freud In Every Pot
description: BERKELEY, Calif.The power psybhotherapists and selfhelpers wield in American society is causing concern. When psychoanalysis origirally offered its explanation of emotional life, its use was limited to helping people with severe problems. Today, as we see in the film An. Unmiiried Woman, when a husband tells his wife he's unhappy, she seems uninterested and suggests he see a altiink. When he leaves her, she takes to thfa consulting room for crisis intervention and reevaluation of her priorities.

title: Theater: The Incognita,
description: ALTHOUGH Steven Braunstein's The Incognita, playing at the Gene Frankel Theater Friday through next Monday, consists of two acts and an epilogue, it is only half a play. That half presents a trio of interesting, enigmatic characters engaged in a triangular erotic duel. The rest of the evening, however, is all contrivance. Plot takes over from character, and although the twists and turns of the plot are mildly amusing, the play itself sputters to a halt. That hoary stage query How is your second act? is a question Mr. Braunstein might legitimately have asked of himself.

title: Mitsui Completes Deal for Cook Units
description: Mitsui & Company Inc., U.S.A. reported that it had completed the acquisition from Cook Industries Inc. of seven grain elevators. The elevators will be owned and operated by Gulf Coast Grain Inc., a newly established subsidiary of the Japanese company's American subsidiary. Gulf Coast's principal office will be in Memphis.

title: Urban Scholars Assert Decline in Cities
description: WASHINGTON. June 6A panel of urban scholars told a Congressional committee today that the loss of population being suffered by AM'riCa'S old cities was not necessarily bad and that the task of government should ;.e to eve Ur, p^onomic and social impact of decline rather than to fight it.

title: EXAMINER IS PRESSED BY CURARE DEFENSE
description: HACKNSACK, N.J., June 6The defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich sought in several today to discredit Dr. Michael M. Baden. New York City's acting Chief Medical Examininer who is one of the prosecution's key witnesses.

description: Topics Calls and Recalls

title: California Voters Approve a Plan To Cut Property Tax $7 Billion
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 6California voters today adopted an amendment to the State Constitution that will trim $7 billion off the amount of property tax revenue collected by the state. This reduction will radically affect local government finances

title: U.S. to See Art Stolen In Turkey
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)Six ancient marble sculptures, stolen from a Turkish warehouse and recovered by luck in this country, will go on display here. Thursday.

title: Black Caucus in Congress Attacks U.S. ColdWar
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Congressional Black Caucus protested today what it called the Carter Administration's coldwar oriented foreign policy in Africa.

description: June 7, 1978

title: Mariners Score on Error in 9th to Break Tie
description: SEATTLE, June 6Jhe Yankees lost their fourth straight game tonight, 43, to the Seattle Mariners on a ninth-inning run that resulted from the sort of inadequate defense that plagued them all evening.

title: Israel Asks U.N. to Shield Christians in Lebanon After Troop Pullout
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 6Israel is asking the United Nations for assurances that Christian enclaves in southern Lebanon will be protected after Israeli troops carry out their scheduled last stage of withdrawal on Tuesday.

title: Books, Exhibition and TV On Alexander the Great
description: Time Inc., in cooperation with the Greek Government, plans to produce a book, a traveling exhibition and six onehour television films about the life of Alexander the Great, the Mace- donian empire builder who spread Greek culture through the ancient world, a Time Inc. spokesman said yesterday. The Greek Government and Time Inc., will jointly finance the exhibition, the spokesman said, and Greek private investors are to put up money for the films.

title: Consumer Debt Up $3.7 Billion in April
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)American consumers increased their installment debts in April by the secondlargest amount in history, spending much of the money for cars, the Federal Reserve said today.

title: End Loss Streak at 5 Games on 82 Triumph
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers, a stunning 15 games behind their pace of a year ago, returned to the scene of the crime last night and for a change tolerated no nonsense from the New York Mets.

title: Power Failure Halts Game
description: MONTREAL, June 6 (AP)Tonight's game between the San Diego Padres and Montreal Expos at Olympic Stadium was suspended after a delay of l hour 9 minutes following a partial power failure. The game will be resumed at 6:05 P.M. tomorrow with one out in the bottom of the sixth and the Expos ahead by 20.

title: Price Raised 7% On Cobalt Steel
description: The Cyclops Corporation said yesterday that the pressure from higher cobalt prices had caused it to increase the price of hightemperature alloy steels by 7 percent.

title: Garret Hits No. 21 in Japan
description: TOKYO, June 6 (AP)Adrian Garrett hit his 21st homer of the season today as the Hiroshima Toyo Carp played 22 tie with the Yokohama Taiyo Whales. Masahiro Dio of the Kyoto Lions homered twice, including a fourthinning shot which market his 400th career home run.

description: To the Editor:

title: Companion of J. Paul Getty Gets $150,000 of Estate
description: LOS ANGELES, June 6 (AP)A woman who lived in England with J. Paul Getty. the billionaire, will receive $150.000 from the Getty estate for herself and her two children under an agreement approved today.

title: Connors Scores Again
description: LONDON, June 6 (AP)Jimmy Connors, playing in his first tournament since having been hospitalized recently with a blood disorder, and Stan Smith were among the winners today in the Kent grass tennis event at Beckenham.

title: Comsat Will File For Reduced Rates
description: The Communications Satellite Corporation said it would file with the Federal Communications Commission sharply reduced rates for international satellite communications services. The lower rates are in line witrh a settlement reached by Comsat and the agency to end a longterm dispute over just what are the proper rates.

title: Italy and Argentina Gain World Cup Second Round.
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 6 (AP)Argentina and Italy today became the first teams to reach the second round of the World Cup soccer tournament as each team scored its second victory.

title: Mother Dies as Children Flee Fire
description: WINOOSKI, Vt., June 6 (AP)Two small children escaped but their mother was killed in an apartment fire early this morning. The police identified the victim as Dianne Peck, 26 years old. They said that Mrs. Peck's two childrenAndrew, 7, and Julia, 5had escaped when the fire broke out at about 5 A M. The children were unable to awaken their mother in another room of their downstairs apartment, the police said.

title: Shell Pile, N.J., Longs for a Comeback of Its Oyster Industry
description: SHELL PILE, N.J.The wooden shacks are more reminiscent of William Faulkner's Mississippi than of Brendan Byrne's New Jerseymean little shacks built on hundreds of thousands of clam and oyster shells, shacks that contain no water, no toilets, no central heating, where crumbling walls are patched with rusted CocaCola signs, where rats soramble under floorboards and seagulls cry above the plastic bottles and moldering garbage that assault the reed grass.

Javits. Copies of the remarks by the Muyor and Mr. Moynihan were provided by their offices; the others were recorded by The Associated Press.

title: Byebye, O1 George
description: In the spring of 1963. when George Wallace was newly elected Governor of Alabama, and I was nine years old, rny fourth grade class took a field trip from Mobile to the state capital, Montgomery. When we filed into the executive office, Mr. Wallace loomed before us; rocking gently in his wingtip shoes and seersucker suit, peering down at us heroically.

description: WASHINGTON, June 6The legislation that New York City is seeking from Congress would provide for Federal insurancecalled guaranteesof up to $2 billion on 15year bonds that would be sold to the state and city pension funds,

title: ExDutchess County Executive Given 60 Days in Bribery Case
description: WHITE. PLAINS. June 6 (AP)A former Dutchess County Executive, Edward C. Seheuler, who recently pleaded guilty to a bribery charge, was sentenced today to 60 days in jail. He also was fined $4,000 and was put on five years probation.

title: Minneapolis Hotel Renamed, Croissants Same
description: The name has changed, but the croissants are the same. So said Morris G. Levy Jr., a Minneapolis hotel man, in announcing a change in the name of his L'hotel Sofitel to L'hotel de France. Mr. Levy should know about the croissants. On a trip to France some years ago, the trip that turned him on to things Gallic, he went to bakery school and learned how to make croissants, brioche and other glories of French bread.

Hammant Waghamarea was the third leader of the group to be detained since it was formed last month.

description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 6The tension surrounding the Ken NortonLarry Holmes World Boxing Council heavyweight title bout became physical today when Holmes, after disrupting Norton's training session, gave Norton a substantial shove.

description: LUBUMBASHI, Zaire, June 6 (AP)A first contingent of 350 French Foreign Legionnaires left here aboard United States Air Force jet aircraft today as planeloads of Moroccan forces continued to arrive to take their places.

title: Cubs Win Fifth in Row: Kingman Clouts Slam
description: CHICAGO, June 6 (AP)Dave Kingman's grandslam homer and a threerun double by Dave Roberts, a pitcher, powered the. Chicago CObs to their fifth victory in a row, 94, over the Houston As tro's today.

title: $1.5 Million Skiing Award Upheld by Vermont Court
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., June 6 (AP)The Vermont Supreme Court today upheld lower court decision in which a skier was awarded $1.5 million for injuries .hc received in a fall.

At 8 o'clock, a sightseeing vessel will leave the Circle Line Pier, 43d Street and 12th Avenue, carrying paying guests and entertainers of O'Lunney's third annual floating barn dance and picnic.

title: Pulitzer Fountain Cleaned Free
description: With a blast of steam an a spray of water, a crew of workmen yesterday gave the first top-to-bottom cleaning in more than tight years to the Pulitzer Fountain in front cf the Plaza Hotel. The services were the gift of a buildingmaintenance coinpany to the people of New York.

title: Inflation Compounding Problems Of State and City Governments
description: WASHINGTON, June 6In Des Moines, the municipal swimming pools close at 8 P.M. Until last year, they stayed open until 9 o'clock. Along the Des Moines riverfront, the city now cuts the grass twice a summer instead of once week.

description: The stockbuying surge by institutional investors halted abruptly yesterday afternoon when demand slackened sharply to trim gains in glamour issues and other sectors of the market. Volume on the New York Stock Exchange 51.97 million shareswas the fourth heaviest on record.

title: Associated Press

title: Garden Aids Drive For School Sports

Rizzuto said over the air on the next pitch, Sparky was walking off the mound. Munson turns to ask, Where was it? Now it's two and two.

title: Indians in Maine Ask U.S. For Help on Land Claims
description: AUGUSTA, Me., June 6 (AP)Maine's Indian tribes asked the Federal Government today to seek 350,000 acres and S300 million in damages for them from the state, but to hold off on suing private landowners.

description: The Belmont Ball, held last night, after a fiveyear hiatus, at Tavern on the Green in celebration of the Belmont Stakes Saturday, was pure class. But more than that, it was just plain horse sense.

description: President Carter's commencement address today to the graduating class of the United States Naval Academy. will be telecast live by ABCTV and its local stationoChannel 7.

title: Joy Manufacturing Closing French Unit
description: The Joy Manufacturing Company said it will close its Joy S. A. subsidiary in France. It makes and sells mining systems equipment designed for use in Frenchiron ore mines, equipment that has limited applications in other mar- kets. Sporadic volume from these limited markets have made the operation impractical, the company said.

title: Doing the Job for Jobs
description: In spite of the slight rise in the jobless rate for May, employment in the private sector continued to expand by another halfmillion jobs over April. The trend confirms the wisdom of President Carter's move to insure that the disadvantaged share in the growth by finding jobs in private industry. He has now put forth ;two plans  $400 million in training subsidies and $1.5 billion in tax creditsdesigned to spur the private hiring of young adults from lowincome families.

III. The Rev. Samuel Shoemaker Johnston, rector of Christ Episcopal Church in Detroit, performed the ceremony.

title: The Tea Sandwich: Themes, Variations
description: While to Northerners tea sandwiches may seem as dated an idea as dance programs and beribboned wrist corsages, in the South and, of course, in England, they are in as good repute as they ever were. Piled high on pretty. flowersprigged porcelain, garnished with curly cresss, set out on cloths of sheer embroidered organdy or linen, these enticing morsels are perfect adjuncts to real brewed tea. They should be substantial enough to stave off ravenous appetites until dinner but not so heavy that they will discourage the eating of that meal.

description: LONDON, June 6  One by one, the portents of an autumn general election in Britain are accumulating.

description: The police canvassed a Staten Island neighborhood yesterday in search of two teenagers who shot and killed a 64-yearold grocer on Monday after the grocer asked the youths to show proof that they were old enough to purchase beer.

description: WALLACE, Idaho, June 6  The Hecla Mining Company, which made its fortune in Idaho silver, is quickly losing it in Arizona copper.

title: I.R.S. Rule Said to Cut Oil Unit Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, June 6  A House subcommittee asserted today that American oil companies operating in petroleumproducing countries abroad had been spared $14 billion in taxes since 1950 because of allegedly improper rulings by the Internal Revenue Service at the insistence of the White House and the State Department.

title: Columbia to Press Banks
description: The trustees of Columbia University yesterday announced that Columbia would sell its stock and withdraw its deposits in banks that lend to the Government of South Africa unless the banks announce their intention to cease that lending. The trustees de- dined, however, to commit tnemseives unequivocally to selling Columbia's investment holdings in any company that has operations in South Africa.

title: Brown Sees a Soviet Naval Threat
description: CHICAGO, June 6Defense Secretary Harold Brown said today that a Soviet bomber known in the West as Backfire posed a potential threat to United States naval forces, and he made it plain that the Soviet Union was seeking to challenge traditional American naval missions.

title: Technology

One senior United States Navy official called it a way to remake the informationhandling industry.

description: BOSTON. June 7 (AP)Cigarettes caused threequarters of the heart attacks suffered by a group of otherwise healthy women under 50. researchers say. They warn that such attacks are likely to increase as more teenage girls take up smoking.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7A Congressional relations officer who resigned from the Interstate Commerce Commission on Monday withdrew his resignation today, saying that the commission had violated the terms of his resignation agreement by telling reporters that he would have been dismissed if he had not resigned.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Carter Administration today proposed revisions in the preparation and use of the mandatory statements that attempt to predict the effect of Government actions on the environment.

title: Down With Taxes and What Else?
description: The message of assorted voters on Tuesday was that Americans wounded by inflation and worried about another recession blame government and high taxes for much of their woe. They struck back in California by voting for an enormous cut in the property tax and clamping new restrictions on the state's taxing power. They struck back in Ohio by rejecting new school taxes in several cities. And they struck back in New Jersey by nominating for the Senate a young Republican conservative whose main campaign pledge is to work for huge cuts in the Federal income tax.

title: Economic Scene

description: By DONAL HENAHAN

title: Philadelphia Study Due June 16
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 (AP)The city has been told to disclose by June 16 the results of a twoyear study done to determine if women can make the grade as fullfledged police officers. Federal District Judge Charles R. Weiner, who has been overseeing various sex discrimination suits against the city police department, issued the order yesterday. The study is not complete, but the results will be produced, Stephen T. Saltz, the Assistant City Solicitor, said.

Kenyon & Eckhardt, McCaffrey & McCall and Hicks & Greist, has moved into Anesh, Viseltear Inc.

title: Assembly Approves Bill Requiring A ReliefSocial Security Matchup
description: ALBANY, June 7The Assembly today approved a bill requiring that the state's welfare rolls be matched against Social Security records. Its proponents say would cut down on welfare fraud, saving taxpayers up to $100 million a year.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7Mayer Koch came under attack from the city's chief critic in the House of Representatives toniqht as debate there began on the S2 billion loan assistance bill for New York City.

Now, after eight years there and 24 in the United States Senate, he has suffered an unexpected defeat. But. his career should not end without recognition of his independent mind and public service.

description: PARIS, June 7 (AP)Guillermo Vilas of Argentina survived a challenge today from Chile's Hans Gildemeister, 64, 26, 61, 36, 63, and moved into the semifinals of the $400,000 French open tennis championships.

description: The Republic of China on Taiwan, increasingly concerned over mainland China's drive to improve its military capabilities, is modernizing its air force and bolstering its navy.

description: The Sonesta International Hotels Corporation announced it had begun its previously announced tender offer of $8.25 a share for its common stock. The offer expires June 27 and is for 1.8 million of the company's 2.3 common shares outstanding.

description: DENVER. June 7President Carter seems to have managed the difficult feat of shaping a national water policy that does not infuriate anyone in the West. The reactions of several Western Governors could even he categorized as mildly Pleased. with reservations,

description: The Bally Manufacturing Corporation, a maker of gaming and pinball machines, announced it had been granted a patent on its electronic flipper pinball machine utilizing a microprocessor. Thomas Cornwell Pyle, 27 years old, was held in the Chester County Prison Farms in lieu of $52,500 bail, the police said. He faces a preliminary hearing on June 16.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7Today could have been a day off for Senator Clifford P. Case, Who suffered his first election defeat yesterday since entering politicsin 1937. But after all these years he didn't break stride.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)The House, after a heated debate that occasionally broke into shouting matches, voted today, 314 to 80, to block proposed Federal regulations to make it easier to trace firearms sales.

title: The Court And The Press
description: WASHINGTON, June 7When the Supreme Court last week upheld the right of the police to make a surprise search of The Stanford Daily, newspapers were alarmed. Editors called the decision disastrous and just plain awful. A lawyer charged the Court with a naive refusal to recognize the importance of the press in this country.

title: Jazz: Marlena Shaw Sings
description: IF jazz could be called a grownup version of funk, then Marlena Shaw is a sort of sophisticated, upwardly mobile Millie Jackson. What that means is that both are singers much concerned with what it means to be a black woman, bath spend an inordinate amount of time in quasiconversational, ostensibly spontaneous but clearly preplanned raps with the audience about that subject, and when they finally do get around to singing, they do it so well you wish they'd done it all along.

title: POLL EXAMINES VIEWS ON U.S. HEALTH COSTS
description: A sizable majority of Americans sampled in a recent nationwide poll say that they would be willing to pay more for better health care but that recent increases in fees of doctors and hospitals were not buying such improvements.

title: The Kennedys (Well, Some of Them) Boost a Benefit
description: JEAN KENNEDY SMITH was disappointed, but, like a true member of the clan; she carried on. She'd expected an almost full turnout of Kennedys for a cause dear to their hearts: helping the handicapped. But one by one, members of the family dropped out. Eunice Shriver hadn't been well. Jacqueline Onassis

description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Lloyd's Electronics Inc. accused the president of one of its affiliates today of having falsified $1.1 million in sales by creating shipping documents for merchandise that was never shipped.

description: LAS VEGAS. Nev., June 7 (AP)The trial to determine whether Howard R. Hughes wrote the socalled Mormon Will went to the jury late tolay, exactly seven months after the trial began.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS

Some of its material fits into the stereotype of the Southern rock band, and when Barry Burton, its lead guitarist, launches into one of his solos, it's hard to put the Allman Brothers Band out of mind.

description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 7Virtually every city, county and school district in California was ordering emergency budget cutbacks today while a legal assault was being opened on Proposition 13, the voter initiative passed yesterday that will slash property tax revenues by 60 percent beginning July 1.

description: Film

title: IC Aim: To Get Farther Away From Rails
description: When IC Industries announced on Monday that it had made a bid for Pet Inc., the food company, it was only con tinuing to do what it and many former railroad companies have long been doing  getting farther away from the unprofitable rail business.

title: Tutwiler Takes U.S. Seniors
description: RYE. N.Y., June 7By shooting a final round of 67 today, nine over his age and five under par, Ed Tutwiler of Indianapolis captured the United States Seniors Golf Association championship by four strokes. His total of 141 for the 36hole tournament missed tying the tourney record by a stroke.

title: The Champ and the Copycat
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev.. June 7Muhammad Ali is nowhere to be seen here, or even heard. But in absentia he has somehow scripted the strange plot for Friday night's fight between Ken Norton and Larry Holmes for the World Boxing Council's heavyweight championship. Just as Ken Norton is trying to act like a champion, Larry Holmes is trying to act like Muhammad Ali but neither is succeeding. Each is a stranger to his role. Ken Norton has never had a title before. Larry Holmes has neN er had a staze before. When the bell rings,

Michael Blumenthal before the Senate Banking Committee. The remarks by Mr. Carey and Mr. Rohatyn were transcribed by The New York Times and Mr. Blumenthal's by The Associated Press.

title: 4 Killed in Landslide. On Island OH Naples
description: NAPLES, June 7 (Reuters)Four tourists were killed in a landslide at one of the most popular holiday beaches on the island of Ischia In the Bay of Naples today, according to the police. Two men and two women died and there were fears that others had been buried.

title: Trouble in Fishing Waters
description: The United States and Canada boast that they have the world's longest peaceful and undefended border. But the watery extensions of that border are now being guarded by both sides against intrusion by the other's fishing vessels. It is the least necessary confrontation of the year.

title: Soviet Discloses Arrests In Moscow Subway Blast That Killed 4 Persons
description: MOSCOW, June 7 (Reuters)The Soviet security police have arrested several people on charges of causing an explosion on a Moscow subway  train early last year, the Tass press agency reported today.

title: Illinois Rejects Rights Amendment; Adoption by Deadline in Jeopardy
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., June 7The Illinois House of Representatives today rejected the proposed Federal equal rights amendment, seriously jeopardizing its chances of adoption nationally before the March 1979 deadline.

title: CZECH WRITERS FEAR ANOTHER CRACKDOWN
description: PRAGUE, June 7Twenty of Czechoslovakia's leading writers, poets and dramatists said in a letter today that the Czechoslovak Government had repudiated a tacit understanding that had long allowed the underground reproduction of literary works that do not challenge the Communist system

title: Bridge:
description: ST. LAWRENCE, Barbados, June 7The first major event of the Central American and Caribbean zonal championships ended here last night with a victory for a Venezuelan pair.

description: PRYOR, Okla., June 7A preliminary hearing opened here today in the cast of Gene Leroy Hart, a 34-year-old Cherokee Indian who is accused of murdering three young Girl Scouts at a nearby summer camp last year.

title: Chilean Bishops Ask End to Protest
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 7 (Reuters)Chile's Roman Catholic bishops have called on more than 100 relatives of missing people to call off al 17-day-old hunger strike after receiving a Government promise to look into the disappearances. The hunger strikers have occupied churches in Santiago and have provoked sympathy strikes in other capitals, including Buenos Aires.

title: WALLACE IS WEIGHING RACE FOR SENATOR ALLEN'S POST
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 7 (AP)An aide to Gov. George C. Wallace said today that the Governor was considering a race to fill the unexpired term of the late United States Senator James B. Allen.

description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 7 (Reuters)Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi appointed Gen. Nasser Moghadam today to be the head of Savak, Iran's security organization, which is reputed to be one of the world's toughest and most efficient internal security forces.

title: GARDENING
description: COAXING the lawn mower into sputtering action, to begin a season's assault on the lawn, contemplated, as I usually do about this time of year, alternative ground covers. I like lawns. I even like mowing them once the smell of gasoline whiffs away, leaving the fragrance of newmown hay. But there are rather short limits to my indulgence and so ours is acceptably green for most of the season, but far from manicured.

description: TRENTON, June 7The surprising defealt. of Senator Clifford P. Case in yesterday's Republican party primary stemmed from- the militancy of the conservative wing of the party, Mr. Case's overconfidence and his age.

title: Brown &
description: The Tennessee Valley Authority said it had awarded a $25.6million contract to Brown & Root Development Inc. of Houston for coal gasification and purification facilities to produce ammonia from coal for ultimate use by the nation's fertilizer industry.

description: CAIRO, June 7 (AP)President Anwar elSadat said today that foreign correspondents who write something wrong about Egypt would be expelled from the country.

description: TOKYO, June 7 (AP)  Japanese trading companies expect their exports to rise 0.6 percent and their imports to drop 4.9 percent this year, the Japanese Economic Planning Agency said today.

title: Prank Draft Notices Received; HUNTINGTON, W. Va., June 7 (AP)Dozens of Huntingtonarea high school seniors have received draft notices, but an Army spokesman, Will Drier, said was just a malicious prank. He noted that the draft had ended four years ago and suggested that recipients toss the notices into their trash cans.

title: Ridgway's Agrees To Sell to Hillman
description: Ridgway's Inc. said it had agreed in principle to sell its assets to an affiliate of the Hillman Company of Pittsburgh for about $11.5 million.

title: Japan Urges a Disarmament Day

The idea was first broached by Foreign Minister Sunao Sonoda in an address on May 30 to the special session of the General Assembly on disarmament.

description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission today approved railroad freight rate increases averaging 3.7 percent nationwide. But it rejected an industry request for a 7 percent increase on coal shipments to electric utility companies.
