title: Judge Who Removed Rival's Signs Ousted
description: OCEANSIDE, Calif., June 7 (AP)Municipal Judge Stuart C. Wilson was turned out of office by voters after conceding that he had removed some of his opponent's campaign signs, incomplete election returns showed today.

title: Bank Lance Headed Is Making Recovery
description: ATLANTA, June 7  The National Bank of Georgia is recovering from significant financial losses and the disruption caused by intense scrutiny into the banking practices of its former president, Bert Lance, the bank's shareholders were told today at their annual meeting here.

title: Notes on People
description: THE third annual Louis Dembitz Brandeis Medal for distinguished legal services was presented last night to Edward M. Levi, who served as Attorney General in the Ford Administration. The award was presented by Brandeis University at a dinner at the Plaza Hotel in New York. Mr. Levi, who served as Attorney General after the Watergate scandal, is the third Brandeis Medal winner whose career was touched significantly by Watergate. The first two winners were Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, and Elliot L. Richardson, the Attorney General who was forced to resign by President Nixon at the height of the Watergate crisis. Mr. Levi, who had been teaching law at Stanford University in California, recently returned to the University of Chicago, where he is president emeritus.

title: 129.5% Raise Is Sought by Firemen As Union Resumes Contract Talks
description: The Uniform Firefighters Association demanded a 29.5 percent raise yesterday $5,140 a man in one yearas it resumed contract negotiations with New Yprk City.

title: Big Banks
description: According to the ads, the lines will be shorter at Chemical Bank because the branch manager will speed you on your way. Before you even reach the teller. they suggest, he will have approved your check or taken your deposit.

title: Ohio Voters Defeat Many Tax Increases for the Schools
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 7Public education:the whipping child of taxpayers and opponents of school desegregation in Ohio, took another severe beating yesterday, with more than half the 200 community taxincrease requests on ballots across the state being rejected by voters.

title: South African Trial in Isolated Village Points Up Ineptitude of Black NatiOri:alits Efforts
description: BETHAL, South AfricaThe chief prosecutor calls it a onehorse town, and the judge, lodged with his black cook and steward in a special railway car, scours the municipal library for books to kill the time. The defense lawyers spend long evenings watching television, and chuckle about the occasion when one of them went waterskiing with the judge at a local dam.

title: Bullets Defeat Sonics by 10599 for NB.A. Title
description: SEATTLE, June 7Experience, poise, strength and the timely bounce tilted the final decision to the Washington Bullets tonight as they won the National Basketball Association championship series by beating the Seattle SuperSonics, 10599. The seventhgame triumph ended the longest season of the league's 32year history.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: EAST SIDE INTERLUDES This month on Wednesday and Thursday nights from 7 to 8:30, you can enjoy cocktails or a light meal in the Garden Restaurant of the Whitney Museum, Madison Avenue at 75th Street, while listening to the Mozart on Fifth Trio in the adjacent sculpture court. Museum admission is $1.50, and free for students and the elderly.

title: Aspin Asks Inquiry on Spending in His Own Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Representative, Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, has asked the Justice Department and the Federal Bureau of Investigation to investigate what he described as questionable expenditures of money from his campaign fund.

title: Backgammon:
description: ButtoningUp to Win, But Forgo Overbuilding

title: Accounts
description: Metropolitan Transportation Authority to Herman & Rosner Enterprises Inc.

title: Soviet Calls Attitude Of Carter
description: MOSCOW, June 7The Soviet Union called President Carter's speech on SovietAmerican relations today strange, to say the least and accused the United States of vacillating between cold war and &tente.

title: Black Africans Sharply Split Over Joint Peace Force
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 7The responses of black African nations to Western suggestions and support for a continental peacekeeping force have ranged from indignant accusations of neocolonial designs to outright approval.

title: Unseld Sinks Free Throw When It Counted the Most
description: SEATTLE, June 7When the foul shot went in, Wes Unseld exhaled, his lips puffing. He had missed three consecutive foul shots in the final minute but when this one went in, the Washingon Bullets had a 3point lead with 12 seconds remaining and they would win. 10599, for the National Basketball Association championship.

title: Deliverers Union Head Retires
description: Newspaper executives and union leaders of now and long ago125 of themgathered at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street, last night to honor Joseph Baer, former president of the Newspaper and Mail Deliverers Union of New York City and Vicinity, who was retiring at the age of 65 as executive director of the union's pension and welfare funds.

title: J. Sherman Porter, Former Director Of Moody's Investors Service, at 86
description: J. Sherman Porter, who retired in 1961 as a vice president and director of Moody's Investors Service in New York, died Monday in the Bridgeport (Conn.) Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at 128 Thornhill Road, Fairfield, Conn.

title: Austria Advances in Cup Soccer
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 7Austria qualified for the World Cup soccer tournament quarterfinals today by defeating Sweden, 10, and Brazil kept alive its hopes of advancing with scoreless tie against Spain.

title: THE U.N. TODAY
description: Tune 8, 1978

title: Bradley Won't Disclose His Strategy Against Bell
description: UNION, N J., June 7Amid a daylong flurry of telephone calls congratulating him on his victory in yesterday's Democratic primary for the Senate. Bill Bradley declined to say today how he would tailor his campaign to meet the conservative thrust of Jeffrey K. Bell. his Republican opponent, in the fall campaign.

title: QThe painted wood window frames  on our three-year-old house are rotting. The vertical pieces rot from the sill up and from the inside out, and then the sills start rotting. This has happened only on the southwest side of the house, on four of the seven windows there. The builder has offered to replace the vertical pieces, but not the sills  he says it is too complicated. What are the possible causes of this, and how can the rotting be prevented or arrested?  J.E.G., Moorestown, N.J.
description: ASince they are rotting from the in side out, it sounds to

title: Letters
description: A Ghost Not Banished

title: Hot Weather and Awnings Unfold See Awnings are not only attractive, but can save on energy bills
description: The New York Times/Al Wegener

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, JUNE 8, 1978

title: Illinois Rejects Rights Amendment; Adoption by Deadline in Jeopardy
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., June 7The Illinois House of Representatives today rejected the proposed Federal equal rights amendment, seriously jeopardizing its chances of adoption nationally before the March 1979 deadline.

title: Federal Safety Aide Says Public Won't Accept Law on Safety Belts
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The public and Congress will not stand for a national law requiring the use of seat belts despite the fact that it could save thousands of lives, Joan Claybrook, the Federal highway safety director, says.

title: Koch Sets Gracie Mansion Style, And the Main Theme Is Frugality
description: The green-and-white-striped wallpaper still hangs in the kitchen, the pinkflowered sofa still sits in the den, and although it has a coat of fresh paint Gracie Mansion looks much the same as when the Beanies lived there.

title: UPSET BY CARTER, MAYORS INVITE KENNEDY TO SPEAK
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)The nation's bigcity mayors, feeling rebuffed by President Carter, have chosen Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, as the major speaker at their annual meeting in Atlanta later this month. In doing so, the mayors hope to put political heat on the White House.

title: Rating Raised On Con Edison
description: Standard & Poor's raised its ratings yesterday on Consolidated Edison Company's bonds and preferred stock, citing what it termed the improved financial position of the big utility.

title: BUDGET CUTS BEGUN AFTER CALIFORNIANS VOTE TO CURB TAXES
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 7Virtually every city, county and school district in California was ordering emergency budget cutbacks today while a legal assault was being opened on Proposition 13, the voter initiative passed yesterday that will slash property tax revenues by 60 percent beginning July 1.

title: World News Briefs
description: JERUSALEM, June 7 (Reuters)Israel's ultranationalist Gush Emunim movement demanded today the confiscation of Arab land to make way for Jews to settle on the West Bank of the Jordan River.

title: Shapiro Links Essex County Victory to Hard Work
description: NEWARK, June 7Assemblyman Peter Shapiro today attributed his victory in the Democratic primary yesterday for Essex County Executive to hard work by hundreds of volunteers who manned telephones to bring out voters in suburban communities and to inroads made by Freeholder Donald M. Payne in urban areas where Sheriff John F. Cryan had expected stronger support.

title: A White Oasis Shimmers In the City
description: NO, those pristine white rugs don't quite tell the whole story. But right away you get the idea. Think of it. In New York City, with all the soot, the grease, the grime  a brownstone is carpeted in snowy white. Sheer defiance.

title: Soviet Calls Attitude Of Carter
description: MOSCOW, June 7The Soviet Union called President Carter's speech on SovietAmerican relations today strange, to say the least and accused the United States of vacillating between cold war and dtente.

title: Health Agency Cites 8 Food Places That Violate New York City's Code
description: The New York City Health Department yesterday cited eight.food places that had violated the Health Code, five that had corrected earlier violations and two that were closed for failing to correct earlier violations. The places were listed as follows.

title: Goldin Announces Candidacy for State Comptroller
description: Surrounded by his familyhis sons, Daniel, 7, end Matthew, 5, scuffing their sandals on the floor, his wife, Diana, cradling two-week-old Jonathan in her arms -:-j-larrison J. Goldin, the New York City Gdmptroller, announced yesterday for the Democratic nomination for State Comptroller.

title: Macchiarola Said to Be Planning Wide Shakeup at Education Board
description: Frank J. Macchiarola, the incoming New York City School Chancellor, reportedly plans a major shakeup at the Board of Education, including the possibility of abolishing the post of deputy chancellor, discharging some top officials and reassigning others and placing a number of executives on what amounts to probation.

title: Goodyear to Expand
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company said it would build an international research center at the company's industrial and film products plant in Craigavon, Northern Ireland, for about $5 million. The center is to concentrate on such products as conveyor and power transmission belting, hose and packaging film, to be marketed abroad by the Goodyear International Corporation, a subsidiary.

title: ANZUS Talks Open in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (Reuters)Australia, New Zealand and the United States opened consultations here today in their ANZUS defense alliance to review United States and Soviet military activities in the Pacific and Indian oceans and related issues.

title: HERRIN DESCRIBES BLUDGEONING WOMAN
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 7.  Richard James Herrin sobbingly told a jury with meticulous detail today how he tried to kill his former girlfriend as she slept in her Scarsdale home and how he then fled, consumed by thoughts of taking his own life

title: CITIBANK Big Investment in Automation
description: Citicorp has undertaken the boldest strategy of the New York banks  and probably of any United States bank. And in the process, it says it can double its share of the market  to 8 percent from 4 percent  of the loans and deposits of commercial banks, savings banks and savings and loan associations in the New York area.

title: 3CARTER DROPS FIGHT ON A V.A. HOSPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)--The Carter Administration is dropping its opposition to a proposed $75.3 million Veterans Administration hospital planned for Camden, N.J.

title: Generals of a Rebellion by California Taxpayers
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7Howard A. Jarvis arid Paul Gann, the odd couple who fathered Proposition 13, are alike only in their belief that taxpayers can no lcinger afford a benevolent government.

title: Loan Hearings Refer To Ghosts of History
description: WASHINGTON, June 7During the two days of Senate hearings on New York City loan legislation, Senator Patrick Moynihan frequently peppered his remarks with historical allusions, and at one point today he called Hugh Carey, who was testifying, the finest Governor we have had in New York since Al Smith.

title: EGYPTIAN JUDGE OVERTURNS SEIZURE OF LEFTIST PAPER
description: CAIRO, June 7An Egyptian judge today overturned the Government order that resulted in confiscation of the latest issue of the leftist party newspaper, Al Ahaly, which has become a primary tar get of President Anwar elSadat's drive to silence his critics.

title: SENATE REFUSES TO HALT FILIBUSTER ON LABOR BILL
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)The Senate refused today to cut off an 11day filibuster against revising Federal labor laws.

title: ETHIOPIA OFFERS AMNESTY TO ERITREAN GUERRILLAS
description: LONDON, June 7 (Reuters)The Ethiopian head of state, Col. Mengistu Haile Mariam, offered a full amnesty today to Eritrean secessionist guerrillas who surrender to the Ethiopian Government.

title: Like Everything Else, Dog Fees Rise, Too
description: ALBANY, June 7 (AP)  Governor Carey has signed into law a broad revision cf the state's dog licensing laws that increases licensing fees.

title: Dr. J. Sherwood Weber, Ex.Provost And Head of Faculty at Pratt, 59
description: Dr. J. Sherwood Weber, former provost, of Pratt Institute, died Tuesday at the Cabrini Health Care Center at the age of 59. He lived at 2 West 67th Street in Manhattan and also maintaitted t reddence in Crag moor. N.Y.

title: Ballet: A Square Dance
description: THE New York City Ballet's Square Dance is an abstraction of an abstraction that nevertheless comments on reality.

title: Film: Jorge Semprun's 'Woman at Her Window':Angles of Love
description: THE place is Greece and the year is 1936. We see three people photographed on a cliff against a magnificent panorama of arid mountains. The air is so clear it seems to have been dry-cleaned. Margot (Romy Schneider) is beautiful and dreamily serene, like someone who's been smoking marijuana. Raoul (Philippe Noiret) is shaped like a bowling pin and ill-tempered, but he's impeccably dressed. Michel (Victor Lanoux) is handsome, self-assured and patronizing in the manner of a man with a higher calling.Though they stand far enough apart to be playing catch, they talk about history, politics and literature as earnestly as three people huddled around a tiny cafe table.Michel is a Greek Communist on the run from his country's new Fascist Government. Raoul, a French capitalist??? is in love with Margot, and Margot, who is married to Rico (not in this scene), an Italian diplomat, is in the process of falling in love with Michel.Thus starts "A Woman at Her Window," a French political melodrama with heavily romantic overtones written by Jorge Semprun??? the Spanish-born French writer who has done much, much better things ("La Guerre Est Finie," "Z," "State of Siege"), and directed by Pierre Granier-Deferre, who has done one somewhat better thing that I know of (Georges Simenon's "The Cat").The film, which opens today at the Festival Theater, is a muddle of big ideas??? mysticism and cinematic posing. It's the story of how Margotrich and so completely wrinkle-free it's ???erie  is redeemed from her life of idleness by a chance meeting wi??? Michel, who climbs into her first-floor Athens window one night when fleeing the police (hence tha poetic title).Margot's husband, Rico (Umberto Orsini), is a perfectly nice??? attractive fellow. He has a sense of humor. He's kind. He cares about her, but for reasons never explained adequately??? theirs is a marriage in what once used to be termed "name only." They are good friends but he has his mistresses and she's kept busy being the toast of Athens.As you might guess, the time in which the film is set is important. The old European order is collapsing into two opposing camps on the eve of first the Spanish Civil War and then World War II. Margot's redemptionher love for the Communist organizer and, through him, commitment to the radical Leftis, I suspect, supposed to tell us something about the inexorable movement of civilizations, about history.Mostly??? though??? it tells us how easily a bored woman can be swept off her feet even when the language of love is hack work. Surveying the ruins of an ancient temple, Michel says, "We build for men, not go???s," and Margot goes absolutely limp. When Margot has the temerity to wonder aloud why she loves him. Michel answers in complete confidence. "There's something in me greater than myself.""A Woman at Her Window" jumps around in time for no apparent reason other than to simulate the building of suspense. Part of the film has to do with the faithful Raoul and Ri???'s helping Margot to get Michel safely out of Greece, but there also we jumps forward to 1945 and then to 1967, when Miss Schneider turns up as her own daughter.Even with all of this hopping around the most interesting things in Mr. Semprun's screenplay inevitably happen o???f-screen. It's left to messengers of one sort and another to tell us exactly how Michel escaped, how Margot eventually joined him, how they became very important in resistance movements, and how Rico at last sickened of working for Musso???ni and sought exile in France.There's a lot of pretty Greek scene??? in "A Woman at Her Window" but so little action it could have been a stage piece. As l've already indicated??? ???the talk, at least as rendered by the subtitles, is not great, especially when Margot, early in their relationship, comes on to Michel saying in a manner meant to be inviting, "You wanted to know . . . the taste of my mouth?"Miss Schneider is incapable of registering any emotion except pleasure in her own beauty. Mr. Lanoux also gives the impression of intense??? self-absorption. Only Mr. Orsini and Mr. Noiret seem real, but the movie is interested in them only as props necessary to th??? great romance that is the film's ??? low center.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York Stock Exchange issued yesterday its latest report of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the Big Board.

title: Fox AssailsChrisCraft; Sees a Plot
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation charged yesterday that ChrisCraft Industries had embarked on a move to take over the motion picture Company.

title: Business People
description: Frank Price, who abruptly resigned as president of Universal Television last week, yesterday resigned also as a vice president and a director of MCA Inc., Universal's parent company. While it could not be confirmed, television and film industry sources in California said there was a chance that Mr. Price might move to Columbia Pictures as head of production. That post became vacant when Dan Melnick moved up to the presidency of Columbia. Mr. Price was known to be interested in moving from television production to movies.

title: New Publisher For Sport Magazine
description: Charter Publishing announced yesterday that Don Hanrahan, publisher of Sport magazine, had been replaced by Thomas A. Wolf, 34 years old, who is joining the company after 11 years at Triangle Publications where most recently he was assistant to the general manager of the gravure division.

title: Deaths
description: AK ELSaid Joseph on June 6, 1978 Beloved husband of Violet (nee Zirkel. Dear brother of Farid, Elias Assad, & Mae Goraveb. Funeral Sa turday, 9:30am, from the McLaugh Ina & Sons Colonial Home, Thirc Avenue at 97 Street, Brooklyn. Requ iem Mass, loam, Our Lady of Leban on Church. interment Calvary Ce meter/. Visiting 3.5pin, 7.90m, Thursday& Friday.

title: Questioning of Talmadge on Gifts Postponed by Senate Ethics Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 7. ?? chout explanation, the Senate Ethics committee staff has indefinitely postponed questioning Senator Herman E. Talmadge about his practice of accepting small cash gifts from constituents.

title: Market Lower as Volume Drops
description: Stock prices beat an orderly retreat on sharply lower trading volume yesterday following their spirited, postMemorial Day rally. Most changes were confined to fractions, indicating a rest period for a market that earlier . this week had displayed strength in a wide variety of 2rouns.

title: Advertising
description: THE split between Standard Brands and Ted Bates & Company around the first of the year  involving about $24 million in billings  is almost a classic case of loss of communication followed by loss of business.

title: BELL SAYS VICTORY IS BRINGING SUPPORT
description: TRENTON, June 7Jeffrey K. Bell said today that Republicans in the nation were flocking to his support after his upset victory yesterday over Senator Clifford P. Case in New Jersey's Senate Republican primary and that he exacted his platform of extensive Federal tax cuts to catch on nationally.

title: An adjustable canvas awning, above, designed by Denning and Fourcade, has side panels useful for screening out low western and eastern light.
description: Stationary, metal awnings, above, can be attractive. These are low enough to screen out the sun without completely blocking it.

title: U.N. LABOR SESSION OPENS WITH BID TO U.S. TO REJOIN
description: GENEVA, June 7--The International Labor Organization began its annual session here today amid calls for the United :States to rejoin the United Nations agency.

title: Liquor by the Drink Rejected in Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N.C., June 7The North Carolina House of Representatives today rejected a measure to allow the sale of liquor by the drink on a localoption basis.

title: Talks Fail On Tax. Cut
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Democratic members of the House Ways and Means Committee met for two hours today but could not reach agreement on a compromise taxcut bill.

title: FederalMogul And SKF to Appeal
description: A Federal Trade Commission official's ruling that a supply agreement between the FederalMogul Corporation . and SKF Industries violated Federal antitrust laws will be appealed, the two companies said.

title: Miss Keatonini Vew Filrri
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7Diane Keaton will star as the 30-year-old spinster of Mary Gordon's novel Final Payments for the Orion Pictures Company. Following Final Payments, she will play a woman whose work, marriap.e and friendships have turned into disasters in A movie version of Kit Reed's novel Captain Grownup.

title: Ontario Asks Oil Export End
description: OTTAWA, June 7 (AP)  The Ontario Government said today that Canada should continue phasing out oil exports and limiting natural gas exports to the United States.

title: Curare Case Autopsies Questioned
description: HACKENSACK, NJ., June 7In its second day of intense crossexamination, the defense the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich sought to shake the contention of Now York City's Acting Chief Medical Examiner that there had been no reasonable explanation of the deaths of Dr. Jascalevich's alleged victims when they were buried a decade ago.

title: Music by Miss Currier
description: OF THE five works by Marilyn Kind Currier played in Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night, the two latest were most perfectly realized. That was an encouraging sign for a composer who had a lot to say in the earlier pieces but did so in a restless, inconsistent manner.

title: Chinese Aide Assures Zaire of Help Against Soviet
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, June 7 (UPI)---Forcign Minister Huang Hua of China left here for Brussels tonight alter promising that Zaire could ccunt on Peking for support against Soviet imperialism.

title: Parents Encounter TeenAge Sex
description: SEVERAL dozen parents gathered in an East Side women's center the other night to talk about a subject that still causes many of them to become angry, confused, embarrassed and tonguetied: Teenage sex.

title: 3 Hurt in Explosion at Refinery
description: TRAINER. Pa., June 7 (AP)At least three persons were injured tonight in an explosion and fire of undetermined origin at a catalytic converting unit at a British Petroleum Corporation Refinery on the Delaware River here. A tower on the unit was ripped open by the blast and was shooting flames sporadically, said Harry Beck JrJ. of the Trainer Fire Company,

title: NEW &
description: Sleek Comfort Mario Bellini has achieved an innovation in design with his Cab chair, a framework of tubular steel onto which is slipped a onepiece covering of belt leatherupholstery and slipcover in one. The process is simple and so is the effect. The chair has a sleek, squaredoff back and straight legs. Although it has no armrests, it can be much more comfortable than the usual dining chair because it provides support to the lower back a feature appreciated by anyone who enjoys lingering over dinner. The Cab chair is made in Italy by Cassina and comes in black, red or natural leather. It is available through architects and decorators from Atelier International, 595 Madison Avenue, for $490.

description: TELM SION is nothing if not unpredictable. Just as David Frost's new Headliners series on NBC looks certain to cop this year's Citation for Most Po:ntless Program, along comes ABC's 20/20 and all bets are off. In addition to being pointless, the new ABC News Magazine is dizzyingly absurd:

title: Moliere Farces Staged by Serban
description: OVER the years Robert Brustein's Yale Repertory Theater has been sending talented writers, actors and designers into the New York theater. Occasionally a play that began on the Repertory stage or in a Yale classroom has come to New York in some other form. But Sganarelle, Andrei Serban's quartet of oneact Moliere farces, which opened last night at Joseph Papp's Public Theater, is the first Yalesponsored venture in our city. It is an animated, colorful evening of supremely stylized comedy. To borrow a line from one of the plays, Here's the original in high relief.

title: CAREY, BLUMENTHAL JOIN IN PRESSING U.S. FOR LENGTHY CITY AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Governor Carey and Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal appealed today to the Senate Banking Committee to endorse longterm Federal assistance to New York City, warning thit without it the city would be back to Congress repeatedly to meet its money needs.

description: HACKENSACK, June 7in its second day of intense crossexamination, the defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich sought to shake the contention of New York City's Acting Chief Medical Examiner that there had been no reasonable explanation of the deaths of Dr. Jascalevich's alleged victims when they were buried a decade ago.

title: Marschalk May Get Goldin's Campaign
description: It has not been officially announced, but it looks like Marschalk is the agency for Harrison J. Goldin's run for State Comptroller. They helped make him City Comptroller, so why not?

title: Cyprus Offers G.E. Stock
description: The Cyprus Mines Corporation said that it had advised the General Electric Company that it intended to distribute 250,000 shares of G.E. common stock to its shareholders on a proportional basis in four quarterly dividends beginning in August. Cyprus beneficially owns total of 983,786 shares of G.E. common stock.

title: Hers
description: I JUST opened an envelope in the mail to find mimeographed sheet smelling like a school test and announcing the 20th year high school reunion. No Host Cocktail Party. Buffet Dinner. Family Picnic. Dancing. In August. Class of 58. Edison High. Stockton. The lurches in my stomach feel like doubt about the strength to stay grown up.

title: Thompson Scores With Effie Awards
description: It was nice for Burt Manning, vice chairman of J. Walter Thompson, to be luncheon speaker at the annual Effie awards luncheon yesterday. His aeencv was the bie winner.

title: Political Aides Lent a Hand for Foreign Policy Talk
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The President's political as well as foreign policy advisers helped draft his restatement of his policy toward the Soviet Union today with an eye, White House aides said, on the domestic as well as the foreign audience.

title: Tradition Still Thrives at a Changed West Point
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., June 7The Army Chief Staff, Gen. Bernard W. Rogers, told the United States Military Academy's largest graduating class today turn from the turbulent times of the recent past, an allusion to West Point's 1976 cheating scandal, to the job of training an allvolunteer Army for combat readiness.

title: SADAT SAYS ISRAEL  OFFERED SINAI DEAL
description: CAIRO, June 7President Anwar elSadat said today that he had rejected an Israeli proposal in March to return all of Sinai to Egypt in exchange for a separate peace agreement.

title: Crash Kills Van Passenger, 100, In Jersey and Injures 3 Otheis
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., June 7 (UPI)  A 100-year-old man died of injuries he suffered in an accident today involving van carrying elderly people, the police said.

title: Health Agency Cites 8 Food Places That Violate New York City's Code
description: The New York City Health Department yesterday cited eight food places that had violate the Health Code, five that had corrected earlier violations and two that were closed for failing to correct earlier violations. The places were listed as follows.

title: Yankees 9, Mariners
description: SEATTLE, June 7 (UPI)--Reggie Jackson hit two home runs and unbeaten Ron Guidry won his ninth game on a sixhitter tonight, helping the New York Yankees snap a fourgame losing streak with a 9.1 rout of the Seattle Mariners.

title: U.S. Has No Firm Evidence Somalia's Regular Forces Have ReEntered Ethiopia
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The United States has no credible evidence that regular Somali forces have reentered Ethiopia to support ethnic Somali guerrillas in the Ogaden region, State Department officials said today.

title: Bradley Won't Disclose His Strategy Against Bell
description: UNION, N, .1., June 7Amid a daylong flurry of telephone calls congratulating him on his victory in yesterday's Democratic primary for the Senate, Bill Bradley declined to say today how he would tailor his campaign to meet the conservative thrust of Jeffrey K. Bell, his Republican opponent, in the fall campaign.

title: $3 Million Is Required To Bail Out Islanders
description: The New York Islanders will have to produce about $3 million almost immediately if they want to settle a longrange debt of $9 million owed to the

title: McNamara, Japanese Discuss Aid
description: TOKYO, June 7  Discussions are under way here between Japan and the World Bank on ways to implement their joint program to expand aid to developing nations in the next three years.

title: U.S. Imports 47% of Its Oil
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)  The United States increased its petroleum imports from 6.3 million barrels a day in 1973 to 8.7 million barrels daily last year, the American Petroleum Institute said today.

title: CARTER CALLS ON SOVIET TO END CONFRONTATION OR RISK GRAVER
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 7President Carter called on the Soviet Union today to choose between confrontation and cooperation and said the United States was adequately prepared to meet either choice.

title: Macchiarola Said to Be Planning Wide Shakeup at Education Board
description: Frank J. Macchiarola, the incoming New York City School Chanceller, reportrdly plans a major shakeup at the Board of Education, including the possibility of abolishing the post of deputy chancellor, the discharge of some top officials and the reassignment of others, and the placement of a number of executives on what amounts to probation.

title: IC Presses Pet Offer, Excluding Hardee's
description: IC Industries said yesterday that it was going ahead with plans to offer $54 a share  or about $400 million in cash for Pet Inc.. the big food company. It emphasized that the deal did not include Pet's uncompleted .takeover of Hardee's Food Systems.

title: Spanish Rightists Targets of Bombs
description: MADRID June 7 (AP)Bombs destroyed the automobile and a store owned by a rightwing political leader in Pamplona today, the police reported. A third bomb damaged a Pamplona ba frequented by rightwingers. No one was hurt in the explosions, which followed a statement by a radical rightwing organization that its members would kill Communists whenever Spanish policemen were attacked.

title: New Jersey Bars Gilmour
description: EAST WINDSOR TOWNSHIP, N.J., June 7The State Racing Commission today barred Buddy Gilmour from driving in the state until his tax case is cleared up. Gilmour, second leading driver at the Meadowlands, was indicted Monday by a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn on charges of evading more than $70,000 in taxes.

title: Addenda

title: From Linkage to Sausage

If we heard him right in his address on the Russians yesterday, President Carter told the Lions to keep on roaring about Soviet behavior in Africa and,he told the Beavers to keep on building a structure of armscontrol agreements. And he told the Russian leaders that he must govern a nation of both lions and beavers  that he wants to finish the pending SALT agreement for its own sake but that American anxiety over Soviet conduct Ethiopia or Rhodesia could become a hindrance.

Va., June 5The water was cold and the footing uncertain as the five young women and men stood knee deep in Otter Creek, throwing rocks against the far hank to turn the stream away from the undermined abutment of an old Civilian Conservation Corps bridge along the Blue Ridge Parkway.

On Tuesday night the company opened a week's engagement at Houston's Jones Hall with Kenneth MacMillan's much-talked-about fullevening ballet Mayerline Like many a film diectcr before him, the Royal's chief choreographer has been fascinated by the alleged suicide pact of Crown Prince Rudolf of Austria and his teenage mistress, Mary Vetsera, in 1889. Yet .behind this personal tale of self-destruction among the Hapsburgs, Mr. MacMillan has created another declineof-the-empire ballet similar to his Anastasia, about the Romanovs.

title: Cleric Who Baptized Graham Dies
description: PALATKA, Fla., June 7 (AP)The Rev. Cecil Underwood, the minister who baptized Billy Graham, the evangelist, as Southern Baptist in 1938 died yesterday of an apparent heart attack at his home here. He was 73 years old. Mr. Graham was a 19yearold student at the Florida Bible College at Temple Terrace, near Tampa, when Mr. Underwood visited the school and invited the youth to his church. Mr. Graham, who had been Presbyterian, was baptized in Silver Lake near Palatka and later was ordained here.

title: Books of The Times
description: WILFRID SHEED once wrote of Norman Mailer that Mailer follows the Chestertonian principle of exploring the psychosis proper to the group, the identifying madness, and letting it enter him, like an exorcist opening himself to a devil. William H. Gass, in his first collection or essays since Fiction and the Figures of Life (1971), quotes Henry Miller on the conversation of Katsimbalis: He could galvanize the dead with his talk. It was a sort of devouring process: when he described a place he ate into it, like goat attacking a carpet. If he described a person he ate him alive from head to toe.

Stanford also won the men's Nationaq Collegiate championship.

He was only 28 years old but the Warriors felt he had lost a step on defense and they needed a scoring forward. They put C.J. on waivers and signed Nate Wiillams

description: WASHINGTON. June 8Spyros Kyprianou, President of Cyprus, moved briskly through a strenuous Washington schedule today, pushing hard to fix responsibility for the Cyprus stalemate on Turkey and the Turkish Cypriot leadership, and also to persuade the United States to continue its embargo on military aid to Turkey.

Others, including the University of Virgidia, New York University and the University of Pittsburgh, are planning similar magazines.

Senghor, President of the Republic of Senegal since its founding in 1960, did so this week during his state visit, joining an illustrious group, T. S. Eliot. An outstanding exception is the Red Tulip, recently reopened at a new lcearon on 75th Street between York and First Avenues. Done in what might be termed Hungarian provincial, it provides an enchanting setting with the nostalgic warmth of a faroff Ruritania.

They are now being processed by the Paul Robeson Archives, a nonprofit organization at 157 West 57th Street. When this is completed, before the year's end, the material will be donated to the MoorlandSpingarn Research Center of Howard University in Washington.

title: Salomon to Retire; Gutfreund Gets Post

Salomon, who orchestrated Salomon Brothers spectacular rise from a leading bondtrading firm to the secondlargest brokerage house on Wall Street and the nation's largest privately held securities firm, announced yesterday that he would step down as managing partner on Oct. 1. The 69-year-old executive, who has been managing partner for 15 years, will be succeeded by John H. Gutfreund, 48, a senior partner.

He does it a lot and is apparently none the worse for it. And it allows him to write with seeming authority, We will indeed reach our optimum million circulation during 1979.

title: Dance: Rotante Troupe
description: HE ROTANTE Dance Company is one of the more interesting of the newer modern dance groups on the scene today. The program it presented at Theater at St. Clement's Wednesday was typically intelligent wellcrafted dance. The five solo dancers were good looking, wan beautifully trained bodies. And while Nora (Guthrie) Rotante's choreographic style is more anecdotal than pure dance, Ted Rotante has given his dancers what looks like a pleasurable workout in which the body gets totally stretched in an elegantfeeling way. For the observer, however, what looks fulfilling for the dancers is finally somewhat wearing to watch.

description: WASHINGTON, June 8John 0, Weaver, a retired Army colonel who was also an Episcopal priest, and an expert on psychological warfare died on Monday of emphysema in a nursing home in Phoenix. He was 72 years old.

title: Ford Shifts Executive Jobs Again
description: DETROIT, June 8  At the Ford Motor Company today Philip Caldwell, vice chairman, was given the additional new title of deputy chief executive officer, while William Clay Ford, a vice president and brother of Henry Ford 2d, became the new fourth membei of the recently established office of the chief executive. He replaces his brother as chairman of the executive committee.

title: Screen: Damien Back in 'Omen II':'Born Unto a Jackel'
description: WHEN we took our leave of him at the end of "The Omen," Damien, the cherubic-looking Antichrist, come to earth to claim his rights, was 6 years old and in attendance at the state funeral of his father and mother, the recently deceased United States Ambassador to the Court of St. James's and Mrs. Thorn. Holding the hand of the President throughout the ceremony, Damien did not fidget. Apparently fidgets are not something to which a child "born unto a jackal" is subject.At the start of "DamienOmen II," the inevitable sequel, we leap seven years into the future when Damien, now 13 and played by round-faced Jonathan Scott-Taylor, is living near Chicago with his uncle, Richard Thorn (William Holden), Richard's wife, Ann (Lee Grant), and his cousin Mark (Lucas Donat) in the sort of suburban splendor that only multimillions can buy in the Middle West: a 50-year-old, mock French chateau and more liveried servants than you're likely to find at Buckingham Palace.To all outward appearances Damien is, if not the Antichrist, then at least an Antichrist. He rarely smiles, and when he does it's a sneer. He's rude to his ancient aunt. He smokes cigarettes if he can get them and, when crossed by a schoolmate, all he has to do is stare to send the other kid into convulsions. Yet nobody recognizes him for what he is, not even Damien himself.It's left to a sergeant at the military school attended by Damien and Mark to pass the word on to Damien. The sergeant is one of the Devil's helpers who miraculously appear from time to time to help Damien (and the movie's plot) along."The time is coming," says the sergeant sternly, "for you to put away childish things and face up to who you are."Those of us who endured "The Omen" know what the sergeant means: "You're too old to go around murdering mummies and daddies and nannies. Act your age."One way and another Damien does, and "DamienOmen II" is the open-ended record of this particularwhat should I call it?rite of passage. Before Damien is finished this time, there have been approximately a dozen new victims, a couple of whom have succumbed to what appear to be internal disorders while others have been sliced in half, stabbed, burned, impaled, gassed, pecked (by a nasty crow) and, in the film's most inspired moment of cinematic nonsense, drowned beneath the clear ice of a Wisconsin lake.Perhaps my resistance has given out but I must say that "DamienOmen II," though it's as foolish as the first film, is rather more fun to watch and sometimes very stylish-looking. Much of the movie was shot in and around Chicago, which, in winter, with its extraordinary architecture, must be one of the handsomest of American citiesso handsome, in fact, that the movie-makers haven't hesitated to let Chicago's railroad yards double for those in New York when the need arises."Damien" does have some trouble getting its seasons straight. Though the story covers approximately nine months, the leaves on the trees suggest a perpetual autumn with occasional bouts of winter.The winter scenes, filmed in Wisconsin, are spectacularly beautiful, and work in a subliminal way to make us accept the not uncomic absurdities of the screenplay, written by Stanley Mann and Michael Hodges. Because Mr. Hodges began as the film's director, but was later replaced by Don Taylor ("The Island of Dr. Moreau," "Tom Sawyer"'), I've no idea who is responsible for the movie's classy look.A cast of good actors helps, of course. Mr. Holden and Miss Grant play it straight, with nice assistance from Mr. Scott-Taylor, Mr. Donat, Sylvia Sidney, Lew Aires and several actors new to me, Robert Foxworth, Elizabeth Shepherd and Lance Hendriksen.I'd hate to have anyone go off to see "Damien" with the idea that it's going to be some sort of transcendental experience. It's a joke, but as such jokes go, it's much funnier than "The Fury," and quite as shrewd in its Grand Guignol special effects.

title: Court Rejects Socal on Taxes
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., June 8 (AP) The State Supreme Court has rejected an effort by the Standard Oil Company of California to overturn a Nevada tax on oil and gas leases on Federal land.

title: United Press international
description: PARIS, June 8 (AP)Bjorn Borg of Sweden abd Corrado Barazzutti of Italy swept into the semifinals of the French open tennis tournament today with straightset victories.

title: The Editorial Notebook Why Johnny Isn't Learning French
description: In the late 1950's, frightened by the Soviet Sputnik and goaded by critics of declining academic standards, educa, tors took a hard look at the persistent American failure to master foreign tongues. They concluded that poor timing was part of the problem. They found that teenage  the traditional starting point  is the worst time to teach a foreign language. Adolescents tend to be selfconscious, afraid of making fools of themselves, and therefore awkward about foreign accents. In contrast, young children love to imitate strange sounds and words; give. them a nonsense word and they will re peat it with exuberance and without embarrassment.

title: New York Assembly Passes HospitalRate Limits
description: ALBANY, June 8The Assembly today passed a bill that for the first time would place direct state limits on hospital rates, including those paid by both individuals and private health insurers.

title: Sons of Killebrew, Law Taken in Player Draft
description: The sons of Harmon Killebrew and Vernon Law and the brother of Richie Zisk were among the players selected yesterday when baseball completed its threee.ay draft.

title: A 200Year Tradition: Complaints From Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 8In letters to their constituents, members of Congress express concern about many things: the national debt, poor postal service, the heavy tax burden, demands of Federal employees for pay increases, soaring military costs, the balance of trade and treaty debates.

title: Music: Philharmonic
description: How to decide on the right soloist to go with the right conductor is one of the everlasting conundrums of orchestral life, and one that does not yield to computerized solutions. At Avery Fisher Hall last ntgnt, tor instance, the problem was approached in a way that often gives superlative results: two superior craftsmen of similar artistic temperament were matched, in the persons of the violinist Pinchas Zukerman and the conductor Erich Leinsdorf. The result in Beethoven's Violin Concerto, was performance of exceptional poise and refinement, if not of great tension or drama.

title: Notes on People.
description: King Hussein of .lordan yesterday settled the line of succession to his throne by choosing his 2-year-old son, Ali, to become crown prince when the monarch's youngest brother, Crown Prince Hassan, succeeds to the throve. The King thus bypassed his two older sons, Abdullah and Faisal, by his second, Britishhorn wife, Princess Muna, from whom he is divorced, in directing the succession to the Hashemite throne. He made his wishes known in a royal message to Crown Prince Hassan, in which he said: Prince. Ali Bin alHussein is my son and the son of the late Queen Alia, who gave her life performing the royal duties. This was a reference to the queen's death in a helicopter crash last year. Prince Hassan pledged to carry out his brother's wishes, which were expressed only a week before Hussein is to marry his fourth wife, the Americanborn Elizabeth Halaby.

An old woman carrying a Greek newspaper balances a baby on one hip, and inside an Italian bakery is a cluster of children spending their allowances on an assortment of water ices, of all flavors.
