description: Yankees vs. Seattle Mariners, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (Radio  WINS, 8 P.M.) Mets vs. Dodgers, at Los Angeles. (TelevisionChannel 9, 10:30 P.M. (Radio  WMCA, WGLI, 10:30 P.M.)

title: SENATE FILIBUSTER FOES FAIL AGAIN, BY 2 VOTES
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  A fourth attempt to shut off the 16day filibuster against the bill to revise the labor law fell just short of success today. The vote was 58 to 41, two short of the 60 required.

title: Krupsak, Carey and Cleopatra
description: The sudden tirade with which Lieutenant Governor Krupsak announced her unwillingness to share Governor Carey's ticket reminded the electorate that marriage is not the world's only difficult bipersonal relationship. The connection between the New York. State Governor and the Lieutenant Governor is not an easy one at best. It becomes more difficult when the Lieutenant Governor has won her office as the result of her own efforts in a primary election and when she finds herself, as the first woman to win a statewide election, expected to accomplish changes in private perceptions and public relationships that would have daunted Cleopatra.

title: The Renegade Housekeeper Comes Clean
description: WHO has the time? Who has the interest? And, one might add, how many can afford that weekly char? But cutting back, trimming corners and pitching out can go a long way toward making short shrift of housework. And why not ease such a burden? After all, you clean and in six months you just have to do all again.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: The FreedmanDershowitz OpEd article of June 2 is a sadly distorted apology for the Israeli Government's unjust and inhumane treatment of American graduate student Sami Esmail. Yesterday Esmail was convicted by an Israeli court of membership in a Palestinian organization which is illegal in Israel. Dershowitz and Freedman, professed civil libertarians, should be outraged by this conviction at a trial in which the prosecution presented no evidence other than an extorted confession. In fact, the prosecution admitted that without this confession there would be absolutely no case against Sami and he would be freed! Sami's uncorroborated confession was obtained after six days of intense interrogation arid mistreatment. He was allowed to see lawyer and visit his dying father only after confessing. Incredibly, these circumstances are what Freedman and Dershowitz refer to as far from being held incommunicado.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: Ceausescu Has Talks in London
description: LONDON; June. 14 (Reuter)  President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania had talks today with Prime Minister James Callaghan of Britain on the second day of fourday state visit aimed partly at strengthening Rumanian independence from Moscow.

title: American Symphony
description: I T IS ironic but true that the most interesting feature of the American Symphony Orchestra's second Schubert Fest concert, given at Carnegie Hall last night, was a transcription of a Schubert work by Liszt.

title: Events Today
description: ONCE IN A LIFETIME, the Most Hart George S. Kaufman comedy. Directed by Tom Moore. Cast Includes Jayne Meadows Allen, George S. Irving, John Lithgow, Deborah May, Treat Williams, May Wright. At the Circle inthe Square, 50th Street west of Broadway, at 6:45.

title: Associated Press
description: GRIEVES OVER SHOOTING VICTIM: Mattie Pearl Duncan clutches Wellington Franklin, shot with a rifle on a street in New Haven. Mr. Franklin's brother, Douglas, was later charged with the slaying. Miss Duncan's relation to the two men was not immediately known.

title: Letters
description: Regarding Mr. Cylke's comments the Letters column of June 7 on Anatole Broyard:s essay. (A Ghost From the Past Banished From  My Door, June 11, he seems to have missed the whole point of the piece. Before we must honor our neighbor, we must honor the sanctity of our home and protect the lives of our loved ones.

title: President Appeals to Congress to Limit Federal Outlay
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  President Carter called on Congress today to exercise restraint in spending to hold down the Federal budget deficit and to set a good example for the wage and price decisions of our workers and businessmen.

title: The von Hirsch Collection Goes to Auction
description: DAILY they came to the imposing, mansardroofed brick mansion of Robert von Hirsch in Basel, Switzerland. Art lovers, musicians, conductors and diplomats gathered for lunch in a dining room as rich in art treasures as a gallery of New York's Museum of Moaern That midday ritual ended last.

description: OLD GLORY HONORED: Youngsters from Jersey City schools took part in ceremony at Liberty Park yesterday in celebration of Flag Day.

title: Desai Rejects Nuclear Inspections While U.S. Can Expand Arsenal
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Prime Minister Morarji R. Dosai of India said today that the. United States could not expect countries.such as his to accept nuclearfacility inspections and safeguards while the United States remained free to expand its own atomic arsenal.

title: CURRENCYMARKETS
description: The dollar closed mixed on currency exchanges at home and abroad yesterday, while the price of gold, traditionally a refuge for those wary of the dollar, rose more than a dollar an ounce, The Associated Press reported.

title: The MillionDinar Gate, Maybe
description: Get it this year, but if and when he does baseball's finest hitter since Ted Williams and Stan Musial will still be underpaid by current standards in other sports. Carew would have to moonlight as a used car salesman to approach the economic level of Bjorn Borg, the tennis player, whose loot for the year has reached $507,513 with seven months to go.

title: Lower Saxony Skips VW Rights Issue
description: The West German state of Lower Saxony, which owns 20 percent of Volswagenwerk A.G., announced that it would not subscribe to VW's planned 1for3 rights issue this fall. Instead, the state government said it would let the Volkswagen Foundation subscribe to the rights offer. It added that experts had concluded that the state could keep its voting rights in the company by putting its rights issue into the trust arrangement.

title: F.B.I. Alert Ordered When Nixon Resigned
description: SEATTLE, June 14 (UPI)  Clarence Mr. Kelley said that when he was director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation he ordered a nationwide alert because he feared a coup attempt after President Nixon's resisnation in 1974

title: Bakke, Unmuddy
description: On Monday morning, May 22, a New York radio station began alerting its likeners to stay tuned for an imminent announcement of the United States Supreme Court decision in the controversial and crucial Bakke case, on minority admissions and affirmativeaction programs. I turned up the volume and waited nervously for the report.

title: OneTime Prospective Provenzano Juror Is Arrested for Soliciting $20,000 Bribe
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., June 14  A. onetime prospective juror who allegedly solicited a $20,000 bribe to hang the jury in the Anthony ProvenzanoHarold Koenigsberg murder trial before the case opened was arrested by the state nolice today.

title: Twins Take carevv Off Ttade Mart
description: Carew willremain a Twin. That was Calvin R. Griffith's statement yesterday when the Minnesota Twins president withdrew Rod Carew, baseball's top hitter, from the trading market.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: ACANOPY transforms a bed from a mere sleeping place to an intimate, decorative spot, hidden island in a bedroom. The cost of making such a romantic statement is usually astronomical, because of the carpentry and drapery involved.

title: The New York Times/Neal Boenzl
description: IT'S SUMMERJOB TIME: Gordon J. Davis, Parks Commissioner, drawing job application cards from lottery drum yesterday. About 12,500 applications for summer employment were received; only 300 jobs are available.

title: Unions to Map Strategy on Layoffs
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP)  Thirty public employee unions formed an emergency committee today to consider launching mass strikes or work slowdowns in California to protest anticipated layoffs because of a sharp cut in property taxes approved by voters there. Spokesmen for the unions, which represent two million Fedexal, state, county. and city workers, said the panel also would map a strategy to counter taxrevolt movements elsewhere in the country.

title: Carter Is the Winner In Audit of His Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  President Carter said today that an Internal Revenue Service audit of his taxes showed he owed $160 in back taxes but that the same audit uncovered an overpayment that would result in a refund of $5,000 to $6,000.

title: TV.. Memoir of Family Character
description: Chachaji: My Poor Relation, tonight's World production, which can lie seen on WNETTV at 9, is in many ways an extraordinary memoir by N.red Mehta. Mr. Mehta, now in his Inid40's, is a staff writer for The New York er and has written extensively about his native India. He has been blind since a childhood attack of meningitis.

title: Police Digging for. Bodies at a Home in Massachusetts
description: WEST SPRINGFIELD, Mass., June 14A backhoe churned the earth around Kenneth Appleby's ramshackle, tightly fortified little house here and tore up the back yard, with its high fence of wood and metal topped by coils of barbed wire.

title: State Supreme Court, 64, Upholds Release of Uncooperative Napoli.
description: TRENTON, June 13 (AP)  The New Jersey Supreme Court upheld yesterday the release of Ralph Napoli, the reputed mobster, on the ground that no amount of imprisonment would ever force him to testify before the State Commission of Investigation.

title: Bar Upheld On Stations Of Refiners
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  The Supreme Court ruled today that states can bar oil refiners and producers from the direct operation of service stations, a move the oil companies said would result in higher consumer prices.

title: Rate Is Raised On Crop Loans
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP) Farmers who get Government pricesupport loans on their crops will be paying a higher interest rate, the Agriculture Department said yesterday.

title: Says Cuban Soldiers Should Have Acted to Block Invasion
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  President Carter charged today that Fidel Castro could have done much more to prevent the recent Katangan invasion of Zaire, including using Cuban soldiers to prevent the attack and notifying the world, in advance, had he genuinely wished to stop the incursion.

title: In Trenton, Party Pride's the Key Any Assessment the Legislature
description: TRENTON, June 14  The legislative session now drawing to a close has either been a. success or a dismal failure, depending on who is making the assessment.

title: Market Place
description: WORD from Caesars World that it planned begin gambling operations in Atlantic City earlier than had been planned led to heavy buying interest in the shares yesterday, but traders may have been gambling a bit themselves in view questions raised about problems the company still appears to face in Nevada if it opens a casino elsewhere.

title: Carter Didn't Sell Well, So Breakfast Is Free
description: ATLANTA, June 14 (AP)  Southern Baptist leaders, unable to sell the expected number of tickets to President Carter's speech at a Baptist men's conference Friday. have decided to open the event to anyone who shows up.

title: Sound
description: CONSIDER the plight of footloose vacationers longing for a favorite Mozart concerto by the sea or in the woods. Leaving aside the question whether landscape is improved by the addition of Mozart  not to mention lesser musical contributions by transistorized tourists1 can happily report that some of the better batterypowered portable radios and tape recorders now qualify as musically tolerable travel companions.

title: Soviet's Said to Have Warned U.S. Of Retaliation in Arrest of Russians
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Authoritative sources said today that Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko warned Secretary of State Cyprus R. Vance two weeks ago that the Soviet Union would soon retaliate against Americans in Moscow unless the United States released two Soviet employees of the United Nations being held on espionage charges.

title: New Copyright Law is Found Effective
description: ARLINGTON, Va.,. June 13  The new copyright act that took effect jan. 1 is working fairly well to protect creators of literary, musical and autistic works in an era of swiftly moving communications changes, according to Barbera A. Ringer, Register of Copyrights.

description: 6:00(4)You and the Law: Services of a Lawyer (13)Captioned ABC News (R)

title: TRAVIS HATFIELD
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 14 (AP)  Travis Hatfield, involved in baseball and boxing for many years, died yesterday of a heart attack at the age of 71 at hi.; home here.

title: Gas Stations Are Putting Price on Air
description: It was bound to happen. Iscella Holder of Peekskill, N.Y., drove into the Power Test gasoline station on Route 202 outside town the other day and stared at the unfamiliar machine mounted on the wall.

title: President Appeals to Congress to Limit Federal Outlay
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  President Carter called on Congress today to exercise restraint in spending to hold down the Federal budget deficit and to set a good example for the wage and price decisions of our workers and businessmen.

title: Sony Net Off 31.8% in Quarter
description: The Sony Corporation, citing higher costs as a result of the rise of the yen,. reported yesterday in Tokyo declines of 31.8 percent in the company's profits in the second quarter ended April 30 and 41A percent in the second half.

title: Notes on People
description: KING Juan Carlos of Spain left Madrid yesterday for a 10day trip abroad, which will include the first visit to China by a Spanish head of state. The king, accompanied by Queen Sofia and Marcelino Oreja Aguirre, the Foreign Minister, stopped first at Teheran. Tonight they were to fly on to Peking, the port of Shanghai, and the resort city of Hangchow in China. On the way home they will spend a day in Iraq, arriving back in Madrid June 23.

title: U.S. Collects $1.7 Million in Debts
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP)  The Government's drive on student loan defaulters is paying off, with $1.7 million in bad debts collected last month alone, according to an official in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare. That compares with only $700,000 in debts collected annually in the last two years, said Leo Kornfeld, a. deputy commissioner.

title: South's Confidence in Carter Slips But He Is Still Popular, Polls Show
description: ATLANTA, June 14  President Carter, suffering a lack of support in the rest of the country, swings briefly into his friendly home state Friday, but he had best be prepared for some more bad news in his own backyard: The home folks also think he is making a bad job of his Presidency.

title: Economic Scene
description: THE initial reaction of most business executives tb the exposure of illegal corporate contributions to the Nixon reelection campaign in i972 and of widespread foreign bribes or questionable payments was commonly defensive and scornful of nublic and nress criticism. But scarcely a business meeting occurs these days without ethics being on the agenda. Scores of major corporations have developed ethical policy statements aimed at providing guidance to employees on a wide range of domestic and international problems.

title: Music: Wagner Evening
description: IN the series of June Favorites that the New York Philharmonic is presenting at Avery Fisher Hall these nights, Tuesday's program was made up of thricefamiliar Wagner opera excerpts. But as is the way with masterpieces, the evening turned out be one of the more stirring and rewarding of the season. Given the music, the finely honed condition of the orchestra  it takes off for a tour of Japan and Korea next week  and the inspired conducting of Erich Leinsdorf, who at the age of 66 could be accorded the status of an old master, it was no wonder that practically every work was greeted with cheers by a particularly enthusiastic audience.

title: Dodgers Defeat Mets, 53, for 5th Victory
description: LOS ANGELES, June 14  Two leftbanded craftsmen who have been pitching in the major leagues for, more than a decade, Tommy John and Jerry Koosman, hooked up in an interesting ditel tonight and John's Los Angeles Dodgers came away with a 5.3 victory over Koosman's Mets.

title: Beirut Endorses U.N. Control
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 14  Lebanon's Prime Minister conferred with a United Nations representative today and said that the United Nations peacekeeping force should take control of the area evacuated by the Israelis yesterday.

title: Martin Luther King Sr. in Hungary
description: BUDAPEST, June 14 (Reuters)  The Rev. Martin Luther King Sr. arrived here tonight for meetings with Hungarian church leaders and peace workers. Mr. j King, father of the slain civil rights leader and pastor emeritus of the Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta, was invited to Budapest by the Hungarian Council of Free Churches, which arranged a visit here last September by Billy Graham, the evangelist.

title: Housen's 296 Takes Golf By 5 in N.J.
description: COLONIA, N.J., June 14  Bob Housen, of Woodlake won the 77th New Jersey Golf Msociation amateur championship today, but the 39yearold financial analyst had to do it the hard way by recovering from a seven over par on the front nine of the final 18 holes en route to a 79.

title: Disks: Teddi King
description: WTEDDI KING. This Is New. Inner City 1044. HEN Teddi King died last November at 48 years of age, she was on the verge of rounding out the most rewarding year she had ever had as a singer, artistically if not financially. For the previous seven years, the illness that proved terminal (systemic lupus erythematosujs, a degenerative disease commonly known as lupus) had prevented her from working regularly, reducing her to sporadic, casually prepared appearances that often did her less than justice.

title: Red Sox, Tiant Are at Nome In Beating A's for 6th in Row
description: With Luis Tiant in top form and Jim Rice and Carl Yastrzemski hitting home runs, the Boston Red Sox had all of their Fenway Park magic working last night in a 9.0 romp over the Oakland A's.

title: Tishman to Pay $1
description: The Tishman Realty and Construction Company, said it would make a third liquidating distribution of $1, payable July 12 to holders of record June 27. The company said the funds for the distribution came from the sale of minority interests in buildings in Cleveland and Los Angeles and the sale of a partnership in a Newark project.

title: Coup de Kas Takes a First Step. to Glory?
description: There's an old saying around the race track that nobody with an untried 2yearold in the barn ever committed suicide.

title: Design Notebook
description: THERE are few things as destructive to the cityscape as high, blank wall of brick or concrete. There seem to be more and more of them, and they cast somber pall over streets and views that deserve to have more life.

title: World News Briefs
description: PARIS, June 14 (Reuters)  Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance of the United States and the foreign ministers of four other Western countries indicated today they would make a fresh attempt to win the agreement of'a major guerrilla group for their independence plan for SouthWest Africa.

description: KINGSTON, N.Y., June 14  Anthony Provenzano, an organizedcrime figure who had been linked to the disappearance of James R. Hoffa, and Harold Konigsberg, an extortionist and alleged enforcer for organized crime, were convicted today of murdering Mr. Provenzano's union rival.

title: Hangen Collection Given to Broadcast Museum
description: Notables from television news turned out yesterday for ceremonies presenting the Welles Hangen Collection to the Museum of Broadcasting, 1 East 53d Street.

title: Bridge
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, June 14  The Central American and Caribbean zonal team championship was won here last night by Panama, which regained the title it last held in 1976.

title: A Cold Shoulder Awaiting Carter in the Canal Zone
description: BALBOA, Canal Zone, June 14  Less than a mile from where Panamanian workers are hanging up posters and flags to welcome President Carter on Friday, the Americans in the Canal Zone seem indifferent, if not hostile, to the 23hour visit, terming it variously as an affront and 'ptire public relations.

title: BRONX MOVE. MARKED BY MINORITY COMPANY
description: The Berg Company, one of the largest minorityowned chemical companies in the country, yesterday celebrated its move to a 100yearold South Bronx warehouse that not too long ago had been occdpied only by scavengers and drug addicts.

title: U.S. Yachts Finish 1, 2, 3 To Lead Onion Patch Sail
description: NEWPORT, R.I., June 14  Led by Burt Keenan's new blue sloop from New Orleans called Acadia, the United States yachts swept the first three places today in the international team competition for the Onion Patch Trophy and established a 31point lead over Britain, with South America third and Bermuda last.

title: Jordan Quiet on Eve of Wedding
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 14  As khakiclad armed guards looked on under a desert sun, workmen outside the twostory sandstone palace of King Hussein's mother, Queen Zain, unloaded a truck filled with cases of soft drinks for tomorrow's wedding reception.

title: 20,000 in Lebanon Mourn Raid Victims; Vengeance Is Vowed
description: ZGHARTA, Lebanon, June 14 (AP)  ormer President Suleiman Franjieh, joined by 20,000 mourners, buried h:s sloin son today in this northern town after vowing revenge in our traditional style and at the proper time against the rival Lebanese Christian faction responsible for the killing.

title: SCHOOLGIRL SLAYING SHOCKS L.I. VILLAGE
description: MINEOLA, L.L, June 14  Students at the John Philip Sousa JuniorHigh School in Port Washington had taken shortcuts through; an abandoned sand pit without incident for years, but today the community was in a virtual state of shock over the slaying yesterday of a 13yearold Thai girl in a remote area of the pit.

title: Brati
description: PARSONS  George Rockliffe, June 14, age 79 in Pawling, NY. Born In WestonSuperMar., Somerset, England and resident of NYC and later Mountainview Park, Towners, NY. Member of Patterson Fire Dept., and Masons. Mourned by his widow, Evelyn Parsons, survived also by a daughter, Mrs. William Dokes of Milford, Ohio, 2 grandchildren and 2 greatgrandchildren. Also a sister, Mrs. Bert Kelland of Penygraig, So. Wales, Great Britain. Private burial In Pepperell. Mass, In lieu of flowers, contributions to American Cancer Society would be appreciated.

title: Provenzano and Konigsberg Guilty In 1961 Slaying of Teamster Official
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., June 14  Anthony Provenzano, an organizedcrime figure who had been linked to the disappearance of James R. Hoffa, and Harold Konigsberg, an extortionist and alleged enforcer for organized crime, were convicted today of murdering Mr. Provenzano's union rival.

title: Jews Promise a Nonviolent Rally Against Marchby Nazis in Skokie
description: CHICAGO, June 14  The Public Affairs Committee of the Jewish United Fund, which is planning a demonstration to counter the Nazi match scheduled for June 25 in suburban Skokie, pledged today that it would make every effort to prevent violence.

title: Saudis Provoke Outcry in Britain By Flogging 2 Who Brewed Beer
description: LONDON, June 14  Saudi Arabia has flogged two British workers for making beer, causing a pnblic outcry here.

title: Transfer of Braves Delayed 20 Days
description: CORONADO, Calif., June 14  Roy L. M. Boe, the beleaguered president of the Nets. and Islanders, received the same treatment today from the National Basketball Association owners there that he got yesterday in Montreal from the National Hockey League owners. A few hours after Boe arrived here for the start of the N.B.A. owners meeting, he was given a second ultimatum that could cost him the loss of the New Jersey Nets. Unless Boe comes up with a viable financial plan by July 28 that would make the Nets financially operable, the owners are prepared to strip him of the franchise. The N.B.A. deadline is 10 days later than the one imposed by the N.H.L. for Boe to solve his financial problems with the Islanders or have that team taken over by the league.

title: 12 New York Food Spots Cited For City Health Code Violations
description: The New York City Health Department yesterday cited 12 food places for violations of the Health Code, one that had corrected an earlier violation and one that, had reopened after correcting violations. The places were listed as follows:

description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock E xchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Callas Household Effects Sold at Auction in Paris
description: PARIS, June 14 (Reuters)  Furniture and household effects belonging to the opera singer Maria Callas  everything from asparagus tongs to a rare Chinese carpet  were auctioned today.

title: House Votes to Retain Control Of TV Cameras in the Chamber
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  The House voted late tonight to have its employees, not those of the networks, control the televison cameras that soon will be recording chamber proceedings.

title: Trilateral Unit Criticizes Official Plans On Energy
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  An international commission of prominent privete citizens gave the governments of theAvorld's industrial nations generally poor marks today for their handling of the fiveyearold energy crisis.

title: State Asks Reorganization of Hospitals in Brooklyn
description: New York's top state health officials will recommend today the ending or consolidation of services of several private voluntary hospitals in Brooklyn as part of an effort to close 823 unnecessary hospital beds in the borough.

title: Deputy Police Chief Indicted in Bdtimore
description: BALTIMORE, June 14  A deputy chief of the Baltimore Police Department has been indicted on charges stemming from an 18month investigation into police trafficking in narcotics.

title: BROOKE ACCUSED OF FAILING TO REPORT STOCK HOLDINGS
description: BOSTON, June 14 (AP)  Senator Edward W. Brooke's Senate financial disclosure report failed to include information about stocks that he holds and incorrectly stated that he is not a member of any corporate board, The Boston Herald American reported today.

title: Beyond the Katanga Tangle
description: President Carter's vigorous charges that Cuba bore responsibility for last month's invasion of Zaire were unworthy of American diplomacy to begin with. They turned out to be unprovable except by a kind of guiltbyassociation. They undoubtedly inflamed American passions for no discernible good reason. And they threatened for a few days this week to embroil the American Presidency in another Tonkinlike test of credibility in which a proud and promising new President would have to tangle in the pits with, of all people, Fidel Castro. While pretending to be above such a scrap, Mr. Carter tossed a few more questionable punches yesterday, but if that was the price of his resolve to put the matter behind him and look to the future instead, we can all be grateful.

title: The New York Times/D. Gorton
description: ALBANY, June 14  Governor Carey and Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo were designated as the Democratic candidates for Governor and Lieutenant Governor today over token opposition at one of the most harmonious Democratic meetings in many years.

title: GISCARD SAYS HE WARNED BREZHNEV OVER DETENTE
description: PARIS, June 14  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France disclosed today that he sent a message last week to Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, reminding him that dtente must be global and is not compatible with endorsement of armed forces crossing frontiers.

title: Elpatlyi
description: ABRAHAM  Roy E. Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun mourns the passing of its esteemed member and extents its heartfelt sympathy to his dear wife and to all the members of the bereaved family.

title: Advertising
description: SGONER or later everyone  yes, everyone  gets involved with a marketing man, eh, marketing person. Extremely insidious people, really. Not even the United States Olympic Committee is immune.

title: Rutgers Becomes Film Set
description: NEWARK, June 14 (AP)  The college days of Sylvia Plath, the novelist and poet were recreated today when location filming of The Bell Jar began on the Rutgers University campus in New Brunswick.

title: Proposition 1
description: As a man of the democratic left, I was, of course, appalled by the passage of Proposition 13 in California, and yet there was a core of progressive truth in the tax revolters complaint. The positive way to respond is by a radical reform of the entire tax systern.

title: Arabs Favor U.S. Banks Over Own
description: Since 1979, Arab banks and their affiliates have sprung up all over the Arab region, in Paris, London and Tokyo, and even in faraway Latin America.

title: P.B.A. Negotiations Are Resumed
description: Negotiators for New York City and the patrolmen's Benevolent Association reported progress in bargaining talks that resumed yesterday. following an abrupt, breakoff on Monday.Samuel DeMilia, P.B.A. president, arriving to renew bargaining talks.

title: Jewelry Design: Old and New
description: TWO current jewelry exhibitions provide a study in contrasts. The work of Bjorn  Weckstrom, at the Aaron Faber Gallery through June 24, is contemporary, at times even futuristic. Delphin Broussailles, on the other hand, takes his inspiration from the past. Some of the meticulously crafted pieces in his Gold in the Classical Tradition show at the Ares Gallery through Zane 27 use techniques dating to the fifth century B.C.

title: Both Sides Sum Up at Herrin Trial; Focus on His Mental State in Killing
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 14  Both the defense and the prosecution summed up their cases today in the murder trial of Richard J. Herrin, focusing on the 24yearolddefendant's state of mind when he bludgeoned his former girlfriend to death with a hammeilast year.

title: Issues in Strike at The Daily News
description: ParticipantsThe Newspaper Guild of New York, which went on strike at 2 P.M. Tuesday, claims 1,340 news and commercial members at The Daily News. The newspaper, which employs 5,100 workers overall, has the country's largest daily circulation of 1.9 million, and a Sunday circulation of 2.7 million.

title: 2 New South Moderates Emerge As Candidates for Seats in Senate
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., June 14  Gov. David Pryor's victory yesterday in the Democratic primary runoff virtually assured his election to the Senate, but the winner in South Carolina's Democratic senatorial primary, Charles Ravenel, faces yet another stiff test.

title: BROWN CUTS $570 MILGION FROM CALIFORNIA. BUDGET
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June, 14 (AP)  Gov Edmund Brown Jr. of California anc ounced today a 5570 million out en his proposed $17.4 billion 197879 state budget including a cneyear freeze on salarias for all state employees.

title: Health Specialists Concerned ()vet Cadmium Perill
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)There 11 growing concern among environmental health specialists about the future threat of cadmium, a ubiquitous metal that some believe may have a role. in causing high blocid pressure and, possibly even a form of cancer.

title: APL Contests Takeover Laws
description: The APL Corporation, pursuing its long battle for control of the Pabst Brewing Company of Milwaukee, said yesterday that it had filed suit in Manhattan Federal Court to contest the constitutionality of takeover statutes in Wisconsin and Arkansas.

title: U.S.China Trade Seen Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP) United States trade with China will probably double this year, primarily because of Chinese purchases of farm products, Secretary of Commerce Juanita M. Kreps said today.

title: What's So Special About New York?
description: If eloquence and an impressive display of ambition, forbearance, humor and compassion were decisive, New York City and State can be said to have made their case for a Federal loan guarantee. Even Senator Proxmire and his Banking Committee colleagues seemed to be moved in recent days as they heard Carey, Duryea, Koch, Rohatyn, Moynihan, Javits, Shanker, Gotbaum, Bigel, Steingut, Marchi, Rockefeller, Patterson and all the rest. One had to be moved hearing SenN.or Marchi, the Staten Island conservative, beg the nation to honor its obligation to the poor, and Senator Ohrenstein, the Manhattan liberal, explain the disillusionment of California property owners better than any of their spokesmen. Moved yes; but Mr. Proxmire remained unpersuaded. His committee remains narrowly divided and the chairman closed the hearings by saying he could not bring himself to set a precedent of Federal rescue for municipal distress. Why, in other words, should New York get special treatment?

title: Carter Campaign Audit Likely to Be Published Soon
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  The chairman of Ithe,,Federal Election Commission said today that the commission hoped to complete; and publish before the end of summeiya longdelayed audit of President Carter's 1976 campaign expenses.

title: Gasoline Stocks Fall in Week
description: The American Petroleum Institute yesterday reported a slight drop in gasoline stocks, which fell to 236.3 million barrels in the week ending June 9, from 238.2 million barrels in the previous week.

title: $300 Million To Greek Bank
description: ATHENS. June 14 (UPI)The Bank of Greece will receive a $300 million loan from a consortium of international banks led by Bankers Trust of New York and Barclays Bank, Government sources today.

title: I.R.S. HELPS COLLECT CHILDSUPPORT FUNDS
description: ALBANY, June 14  In a major new effort to collect millions of dollars in delinquent childsupport payments, the Department of Social Services is using a littieknown provision of Federal law that allows the Internal Revenue Service to collect such payments from the parents of children receiving publicassistance grants.

title: Henry Bibby Is Arrested On 2 Highway Charges
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J., June 14 (UPI)  Henry Bibby, a gilard with the Philadelphia 76ers, faces a court hearing July 24 on charges or drivng his car without a license and speeding at 79 miles an hour.

title: Man Shot to Death by Officer
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 14 (AP)  A West Philadelphia man, George P. Greene, 35 years old, was shot to death by a policeman early today after the man was stopped for allegedly driving past a red light, the police said. Patrolman Garry Bell said that he stopped Mr. Greene and ordered him and a companion to put their hands on their heads. Mr. Greene disobeyed the order and was shot when he opened a glove compartment, the police said. A starter pistol was later found on the floor, they added.

title: Preliminary Jumper Class Is Taken by Doc's Choice
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 14  Doc's Choice, a 9yearold bay gelding, today won his second preliminary jumper class in two starts at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club Horse Show after a fourhorse jumpoff.

title: $4 Million for Paralyzed Woman
description: A Brooklyn woman who became partly paralyzed by a stroke that she suffered shortly after surgery in 1971 was awarded $4 million in damages yesterday by a State Supreme Court jury in Brooklyn.

title: Michael Spinks Faces Assault, Drug Charges
description: ST. LOUIS, June 14 (UPI)  Charges of common asault and possession of marijuana were filed today against Michael Spinks, Olympic boxing gold medalist and younger brother of the heavyweight boxing champion, Leon SDinks.

title: CALIFANO ASKS ASSISTANCE FOR PREGNANT TEENAGERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  Joseph A. Califano Jr.. the Secretary of Health, Educaticn and Welfare, appealed to Con3ress tocay to turn the rising tide of (teenage pregnancies, which he called one cf the most serious and complex problems facing society.

title: Senator Assails Oil. Shipments
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (Reuters) Senator John A. Durkin, Democrat of New Hampshire, charged today that an American oil company had been quietly granted a Government license to ship Alaskan oil to Japan and stood to make a big profit.

title: Close Race for U.S. Senate Seat Expected in Maine in November
description: ANGUSTA, Me., June 14  Although most of the attention in yesterday's primary electionswas focused on the gubernatorial nominations, veteran politicians and others here belieire that the toughest fight in November will be the race for the United States Senate.

title: Carter AcCused of Breaking Pledge By Asking End of Turkish Arms Ban
description: WASHINGTON, June. I4  The House majority whip and thiee other Democratic members of Congress have accused President Carter of going back on promise to make repeal of the arms embargo against Turkey contingent on progress toward a settlement of the Cyprus issue.

title: I.R.S. HELPS COLLECT CHILDSUPPORT FUNDS
description: ALBANY, June 14  In a major new effort to collect millions of dollars in delinquent ch.li payments, the Department cf Social Services is using a litt;eknown provision of Federal law that allows the Internal Revenue Service to collect such payments from the parents of children receiving publicassistance grants.

title: Another Quake Strikes Region In Japan Where 22 Died Monday
description: TOKYO, June 14 (AP)  An earthquake strong enough to shake houses struck today in the area of a stronger quake that killed 22 persons in northeastern Japan Monday.

title: Chavez Is Released From Jail:
description: YUMA, Ariz., June 14 (AP)  Cdsar Chavez, the farm labor leader, and his wife were released from jail on their own recognizance today after pleading innocent to unlawful picketing of melon farms on grounds that the injunction was illegal. The couple protested their reledse, and said the United Farm Workers union was considering breaking the injunction en masse tomorrow to force the judge to put all of us in jail.

title: Curare Test Contested by Defense
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., June 14  The defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich attempted today to under. mine the validity of a key test that the prosecution has relied on to detect curare in the exhumed bodies of the alleged victims.

title: The New York Times/Neal Boenzi
description: IT'S SUMMERJOB TIME: Gordon J. Davis, Parks Commissioner, drawing job application cards from lottery drum yesterday. About 12,500 applications for summer employment were received; only 300 jobs are available.

title: U.S. Productivity Growth Eased in '77
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  Productivity growth slowed last year in about threefourths of the nation's industries, including a sharp drop in steel, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today.

title: Spying Is Back With New Vigor
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Suddenly this spring it was all back in the headlines: secret agents, double agents, mail drops, code books and invisible writing. There has been more public attention to international espionage in the last six months than at any time in a decade.

title: NEW YORK PICKING UP NEV SENATE SUPPORT FOR LONGTERM HELP
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  A major shift in favor of broader Federal aid for New York City appeared today to have taken place in the Senate Banking Committee, with a majority of the committee members reportedly prepared to vote for longterm credit assistance when the panel convenes tomorrow.

title: City's Logic Swaying Senate
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Two. former astronauts, the tobacco industry and a telephone company subsidiary in Indianapolis have been part of the effort to swing the Senate Banking Committet over to longterm aid fcr New York.Another senatorial aide acknowledged that a number of financial contributors from New York had called to speak on the city's behalf. But, he said, people who know the Senator know_that calling and lobbying just gtts his back up. The Senator, who had been philosophically opposed, today endorsed longterm credit assistance.

title: CurareDetection Test Is Challenged by the Defense
description: HACKENSACK, June 14  The defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich attempted today to undermine the validity of a key test that the prosecution has relied on to detect curare in the exhumed bodies of the alleged victims.

title: Kaiser Will Meet Price Guidelines
description: The president and chief executive officer of the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation said yesterday that the company would not raise prices on aluminum this year more than the informal guidelines set by the Carter Administration in its effort to slow inflation.

title: IVAN POUSCHINE SR.
description: Ivan Pouschine Sr., a retired partner in Cohu & Company, former stockbrokers here, died yesterday in his home in Surfside, Fla., after an illness of two years. He was 72 years old.

title: Legislative Session Receives Mixed Ratings From Lobbyists
description: TRENTON, June 14  While some legislative leaders were praising the work of the session drawing close to its summer recess, spokesmen for public and special interest groups had their own ideas about what the Legislature did, failed to do or might do in the coming weeks.

title: Pay Toilet Inventors Now Selling Air
description: It was bound to happen. Iscella Holder of Peekskill, N.Y., drove into the Power Test gasoline station on Route 202 outside town the other day and stared at the unfamiliar machine mounted on the wall.

title: F.T.C. in Bankruptcy Rescue
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP)  The Federal Trade Commission is trying what officials termed an innovative solution in a case in which they felt a company would go out of business under normal commission sanctions.

title: Business People
description: AnyOne who can sell French cars to West Germans, it could be presumed, should have no problem selling them to Americans. Whether that's what the top people at Governmentowned Renault had in mind when they sent Pierre. Herrmann here is not known. But it is a fact that Alsatianborn Mr. Herrmann spent five years in West Germany for the big French auto maker before coming here 18 months ago as president of Renault America.

title: Says Cuban Soldiers Should Have Acted to Block Invasion
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  President Carter charged today that Fidel Castro could have done much more to prevent the recent Katangan invasion of Zaire, including using Cuban soldiers to prevent the attack and notifying the world in advance, had he genuinely wished to stop the incursion.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Organized crime was responsible for the executionstyle slaying of the former municipal judge, Edwin H. Helfant, according to Atlantic County prosecutor, Richard J. Williams. Four months after the murder, Mr. Williams admitted that authorities were no closer to arresting the slender gunman wearing a ski mask who walked into Mr. Helfant's motel here Feb. 15 and fired five shots into his head and chest.

title: Stuart Symington Weds Ann Watson
description: Ann Hemingway Watson, widow of Arthur K. Watson, former chairman of the IBM World Trade Corporation and Ambassador to France under President Nixon, was married yesterday to Stuart Symington, former Democratic Senator from Missouri.

title: Hers
description: TRYING to define exactly how Hawaii is different from California, I keep coming up with the weather, though during certain seasons the weather isn't all that different.In l967, my husband, Earll, and I left Berkeley in despair over the war. Our Hiends, retreating from the barricades, too, were starting communes in the northern California woods. They planned to build and filant, marry and have babies, as if the United States were out of Vietnam.

title: Miss Krupsak, Softening Stand, May Endorse the Carey Ticket
description: ALBANY, June 14  Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak indicated today that she would nct challenge the renomination of Goverhor Carey, would not iun for any elective office this year and might even endorse the ticket she refused to run on.

title: JAPAN AND CHINA SET NEW TALKS ON TREATY
description: TOKYO, June 14  Japan and China agreed today to resume negotiations on a peace treaty that were first proposed six years ago but were suspended in late 1975 after Japan refused to accept an antisoviet hegemony clause in the treaty that was sought by China.

title: Veterans Hiring Rules Retained
description: A reduction of the preference provisions has been a key part of President Carter's Civil Service revision plan.

title: Top Pop Records
description: Inese are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: Backgammon.
description: The California Open Backgammon Championships, under the direction of Sidney Jackson and George Bassman, took place this month in Los Angeles. A special feature or this event, which drew 422 players, was a double elimination format that enabled competitors who had lost a round to remain in contention.

title: Callaghan Barely Avoids Defeat in Confidence Vote
description: LONDON, June 14  Prime Minister James, Callaghan's Labor Party Government today narrowly avoided a defeat in the House of Commons that would have necessitated a general election next month.

title: Guild Agrees to Resume Talks Today With The News
description: Negotiations aimed at settling the twodayold strike by news and commercial employees at The Daily News  where police and strike supporters clashed last night  were scheduled to get under way this afternoon, a top union official announced early this morning..Strike supporters threw bottles and eggs as Daily News. trucks pulled out last night under police protection.

title: Carew Off Trade Market
description: Calvin R. Griffith, president of the Minnesota Twins, yesterday withdrew Rod Carew, baseball's top hitter, from. the trading market. The baseball trath, ing deadline is midnight tonight; Pacific oast time. Page B21.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Interest rates in the corporate bond market declined somewhat yesterday as investment bankers bid more ag. gressively after last week's successful sales.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matteit
description: I have two brief statements to make before I answer questions.

title: Sea Lice Kill Connecticut Salmon
description: NEW MARLBORO, Mass., June 14 (AP)  Fish experts hope a new chemical arriving this week will halt an infestation of bloodsucking fish lice that threatens efforts to bring Atlantic salmon back to the Connecticut River.

title: Carter Seeks Plan To Avert Threats To Press Freedom
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Vice Presidgnt Mondale, in a speech tonight to an audience of journalists, said that President Carter had asked for a review of all iroposed legislation involving First Amendment rights with the objective of constructing procedures to guarantee protection of such rights.

title: Coalition in House Seeks Meeting With Carter: on Military Base Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Tune 14 (UPI)Agroup of representatives from the Northeast and Middle West said today that they wanted to discuss with President Carter planned ctitbaCks in military bases that they contended would hit their regions harder than they would the Sun Belt.

title: Man Killed in Missouri Fire
description: LUTESVILLE, Mo., June 14 (AP)  An explosion and fire killed one man and the Bollinger County Sheriff's office said. It was believed that the fire started at a gasoline distributorship, The authorities injured four other persons here today, said that David Lee Cook, 26 years old, was killed when a duplex across the street from gasoline holding tanks collapsed in flames.

title: Bertha J. Diggs, 66, a Pioneer In State Post Under Gov. Dewey
description: Bertha J. Diggs, the first black and first woman to be named Secretary of the New York State Department of Labor, died last Thursday in the Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center after a short illness. She was 66 years old and lived at 818 Lincoln Place, Brooklyn.

title: Times Planning Test of Edition
description: The New York Times announced yesterday that this Sunday It would begin a sixday marketresearch project in which &modified edition of the newspaperprepared in New York will be distributed to about 1,200 homes in the Chicago, Cleveland and Detroit areas.

title: 16 Hours of Light Each Day Raises Cows Milk Flow
description: Dairy cows exposed to 16 hours of light daily give as much as three and a half more quarts of milk a day than do similar cows exposed to shorter or longer periods of illumination, researchers at Michigan State University have found.

title: U.S. Aide Dubious on Bonn Talks
description: PARIS, June 19  Leaders of industrialized nations will set no specific growth targets at next month's sevencountry economic summit meeting in Bonn, either for individual countries participating or far the group as whole, according to a senior American official.

title: JapanSouth Korea Oil Treaty Ratified
description: TOKYO, June 14  The Japanese Parliament today ratified the controversial treaty signed by Japan and South Korea in 1974 on the joint development of continental shelf oil and natural gas resources lying between their shores and the East China Sea.

title: CHICANO GROUP SEEKS BROADER RECOGNITION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 14  The growing presence and power of MexicanAmerican and other Hispanics was underscored here yesterday at the 10th anniversary celebration of the MexicanAmerican Legal Defense and Education Fund.

title: Butcher Block Care
description: WHILE the wood In butcher block table or counter top is dead, so to speak, it still retains some of its plantlike qualities and cannot be put in a corner and forgotten. It responds to good care like a living organism; the price of neglect is cracks and dull dried wood.

title: Atlanta Couple Scales Down to 12 Rooms
description: ATLANTA ONCE upon a time, Virginia and Alfred Kennedy lived in house so big that when Mrs. Kennedy was on one side and the telephone rang on the other side, the maid would tell the caller, She's cross town.

title: Retired Detectives Honor 10 of News Media for Performance
description: The Retired Detectives Association honored 10 news reporters and photographers yesterday for accurate and understanding coverage of police, activities,. or fin. assisting the police in the performance of their duty.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, The Times reported incorrectly Monday that the United States Civil Service Commission would investigate alleged improprieties in the hiring and promotion practices of the police department in Dayton, Ohio. In fact, the charges will be investigated by Civil Service Commission personnel retained by the City of Dayton.

title: Bratigs
description: HAFTDr. David. Temple Israel of New Rochelle records with sorrow the death of its cherished member and extends Its heartfelt sympathy to the family.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I tried to hang items on a brick wall in my apartment using the special nails sold for masonry work in hardware stores. The nails go in, but they are not stable and tend to loosen. Is there anything besides cement, which I cannot buy in small enough quantities, to fill the holes and hold the nails as well?  A.C.L., New York City.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing errur, The Times reported incorrectly Monday that the United States Civil ServiceCommission would investigate alleged, improprieties in the hiring and promotion practices of the police department. in Dayton, Ohio. In fact, the charges will be investigated by Civil Service Commission personnel retained by the City of Dayton.

title: Porn Free
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  In Octotier 1976, at a political fundraising luncheon, Congressman Andrew Young told Joan Thevis, wife of a jailed pornographer, I thought your husband got a bum rap.

title: Biology, Not Regulation, Controls Food Supply
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  Food prices, especially for meat, are the most volatile element in the Consumer Price Index, but there is little left that either President Carter or the American farmer can do to check inflationary pressure any time soon. More than 90 percent of the average American's food budget is spent on beef, pork and poultry, and it is primarily the cost of these that is pushing up the price index. The President's problem is that only increases in their supply can check those rises, and here biology will outweigh any jawboning by Mr. Carter or Robert S. Strauss, his special counselor on inflation.

title: NEW YORK PICKING UP NEW SENATE SUPPORT FOR LONGTERM HELP
description: WASHINGTON, June 14  A major shift in favor of broader Federal aid for New York City appeared today to have taken place in the Senate Banking Committee, with a majority of the committee members reportedly prepared to vote for longterm credit assistance when the panel convenes tomorrow.

title: Fabian of Scotland Yard Dies at 77
description: LONDON, June 14  Robert Fabian, who as head of Scotland Yard's Flying Squad became one of Britaintp bestknown detectives, died today in a hospital in Epsom, Surrey. He was 77 years old.

title: Dance: American Machine Revives Broadway Hits
description: THERE'S nothing wrong with the blueprint for the American Dance Machine. And the machine itself, for the most part, perks merrily along. (Oh yes, the mathine sometimes grinds relentlessly.) But let's keep that remark within parentheses. For most of the time, the machine is perky.

title: New Car Sales Rise 2.2%
description: DETROIT, June 14  Sales of domestic new cars continued to show strength, the industry reported today, rising 2.2, percent during the first 10 days of June and breaking an industry record set last year for the period.

title: Begin Causes Stir With Decision to Rest
description: TEL AVIV, June 14  Prime Minister Menachem Begin will rest in his Jerusalem residence until the weekly Cabinet meeting on Sunday, his aides said today. The news, which followed press reports, officially denied, that Mr. Begin's physical condition prevented him from functioning properly, heightened speculation about his health.

title: Horizon Press Wins Book Prize
description: The 1977 CareyThomas Award for most distinguished project of book publishing in the last year has been conferred on Horizon Press for its edition of Frank Lloyd Wright's An Autobiography. The smnual award, sponsored by Publishers Weekly, will be presented today to Ben Raeburn, Horizon's president and editor, at the Algonquin Hotel.

title: House Bans Raises For Its Members And Cuts Expenses
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  The House voted late tonight to ban costofliving raises for Congressmen, judges and any other Federal officials making more than $47,500 a year and to cut their own expense allowances by 5 percent.

description: 69 A.M., WKCR. Robert Browning Ovetture, Ives; Symphony 1. Beeson: Concord Sonata, Ives; String Quartet 1, Foss.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Vladimir Kagan, one of the bestknown names in custom furniture, has decided to make his designs available more people. His new massproduced line for the Preview Furniture Company, while far from cheap, is, shall we say, more attainable: A customer can walk into W & Sloane's and buy it with no decorator required. The line. called Multiples, includes multilevel seating, a glasstop extension table, a lacquered buffet, upholstered dining chairs and a onearmed chaise longue that appears float on a Plexiglas base. The most interesting group the multilevel seating, Omnibus. It embodies a favorite Kagan concept, interior landscaping, that offers variety of pieces to be arranged in any number of ways. In the Omnibus group, for example, are a curved corner sofa, armless chairs, an ottoman, a highlow unit (which has seating on two levels) and a chaise that can be slipped part way under, the higher level for seating, then pulled out fully for service as a guest bed. Some of the pieces are on casters; others are on Plexiglas bases. Sloane's is showing the set in offwhite velvet, but other fabrics are available. Prices start at about $600 for an ottoman. And, of course, a customer can buy as many or as few pieces as fit into the room  or the budget.

title: Gaming Stock Surge Continues.
description: Casinorelated stocks, Wall Street's favorite group recently, made sharp gains yesterday, but for most of the market price.changes were minor.

title: Arabs Vary Investing  Warily
description: WASHINGTON  Cautious and conservative are the buzz words on Arab investments in the United States.

title: Home Beat
description: WONDER of wonders, Betty Friedan now selling sheets? Surely our eyes deceive us. But what is this? Her familiar feminist countenance smiling out of a Wamsutta sheet sales brochure. What edification lies in store for all those sheet salesmen across the country when they open up their mail and receive Wamsutta's small but arresting venture into sociology and the proposed equal rights amendment.

title: About New York
description: Two floors below Perry Belmont Duryea's triumphant Republican convention lay dozens of coffins on display, at least 40 of them, their lids yawning in shades of pastel like rows of delegates saturated in rhetoric.

title: North Stars, Barons Merge in N.H.L.
description: MONTREAL June 14  The Cleveland Barons and Minnesota North Stars have agreed to combine their starting teams for the 197879 season, the National Hockey League governors announced today. As a result, the N.H.L. will be reduced to 17 teams.

title: Partner Says doe Silenced 3
description: MINEOLA, L.I., June 15The dissident minority partner of the New York Islanders charged today.that Roy Boe, the team's president, had paid an exorbitant sum to buy out three other partners to keep them from revealing Boe's wrongs.

title: Ballet: Cubans and Fans at High Pitch
description: IT wasn't surprising that Alicia Alonso's fans went wild over her White Swan pas de deux with the National Ballet of Cuba at the Metropolitan Opera House Wednesday night.But the sight of women of all ages in the audience springing to their feet after a bravura display of male cheesecake in a work called Canto Vitil was something else.

title: ELLEN KURZMAN
description: Ellen Kurzman, an architect known for her work in residential remodeling, died of cancer Wednesday in her home in the Georgetown section of Washington.She was 45 years old.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAHAMRoy, E.The Board of Trustees and Administration of Yr Shiva University are deeply saddened at the passing of the beloved brother of Daniel Abraham, Cloths ouished supporter and Fellow of the Rabbi Issac Elchanan Theological Seminary.May the bereaved family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem.

title: COMMODITIES
description: CHICAGO, June 15 (AP)  Concern about domestic sugar policy and delays in ratifying the International Sugar Agreement spurred selling today that pared world sugar futures to lifeofcontract lows.

title: Man Killed in Restaurant
description: A unidentified man was fatally shot, apparently in a dispute early this morning at the Fertile Earth Restaurant on Second Avenue near 84th Street, the police reported.They said the assailants, two men, fled in a black Buick Electra.

title: Business People
description: Roderick M.Hills, former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission who became chairman of the Peabody Coal Company, resigned the post yesterday after less than a year on the job.Sources close to Peabody said that Mr.Hills had never moved to St. Louis, the company's headquarters, and ihat the commuting to and from Washington had become a tremendous physical burden.

title: U.S.COOL TO EAST'S OFFER AT TROOP TALKS IN VIENNA
description: VIENNA June 15 The American delegation to the EastWest talks on troop reductions said today that the Warsaw Pact had made a proposal of questionable practical value last week in calling for equal limits on the military forces of the two sides in Central Europe.

title: Statement Is Released On Wilderness Areas
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (UPI)The United States Forest Service today released a draft environmental statement, with a tendency toward development, in its effort to determine uses for 62.1 million acres of undeveloped areas in the National Forest.System.

title: Film: Another Snap of 'Jaws':The Great White Redux
description: UNTIL great white sharks learn how to fly or use automatic weapons or develop their powers of telekinesis, it would seem that "Jaws 2" has pretty much exhausted the cinematic possibilities of sharks as man-eating monsters.Watching the new film, which opens at the Cinerama 1 and 2 and other theaters today and is, of course, a spin-off from the phenomenally successful 1975 movie, one quickly realizes that there's only a fixed amount of excitement that can be generated by the sight of a $2 million mechanical shark upsetting sailboats, nipping the legs of swimmers or even swallowing victims whole, without even a burp.One also longs for the talent and discipline of Steven Spielberg, who directed the original film and knows how to use a motion picture camera, something that is not at all evident in the work of Jeannot Szwarc, the young man who directed "Jaws 2." The screenplay, based on some of Peter Benchley's original characters, is something of an impediment, being about nothing at all except another batch of shark attacks that upset life at Amity, which is supposed to be a Long Island resort community though it often resembles Florida.A worried, ill-tempered-looking Roy Scheider reprises his role as the Amity police chief, along with Lorraine Gary as his wife and Murray Hamilton as Amity's smarmy, always-wrong mayor. Most of the rest of the cast are teenagers, young men and young women, all of whom look enough alike as to make it virtually impossible to remember which kid has been gobbled up in what sequence. Not that it matters much.Some of the action sequences have been well staged, but they've been dropped into the film so indiscriminately that "Jaws 2" never builds to a particular climax. It simply drones on and on and on, like a television movie.Someone also made a mistake in showing us so much of the mechanical shark so early in the film. One of the canny decisions in "Jaws" was the withholding of such visual information until near the end, by which time suspense had overwhelmed logic to such an extent that our imaginations were in league with the movie makers'. The shark in "Jaws 2" looks like something one might ride at Disneyland."Jaw 2," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), contains some mildly vulgar language and a number of scenes showing children in jeopardy, but the violence is mostly implied and bloodless.

Arnold Palmer is 48 years old now.He hasn't won a tournament on the PGA Tour since 1973 and he isn't likely to win the United States Open this week.But that's not important.

title: Economic Scene
description: PHILADELPHIA A burst of United States growth at a 9 percent annual rate in the second quarter will be among the largest we have seen in the last years. But it will be followed by an economic slowdown, although no recession, for the next two years, concomitant with a gradual reduction in the unemployment rate and a sustained rate of inflation near 7 percent through 1980.

title: Art: The Conversion Of Social Photos
description: ONE of the most mysterious occurrences in the life of art is the process by which objects consciously designed to serve a particular purpose, especially a useful or committed purpose, are sooner or later convertedeither deliber ately or inadvertentlyinto their opposites.An artist may be committed to a particular social cause, for example, and conceive of his work as faithfully serving it, yet posterity may care little or nothing for the cause and still honor the work, finding in it esthetic qualities that are now given priority over the original 'content.

title: When Inflation and Safety Collide
description: Disputes over health and environmental standards have usually pitted business interests against environmental forces.Industry spokesmen stress the cost cleaning up the workplace or the countryside while environmental groups demand the maximum possible protection  and hang the expense.Now.however. new tactor has entered the regulatory equation.President Carter and his top economic advisers, concerned about inflation, are pressing the regulatory agencies pay more attention to the effect of their rules on the cost of doing business.That pressure could be salutary if it leads regulators to devise more economical approaches.But antiinflation zeal must be measured against the value of legitimate efforts to protect health and safety.

title: Restaurants
description: AMONG the lively new additions to the Columbus Avenue restaurant scene, the recently reopened Indian Oven is one of the more pleasant and interesting.Originally opened in 1976, the Indian Oven's housekeeping and cooking left much to be desired in its first incarnation. But after a fire destroyed the building which housed the restaurant, the Indian Oven was completely redesigned and refurbished and is now compactly smart, sparkling white and modern, and serves entertaining food at moderate prices.

description: The Ludwig family, which founded the Tenna Corporation, manufacturer of automotive accessories and sound systems, in 1945, intends to wage proxy fight to regain control of the company.

title: Bluefish Big Jersey Lure
description: AREA AThe big catch along the New Jersey coastline is bluefish.Blues are abundant five to seven miles offshore.John Herron's Black Fin returned to Captain Andy's Marina in Margate with 73 blues weighing up to 12 pounds, which were taken by three fishermen with umbrella rigs at Avalon Shoals.Ray Mandel's Raycon reported a catch of 42 blues in the Stone Beds; eight miles off Great Egg Inlet.Inshore, blues are being caught with bucktails and Hopkins lures.Blues from eight to 10 pounds are plentiful on Barnegat Ridge, Manasquan Ridge and the Tolten. Captain Ray McNab's Miss Michele, with eight aboard, pulled in 240 blues yesterday, using cut bunkers.Fluke have been responding to squid and minnows at Longport, Newgate, Point Pleasant and in Barnegat Inlet.

title: BLACK CHURCH NEWSPAPER IS BANNED IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 15 The South African Directorate of Publications today banned a churchbacked newspaper foi blacks, The Voice, that had begun to move into the void created when another black paper.The World, was banned in a security crackdown last October.

description: The role of Marxism in universities is only slightly less obscure than the role of universities in Marxism, but perhaps some light can be shed on both subjects by examining Marx's littleknown response to an ancient Rcman myth.

description: ARLO GUTHRIE was reminiscing.I loved the old folk festivals, he said..By old he meant the outdoor gatherings of the 1960's where you heard all kinds of musicmusic from down South, from across the seas, from all over.

title: Publishing: Fast on The Typing Finger
description: LESLIE WALLER is a quick man with a word.He turned in the manuscript of a goodsized suspense novel, Trocadero to his publisher, Delacorte, last spring and coinciding with the publication of that novel, has handed in a 1,300page manuscript of another novel, The Brave and the Free. It's a work that centers on the period from the assassination of John F.Kennedy to the resignation of Richard M.Nixon.

title: Topics
description: A historic moment came and went almost unnoticed in the House of Representatives the other day.There weren't even many yawns since only 16 of the people's representatives were present as the House went on the air live for the first time.The enthusiasm of the broadcasters, too, was exceedingly well contained.Only a single network carried the proceedings, as live as they were, and then only for five minutes.

title: Parents of Handicapped Students Plan Drive Against StateAid Cut
description: TRENTON, June 15  Parents and teachers of handicapped children were preparing today for a last, major effort to prevent a $27 million cut in state aid for seducational programs for the handicapped that has been recommended by Goyernor Byrne.

title: Spain Seems to Look to Younger Generation for Leaders
description: MADRID, June 15One year ago, Spaniards began the political transformation of their country by casting their ballots in freedom for the first time in four decades.On this first anniversary of their democracy, it seems to at least one thoughtful Spaniard that what is occurring, beyond the obvious political changes, is a transfer of power from one generation to another.
