description: Another board room bastion has fallen. The Illinois Bell Telephone Company yesterday named a woman, the first in the company's history, to its board of directors. She is Esther Ruth Rothstein, a partner in the Chicago law firm of McCarthy & Levin for 22 years. Miss Rothstein also was the first woman president of the Chicago Bar Association, a post she is giving up this week.

title: Around the Nation
description: OTTAWA, Kan.; June 19 (UPDRescue workers, emotionally and physically drained from two days of pulling bodies. from muddy Lake Pomona, said today that the 15th victim of the state's worst boating disaster might be pinned to the lake floor by debris.

title: Joan Little Indicted For Prison Escape
description: RALEIGH, N.C., June 18 (UPI)Joan Little was indicted by a Wake County grand jury today in connection with her escape last October from the women's prison in North Carolina.

title: U.S Agents Arrest Plumber on Charges of Peddling Pipe Bombs
description: Two men lounged on the grass in Riverside Park yesterday as a man with a shopping bag walked past to keep an appointment at 80th Street and Riverside Drive. In the bag, the police said, were five eightinch pipe bombs, and when Charles F. Brown, aged 25, offered to s211 them for $650, he was arrested.

title: U.S. AND CANADA MOVE TOWARD FISHING PACT
description: OTTAWA, June 19Canada indicated today that it would be willing to accept a stepbystep removal of the ban it had placed on American fishing boats in Canadian waters.

title: Niels Onstad, Shipowner Who Gave An Art Museum to Norway, at 69
description: OSLO, Norway, June 19 (AP)Niels Onstad, a shipowner and art collector who with his late wife, Sonja Henie, gave Norway a multimilliondollar art center, died Saturday, newspapers here reported today.

title: VANCE URGES EFFORT BY U.S AND RUSSIANS TO REDUCE TENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 19Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the Carter Administration would bend our efforts to expand cooperation with the Soviet Union. He urged that both Washington and Moscow put polemics aside and concentrate on the concrete actions we both can take to reduce tensions and to reach agreement on the critical issues now under negotiation.

title: THE REAPPEARANCE OF THE CHRIST
description: This book explores the imminent reappearance of the Christ, world Teacher and universal Presence, known by other names in different religions and awaited by all.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Rondo in D, (K. 485), Mozart; Fugue in E flat (St. Anne), Bach; Silent Woods, Adagio for Cello and Orchestra, Dvorak; Largo from Xerxes, Handel; Four Galliards, Dowland; Musk from I Vespri Siciliani, Verdi.

title: 3 Americans Advance In Tchaikovsky Contest
description: MOSCOW, June 20 (AP)  Three Americans were among 28 young pianists selected by judges today to advance to the second round of the international Tchaikovsky musical competition, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency.

title: Dance: Miss Myerson
description: THE dance boom continues on its happy, heedless way. One odd effect it appears to have had is the raising of production standards to some degree. These days there seem to be fewer pages torn from dancers diaries and presented as finished work to an assembly of friends and a hapless critic or two. But the tradition lives.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: NEW YORK, writes Bernice Schechter, is indeed the fashion center of the world.

title: Nazis Backed on Rally in Chicago; Move Could Avert Skokie March
description: CHICAGO, June 20In a move that could lead to the cancellation of the Nazi march scheduled for Sunday in Skokie, a Federal district judge here today ordered the Chicago Park District to allow the rightwing group to demonstrate in Marquette Park on July 9.

title: VANCE CALLS POLICY ON AFRICAN POSITIVE
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the Administration would not simply mirror Soviet and Cuban activities in Africa but would persist with a positive policy aimed at helping African nations resolve their problems.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: ACF Industries Inc., which man ufactures and leases railroad cars and makes auto equipment, has elected Alfred L. Huff vice presidentcorporate planning.

title: Money Rates
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 20, 1978

title: Police Kill an Escaped Murderer As He Fires at Posse in Brooklyn
description: Donald Wiggins, a murderer who escaped May 30 from the state prison at Ossining, N.Y., and eluded the state police after an exchange of gunfire in Brooklyn last Thursday, was killed in a shootout yesterday at a housing project in the borough's East New York section.

title: KOCH MOVES TO EASE NEIGHBORHOOD STRIFE
description: Mayor Koch appointed a toplevel committee on intergroup relations under Deputy Mayor Herman Badillo yesterday to study and recommend strategies to reduce racial, religious and ethnic tensions in the city.

title: Report in Bonn Urges Tax Cuts
description: BONN, June 20 (Reuters)  An influential report, handed to the press today in a move that angered the Government, proposes that West Germany should cut taxes to speed up economic growth that, it says, is slower than officially predicted.

title: Company Earnings Reports
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 20 (AP)President John Wrathall of Rhodesia opened the annual session of Parliament today with a renewed pledge that black majority rule will replace five decades ot white government by the end of the year.

title: Ballet: Cubans Try Feet at Comedy
description: MONDAY was comedy time at the Metropolitan Opera House where the Ballet of Cuba presented a new program with several premieres.

title: Vietnam Attacks China on Closing Of 3 Consulates
description: HONG KONG, June 20  Vietnam charged today that China's closing of the three Vietnamese consulates in southern China was part of a disastrous policy by Peking that included support for Cambodia in its border war with Vietnam.

title: Mets Win On Espinosa 4Hitter, 30
description: A letter from a baseball fan typed on yellow paper and posted on the wall in the Mets dressing room read: Tell that guy Espinosa to stop aiming the ball and start throwing low, outside fastballs. He's aiming it, and the hitters ate killing him.

title: The Israeli Hieroglyphics
description: When it comes to thinking ahead to peace, the lowest common denominator in Israel is very meager indeed. Asked two narrow, critical questions by the United States, the Israelis have come up divided even on a vague 109word reply. It says merely that five years after formal peace, Israel would talk again with unnamed parties about the West Bank and Gaza. The subject would be the nature of future relations concerning the disputed territories, and the participants could include Arab representatives elected in the years of Israeli dominance in those regions. Small wonder that Israeli diplomats are having to speak thousands of words to explain what the hundred mean.

title: Nassau Police Seek Data in Girl's Killing
description: MINEOLA, L.I., June 20The Nassau County police asked the public today for information about a spade and a freshly dug hole near where the body of a 13yearold girl was found last week.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Interest rates climbed yesterday as the credit markets speculated that the Federal Reserve would soon tighten monetary policy after yesterday's policysetting Open Market Cgmmittee meeting in Washington.

title: An Outerbridge Crosses His Father's Bridge Free
description: PERTH AMBOY, N.J., June 20This was the first freebie we ever got in 50 years, Kenneth B. Outerbridge said today after he was aiiowed to cross the Outerbridge Crossing into State?? Island without paying the S1.30 toll.

title: China Hails Koch Trade Bid
description: TOKYO, June 20 (UPI)  China has welcomed New York City's invitation to hold bilateral exhibitions and promised to give serious consideration to increasing trade with the city, a New York businessman said today.

title: Sofa Safety Plan
description: How do you protect sofas from burning cigarettes and how do you get the Government to approve your plan? The nation's upholstered furniture industry thinks it knows and is proceeding with its own program without waiting for the approval of the United States Product Safety Commission.

title: Petitions for Krupsak and Bloom Circulate for the Sept. 12 Primary
description: Two potential Democratic challengers of Governor Carey's renomination began circulating designating petitions yesterday to qualify for the Sept. 12 primary.

title: Two Experts at Passman Hearing Disagree on His Trial Capability
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)Two coauthors of a book on mental diseases disagreed on the witness stand today on whether former Representative Otto Passmen was competent to stand trial an conspiracy and bribery charges.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Officials of the New Jersey Water Company declared the water in a southeastern part of Somers Point safe for drinking, saying that discoloration was caused by illegallyopened fire hydrants. Shore Memorial Hospital reported the discoloration about 7 P.M. Monday and residents were cautioned by the police and local officials not to bathe in or drink the water. Yesterday the cornpany said that the slimy water that came out of faucets was the result of rust being flushed into the water supply when hydrants were opened.

title: Excerpts From the Address by Secretary Vance on the U.S. Policy Toward Africa.
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Following are excerpts from a speech in Atlantic City today on African policy by secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance:

title: Con Schmidt Joins Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 20  Con Schmidt, assistant coach of the Pennsylvania hockey team when Penn ended its hockey program this spring, was named to the same post at Princeton today. He is 28 years old and son of Milt Schmidt, former Boston Bruin general manager and coach. He captamed the Brown team in the 197071 season.

title: 25 Ways to Cut Costs of Eating
description: TO the list of grim certainties that includes death and taxes, add the equally inevitable news that food prices will go nowhere but up, at least in the foreseeable future. Anyone interested in coping with this in an extreme way might go on a permanent diet and eat half of the usual daily amount of food or limit eating to a single meal a day. Others might choose to fast one day a week. Most of us, however, would prefer more moderate means, and a few suggestions follow:

title: Critic Asks Sadat to Face Inquiry
description: LISBON. June 20 (Reuters)Egypt's Ambassador to Portugal, Lieut. Gen. Saad Eddin elShazli, challenged President Anwar elSadat today to appear before an international or interArab committee to reply to accusations he made yesterday against the Egyptian leader.

title: Five Companies Are Picked to Use Electric Vehicles in Federal Test
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)The Energy Department announced today the selection of five companies in California, New York, New Jersey and Florida to use electric vehicles in a Government demonstration project.

title: STUDIES ON NUTRITION SHOW BRAINDIET LINK
description: BETHESDA, Md., June 20The effects of diet on the human brain and of the brain on human diet constitute a highly promising area for future research in nutrition, scientists said at a national conference that ended here today.

title: State Denies Citizenship To Filly
description: MINEOLA, Li., June 20The State Supreme Court denied New York citizenship today to a filly born in this state, but bred in Old Kentucky.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I recently read an account of a very fancy, 12course dinner and a trou du milieu was listed as one of the courses. Can you explain this?

title: Vallario Leads Qualifiers
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J., June 20Don VaHario of Spring Brook, Dick Howell of Newton and Ron Regner of Gallopping Hill, an amateur, carded oneunderpar 72's at the Braidburn Country Club today to lead 23 Central Section qualifiers into the New Jersey State open July 12.

title: Levitt Says He Will Freeze Millions in State Funds For Cooperative Education
description: ALBANY, June 20State Comptroller Arthur Levitt said today that he would freeze millions of dollars intended for the state's.Boards of Cooperative Edu.cption Services because they had extended their activities beyond what the Legislature intended.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Taking the Wheel

title: Personal Health
description: ALTHOUGH he has lived in Minnesota, the land of 10,000 lakes, for all his 46 years, Don P. never learned to swim. Nonetheless, last summer he decided to join his family on an innertube trip down a Wisconsin river. Suddenly, a woman near him fell off her tube and began floundering in the churning water. Don leapt to her rescue and quickly lost his footing on the slippery rocks. He was in water only chest high; but he could not right himself. If not for an alert bystander who dived in to help, both Don and the woman would probably have drowned.

title: Old Clothing for Men
description: More and more men are spending their Saturday mornings prowling through cluttered antiqueclothing shops looking for old clothes made, worn and discarded before they were born. As the interest in antique clothes grows, these new converts, oldclothes conscious for the first time, are braving what has traditionally been a woman's world.

title: Correction
description: The list of ingredients for Eggplant Creole last week, inadvertently omitted the need forone to two teaspoons of finely chopped garlic.

title: Brown Leaves Joint Chiefs Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)Gen. George S. Brown, who learned four months ago that he had cancer, stepped down today as chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. A retirement ceremony will be held June 30. He will be replaced by Gen. David C. Jones of the Air Force, who has been acting chairman.

title: Tax Cesdit Fervor Rises With Tuitions
description: BOSTON, June 17The waiting is hard for Maura Shannon.

title: Duryea, in an Upstate Swing, Tells Of Effort to Get Woman on Ticket
description: COLONIE, N.Y., lune 20While two of the three men who are running with him stood by smiling bravely, Perry B. Duryea explained at length and often today how he had tried in vain to get a woman on the ticket.

title: Diplomat Wounded in East Berlin Is Reported to Be Recovering
description: EAST BERLIN, June 20 [Reuters]A West German diplomat injured yesterday in an exchange of gunfire between East German policemen and a Soviet Army deserter was reported today to be recovering in a hospital.

title: ELIGIBILITY ALTERED FOR URBAN AID PLAN
description: ATLANTA, June 20The Carter Administration disclosed today that it had altered the eligibility criteria for its proposed national development bank to prevent its use by wealthy suburbs.

title: FreeTrade Bank Bill Is Signed
description: ALBANY, June 20  Governor Carey took the first step today in a campaign to get the Federal Reserve Board to approve the establishment of a banking freetrade zone in New York City.

title: Youth Is Charged in Slaying
description: WENATCHEE, Wash., June 20 (AP)The police charged a teenager today with the rapeslaying of a 95yearold woman three years ago. He was 11 when the crime occurred. An autopsy at the time showed that the victim, Mahilda Sloan, was sexually attacked and then beaten to death with Ed blunt instrument. Her assailant crawled into her bedroom through an unlocked window, the police said.

title: Last Food for Thought: A Lagniappe
description: Fine words butter no parsnips. Or so, at least, I was admonished by one of the more trenchant critics of my previous forays into the world of the kitchen. His reminder was salutary, and should, doubtless, be inscribed in letters of gold over the door of every business school In the country.

title: Socialist Party Seeks to Jail Bell if He Fails to Release Informer Files
description: Attorneys for the Socialist Workers Party filed a motion yesterday to hold Attorney General Griffin B. Bell in contempt of court and to imprison him until he releases Government files on 18 informers.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day yesterday on a battle to take over Husky Oil Ltd. incorrectly identified Husky as a new client of Kekst & Company, a public relations concern. Actually, the new client is PetroCanada.

title: The Yellow Brick Road in Congress
description: New Yorkers, having become skilled observers of fiscal hocuspocus, may be acidly amused. Californians, having rocked the country with their recent vote for tax relief, should be incredulous. And taxpayers everywhere are likely to be at least amazed by the handiwork of the House Public Works and Transportation Committee. The members, wellschooled at giving out a $150million bridge here or a $200,000environmental study there, have now outdone themselves.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
description: SUPPORT THE FRESH AIR FUND

title: Town Houses Amid Honeysuckle Challenge Suburbs
description: BALTIMOREOne city's bold experiment in holding onto the middle class is being played out amid locust trees and honeysuckle on a rolling tract just minutes from the downtown of this old port on the Patapsco.

title: Turner, Testifying in Snepp Case, Says Book by ExAgent Has Hurt C.I.A.
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., June 20Adm. Stansfeld Turner, the Director of Central Intelligence, said in Federal District Court here today that damage had already been done to Central Intelligence Agency by the unauthorized publication of Decent Interval, a book about the fall of Saigon, and that even more could result unless the Government wins its civil suit against the author, Frank W. Snepp 3d.

title: Police Kill an Escaped Murderer As He Fires at Posse in Brooklyn
description: Donald Wiggins, a murderer who escaped May 30 from the state prison at Ossining, N.Y., and eluded the state police after an exchange of gunfire in Brooklyn last Thursday, was killed in a shootout yesterday at a housing project in the borough's East New York section.

title: BalingWire Shortage Aside, It's a Beautiful Springtime in Oklahoma
description: CLAREMORE, Okla., June 18  Early this spring, just as the last icy puddles were giving way to the first promise of greenery, George Moore climbed into his pickup truck and started down the long dirt road from his farm to collect his first consignment of baling wire.

title: Wine Talk
description: CALIFORNIA wineries are not afraid to try anything. The winemakers have given us white cabernet sauvignon, lateharvest zinfandel, chocolate wine and lateharvest wines to match the best in Europe. Now a winery in northern California, Edmeades Vineyards, has come up with what it says is the country's first ice wine.

title: Rock: The Stones at Palladium
description: SAY what you will about the wisdom of the Rolling Stones tour itinerary this year, the band's concert at the 3,386seat Palladium. Monday night was a remarkable, inspiring evening of rockandroll. Most people who love the Stones in this area weren't able to get in. But those who did won't soon forget the experience.

title: JUDGE ALLOWS DATA IN THE CURARE CASE
description: HACKENSACK, June 20The judge in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich ruled today that the scientific tests for the detection of curare were reliable enough to be admitted as evidence.

title: An Ominous Silence
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  As a general rule, the Carter Administration has had something to say about every foreign affairs crisis anywhere in the world, even when it didn't have much to say. So when it says nothing about the Israeli Government's proposals for settling or evading the Middle East tangle, you can be sure that something unusual is going on.

title: Light Winds Delay Yachts
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 20  The Bermuda ocean race dragged on today with neither of the leaders able to complete the 635mile course from Newport, R.I., by nightfall. Two yachts from New York, Ondine and Boomerang, were about 40 miles from the finish line off St. David's Head at dusk and they had made little progress during the day because of light winds around the islands of Bermuda.

title: GroundUp Bones To Be Permitted In Certain Meats
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)The Agriculture Department said today that it would allow meat processors to grind up hardtotrim bones and include some finely ground bone in frankfurters and salami.

title: Doctors Say Moderate Drinking May Be Healthy in Some Cases
description: ST. LOUIS, June 20 (AP)One or two drinks a day may be all right, a panel of doctors agreed today at the annual meeting of the American Medical Association.

title: ADVISERS ASK CARTER TO RESTRICT HIS PLAN ON HEALTH INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  President Carter's top economic advisers are seeking to dissuade him from proposing a comprehensive national health insurance program on the ground that it would be inflationary and fail to reach desired goals.

title: SADAT STILL HOPEFUL ON PEACE INITIATIVE;
description: CAIRO, June 20President Anwar clSadat said today that, despite the noncommittal position adopted Sunday by the Israeli Cabinet on the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip, he was optimistic about his peace initiative and was ready to discuss directly any new plans that Israel will submit to get the stalled peace effort moving again.

title: Jerome Hellman to Try Directing
description: LOS ANGELES, June 20Jerome Hellman, the Academy Awardwinning producer of Midnight Cowboy, Will make his debut as a director with Promises in the Dark. Marsha Mason will star as an unmarried doctor in what Mr. Hellman describes as a contemporary story of relationships. he movie will be based on an original script by Loring Mandel.

title: Clergymen From New England Take a Short Course in Economics
description: STORRS, Conn.Every time the word profit conies up in that room, you can feel it, the Rev. William L. Inderstrodt said Monday, slowly clenching his fists as he stood outside the Economic Education Conference for Clergy in New England, of which he is an organizer. You can feel the tension.

title: Town Houses Amid Honeysuckle Challenge Suburbs
description: BALTIMOREOne city's bold experiment in holding onto the middle class is being played out amid locust trees and honeysuckle on a rolling tract just minutes from the downtown of this old port on the Patapsco.

title: Jordan Wary of Interim Role in West Bank and Gaza
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 18  Jordan, which has been proposed as a potential guarantor for the future of the Israelioccupied West Bank of the Jordan and the Gaza strip, appears unwilling to take on the role unless it is specifically asked to do so by the million Palestinian Arabs in the territories.

title: Taiwan to Speed Up Evacuation Of 1,500 Chinese From Vietnam
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 20Alarmed by the deteriorating situation of the Chinese communities in Vietnam, Taiwan has decided to speed up the evacuation of the remaining 1,500 ethnic Chinese in Ho Chi Minh City who have received Taiwan entry permits, officials said today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GOODBYE, SPRING An exotic ceremony in Sheep Meadow will welcome in summer today at dusk, around 8:30 P.M., as some 100 musicians perform a halfhour celebration in Central

title: ISAIAH O. ZUCKER
description: Isaiah O. Zucker, president of the West Side Institutional Synagogue, died Monday following heart surgery at New York University Medical Center. He was 69 years old.

title: Letters
description: In the April 12th issue of The Living Section the following verse was printed in the Metropolitan Diary column. Below it arc excerpts from several reader letters in response.

title: Albany Senate Passes Measure To Stiffen Juveniles' Sentences
description: ALBANY, June 20  The State Senate gave final passage today to legislation increasing sentences for juvenile offenders for a broader range of felony crimes than now covered.

title: Bill Broadens Damage Suits
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The House Judiciary Committee today approved, 21 to 12, and sent to the House floor a bill to permit antitrust suits and recovery of triple damages by consumers who did not purchase directly from alleged price fixers.

title: A DELICATE STANDOFF IN SOUTHERN LEBANON
description: NAQURA, Lebanon, June 20The Christian irregulars lounge near their Americanmade Sherman tank, a gift of the departed Israeli Army, under two Lebanese flags. Soldiers of the 6,000strong United Nations peacekeeping force go about their business. A Norwegianpiloted helicopter chatters to a landing near the Mediterranean.

title: Notes on People
description: ROSALYNN CARTER took polite but firm issue yesterday with derogatory remarks about Western culture made recently by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the exiled Soviet writer. Mrs. Carter, the first First Lady to address the National Press Club in Washington since Eleanor Roosevelt 90 years ago, denied that Americans are wallowing in materialism. Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn says he can feel the pressure of evil across our land, said Mrs. Carter. Well, I do not sense that pressure of evil at all. I am not a Pollyanna about the mood of the country. It's not possible to work with the mentally ill, with the elderly, with those who suffer from poverty or racism and be indifferent to the devastating stigma that is held against them. But I can tell you: The people of this country are not weak, not cowardly and not spiritually exhausted. There is a pervasive desire among Americans to live a useful life, to correct the defects in our society, and to make our nation even greater than it already is.

title: Jewelry Designs For the Younger Set
description: In Italy it's traditional to give a newborn baby of either sex a coral cornetto, a little horn, or tiny coral beads to be worn as a good luck charm. Chinese infants usually receive gold necklaces at the time of their first haircut, when they are a month old.

title: News Summary
description: American efforts for Middle East peace will be pressed, Administration officials said. They added they were determined to use Washington's influence to revive the stalled negotiations despite Israel's apparent rebuff in not specifically answering Administration questions over the future of occupied Arab lands. Officials said they would seek new approaches to resume talks. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Hi, House; Goodbye Ideals
description: SHREVEPORT, La.Anyone who has looked to buy a house on today's market knows all too well what a traumatic experience that search can be. The cost of a home has soared to incredible heights. But after spending some weeks with my wife wandering through assorted bedrooms, bathrooms and closets, it finally dawned on me that beyond the price, the buying of a house required the making of difficult political decisions.

title: KOCH MOVES TO EASE NEIGHBORHOOD STRIFE
description: Mayor Koch appointed a toplevel committee on intergroup relations under Deputy Mayor Herman Badillo yesterday to study and recommend strategies to reduce racial, religious and ethnic tensions in the city.

title: Tito, Opening Yugoslav Party Congress, Warns U.S.Soviet Conflict Could BringWar on `World Scale
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 20President Tito of Yugoslavia warned the United States and the Soviet Union today that their continued conflict threatened war not only at a local level but even on a world scale.

title: Food Aid Planned for Vietnam
description: ROME, June 20 (UPI)The United Nations World Food Program plans to send $2,4 million in aid to Vietnam, whose rice crop has been badly hurt by plant disease and pests. The organization said yesterday that the aid to Vietnam would help feed half a million people for two months.

title: Foreign Bank Influx: Hearings On Today
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The recent dramatic growth of foreign banks in the United States has left regulators and Congress grappling with increasingly complex questions about how to supervise the newcomers and policies to deal with them.

title: Albany Senate Passes Measure To Stiffen Juveniles' Sentences
description: ALBANY, June 20The State Senate gave final passage today to legislation increasing sentences for juvenile offenders for a broader range of felony crimes than now covered.

title: NATO Maps Defense of Oil Route
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 20Secretary General Joseph M.A.H. Luns of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization disclosed today that the alliance had completed plans for the defense of the sea routes around the Cape of Good Hope in South Africa. The routes are used to transport Middle East oil to the United States and Western Europe.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Doctors in Newark performed a controversial abortion following a legal challenge that threatened to topple New Jersey's restrictions on the financing of operations by Medicaid. spokesman for Newark Beth Israel Medical Center said the patient, a welfare recipient identified only as E.M., was in good condition.

title: Books of The Times
description: BIKO, By Donald Woods. Illustrated. 288 pages. Paddington Press. $10.95.

title: Casino Stocks Keep Spotlight
description: Spirited trading in the casino stocks, several of which weakened late in the session, dominated Wall Street's attention yesterday as the general market continued to give ground. Volume on the New York Stock Exchange, meanwhile, improved slightly to 27.92 million shares from Monday's 25.5 million shares.

title: Ruling Closing Hotel On West Side on Use As Bordello Upheld
description: The Appellate Division has upheld a New York State Supreme Court decision closing a sleazy Upper West Side Hotel that rents rooms to prostitutes, but it made one stipulation: The hotel is to be closed one room at a time.

title: Earnings A Record At A.T.&T.
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Company announced yesterday record earnings for the quarter ended May 31, during which profits again went over the $1 billion mark.

title: Around the Nation
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Careers
description: BY the start of 1980, about 300,000 new pilots will be taking off into the wild blue yonder, if GAMA's flight plans are correct. That is the acronym for the General Aviation Manufacturers Association, whose members produce most of the planes and equipment used by the noncommercial aircraft industry.

title: Bridge:
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 20  An American pair, Fred Hamilton of Los Angeles and John Swanson of Mission Viejo, Calif., were more than a board ahead of thtir nearest rivals going into the second semifinal session of the World Open Pair Championships here tonight. Swanson is a reigning world team champion, and Hamilton won the same title in 1976.

title: Saudi Reportedly Buys Control Of Bank Formerly Headed by Lance
description: ATLANTA, June 20 (AP)A Saudi Arabian businessman, Ghaith Pharaon, has succeeded in his bid to buy a controlling interest in the National Bank of Georgia, formerly headed by Bert Lance, The Atlanta Constitution has reported.

title: Pan Am Cuts Fare
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday a standby fare of $70, onehalf the regular coach fare, between New York and Houston starting July 1. It will also offer coach fare of $106, a 25 percent reduction over regular coach, for travelers needing a reservation or wanting to travel at the last minute.

title: Jazz: Ry Cooder Special
description: JAZZ, a specific enough word to begin with, has been subject to broader and broader interpretations over the years. But it still has some musical meaning, if only in a very general sense. It is not time, at least not yet, to begin using it as broadly as the folk and blues guitarist Ry Cooder, whose latest albumJazz includes Bahamian syncopated spirituals, a 19thcentury habanera, songs from minstrelsy and black vaudeville, and chamber arrangements of some light classical pieces composed by early jazz musicians.

title: ADM, NIKOLAI IGNATOV
description: MOSCOW, June 20 (UPI)Rear Adm. Nikolai Ignatov, a member of the sta?? of the Naval Academy, has died, the Defense Ministry newspaper, Krasnaya Zvezda, said today. The newspaper said Admiral Ignatov died suddenly hut gave no other details. A veteran of World War II, Admiral Ignatov had held a number of responsible posts, an obituary said.

title: Utility Test Of Electric Cars Is Due
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The Consolidated Edison Company and the Long Island Lighting Company were among five private companies named by the Department of Energy today to help demonstrate electricpowered vehicles as potential replacements for standard internalcombustion cars and trucks.

title: Best Buys
description: AFTER four consecutive weeks of record highs, the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City ebbed last week by eighttenths of 1 percent.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 20 (UPI)  Billie Jean King remped through her first two matches in the $75,000 Eastbourne women's grass tennis tournament today, showing her old zip. She downed another American, Mona Guerrant, 76, 61 and Renata Tomanova of Czechoslovakia, 61, 62.

title: Food Notebook: A Look at What's New
description: It had to happen. What with the growing preoccupation with health foods, it was only a matter of time until someone came along with a natural foods supermarket, complete with wide aisles, supermarketsize shopping carts and enough variety for shoppers to do an entire week's worth of grocery shopping.

title: ChrisCraft Urges F.C.C To Reject Fox Complaint
description: Arguing that there was no evidence to show it was seeking control of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation, ChrisCraft Industries yesterday asked the Federal Communications Commission to dismiss a petition by Fox concerning a presumed takeover.

title: ILLINOIS DEFENDANT LOSES APPEAL ON SIGN LANGUAGE
description: CHICAGO June 20 (UPI)The Illinois Appellate Court ruled today that the state is not required. to teach sign language to and illiterate man who can neither hear nor speak and who has twice been charged with murder.

title: Chrysler Offer Draws Orders
description: Orders for the offering had been strong before the deal was priced on Monday. But at the last moment the issue had been expanded by $100 million despite a second unfavorable rating of two new Chrysler cars on Monday.

title: JUDGE ALLOWS DATA IN THE CURARE CASE
description: HACKENSACK, ,.N.J June 20The judge in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich ruled today that the scientific tests for the detection of curare were reliable enough to be admitted as evidence.

title: Economic Scene
description: THE Carter Administration's longpending taxcut proposal is losing popularity among some private economists. The reason is quite clear: Inflation is now perceived to be a greater threat to the American economy than the likelihood of a nearterm recession.

title: Holtzman, in First Start For Cubs Is Shaky Loser
description: Ken Holtzman made his first start last night for the Chicago Cubs since Sept. 6, 1971 and hardly resembled his former self as he lost a 61 decision to the Pirates in Pittsburgh.

title: U.S. RESEARCH FUNDS HELD LIKELY TO DROP
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Government, academic and industry research leaders were told here today that they must accept a pause in the growth of Federal support.

title: Contrary to a 1977 State Law, New York City Board of Education Holds Closed Sessions
description: Despite state law and two appellatecourt rulings that explicitly require open meetings, New York City's Board of Education has been meeting behind closed doors to discuss public policies affecting the nation's largest school district.

title: World Gold
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 20, 1978

title: Todd and Stabler Offseason Game: Living It Up on Redneck Riviera
description: GULF SHORES, Ala.'Eight fiftyfour and smashed, again, explained Richard Todd after polishing off four beers, four Mai Tais and assorted sea creatures at a beachfront restaurant.

title: CARTER AND 3 ADVISERS MEET WITH CONGRESSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, June 21 (Reuters)President Carter and three of his foreign policy advisers met with a group of about 80 Senators and Representatives to discuss the Administration's views.

title: News Summary
description: American efforts for Middle East peace will be pressed, Administration officials said. They added they were determined to use Washington's influence to revive the stalled negotiations despite Israel's apparent rebuff in not specifically answering Administration questions over the future of occupied Arab lands. Officials said they would seek new approaches to resume talks. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Order for Polysius
description: Fried. Krupp GmbH of Essen, West Germany, said its American subsidiary, the Polysius Corporation of Atlanta, had received an order worth almost $15 million to build a cement factory in Dallas for the Texas Industries Cement Company. Construction is to begin this year and operations are to start in the first half of 1980.

title: Judge in the Herrin Case Rebuffs Attempt to Influence sentencing
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 20 (UPI)Judge Richard Daronco in Westchester County Court said today that he would not be swayed by a letterwriting campaign urging a harsh sentence for Richard Herrin, who was convicted of the slaying of Bonnie Joan Garland.

title: Hyde school Doing Broadway Musical
description: Students and teachers from the Hyde School, a priests secondary school in Bath, Me., will perform a musical. Roots and Wings. at 8 P.M. June 26 at the uptown Circle in the Square Theater, 1633 Broadway at 50th Street.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day yesterday on a battle to take over Husky Oil Ltd. incorrectly identified Husky as a new client of Kekst & Company, a public relations concern. Actually, the new client is PetroCanada.

title: British Climber Killed in Pakistan
description: LONDON, June 20 (Reuters)A British attempt to scale the secondhighest mountain in the world, the 28,740foot K 2 on Pakistan's border with China. has been abandoned after the death of a climber, the expedition's sponsors said here today. They said that the name of the dead climber was not yet known and that the eightman expedition was returning to Rawalpindi.

title: Money Offer to Hospitals
description: The Blue CrossBlue Shield systems will pay hospitals to close their excess beds in a move to reduce national hospital costs. Page A18.

title: An Outerbridge Crosses His Bridge, Now 50, Free
description: PERTH AMBOY, June 20This was the first freebie we ever got in 50 years, Kenneth B. Outerbridge said today after he was allowed to cross the Outerbridge Crossing into Staten Island without paying the $1.50 toll.

title: Ruling on Closing of Hotel in Use as Bordello Upheld
description: The Appellate Division has upheld a New York State Supreme Court decision closing a sleazy Upper West Side Hotel that rents rooms to prostitutes, but it made one stipulation: The hotel is to be closed one room at a time.

title: CALIFANO DENIES SEEKING A CATHOLIC MAN FOR POST
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, denied today that he ordered a divorced woman directing the White House Conference on Families to hire a white, married, Roman Catholic man as her codirector.

title: Shootout Beside the Charles
description: BOSTON, June 20In the third inning Carl Yastrzemski hit a ball seven stories high and about eight feet up the thirdbase line. Thurman Munson stripped off his mask, took a few steps to his left and waited for nature to take its course. Graig Nettles moved in from third base because he had previous engagements. Don Gullett came in from the mound to be sociable. They all watched the ball. They watched until it landed in foul territory among them.

title: Dollar Plunges in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, June 20The United States dollar plunged to another postwar low against the yen in heavy trading today, closing on the Tokyo foreign exchange market at 211.60 yen, down 4 yen from the previous close.

title: Hirschfeld Counts 75 Years and Countless Ninas
description: There's a kind of magic that takes place. I once tried to analyze it, but I'm no closer to it now than I ever was. I just keep scratching away until something happens.

title: Cyclists Vie For World Junior Titles
description: TREXLERTOWN, Pa., June 20Under clear skies, an intense sun and a persistent wind, the world's best 16 to 18 year old bicycle racers opened the junior world championships today at the Trexlertown velodrome, the first United States site for international cycling in 66 years.

title: Study Finds Foreign Executives Prefer New York
description: Foreign businessmen based in New York City prefer it over London, Paris and other American cities as their favorite place to live aind do business, according to a sampling of their opinions conducted for Touche Ross & Company, the international accounting firm.

title: Tito, Opening Yugoslav Party Congress, Warns U.S.Soviet Conflict Could Bring War on World scale
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 20President Tito of Yugoslavia warned the United States and the Soviet Union today that their continued conflict threatened war not only at a local level but even on a world scale.

title: HENRY J. KENNEDY
description: Henry J. Kennedy, senior partner of the midtown law firm of Burns, Kennedy, Schilling & O'Shea, died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 68 years old and lived in Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Ali Leaves Them Cheering in Moscow Farewell
description: MOSCOW, June 20Muhammad Ali sparred in the ring today with three Soviet heavyweight boxersand in the United States Embassy with about 100 diplomats and staffersas he prepared to wrap up his 10day stay in the Soviet Union.

title: Nazis Backed on Rally in Chicago; Move Could Avert Skokie March
description: CHICAGO, June 20  In a move that could lead to the cancellation of the Nazi march scheduled for Sunday in Skokie, a Federal district judge here today ordered the Chicago Park District to allow the rightwing group to demonstrate in Marquette Park on July 9.

title: Hurricane Triumphs
description: HOUSTON, lune 20 (AP)Dale Russell scored on a rebound from four yards out nine minutes into overtime to give the Houston Hurricane a 32 North American Soccer League victory over the Chicago Sting tonight.

title: World Cup Scoring System Called Unfair
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 20The scoring system of the World Cup soccer championship, under which a team can be eliminated without losing a game, has come under criticism trom Enzo Bearzot, the coach of the italian team.

title: JOSEPH K. ALLIGER
description: Joseph K. Alliger, a retired realestate man and mortgageinvestment bank formerly of Great Neck, L.I., died last Thursday in his home in North Miami Beach, Fla., He was 82 years old

title: MACK POSNAK, 67
description: Mack Posnak, cocaptain of the 192830 St. John's University basketball teams known as The Wonder Five, died yesterday in North Miami, Fla., after suffering a heart attack while playing golf. He was 67 years old.

title: ADVISERS ASK CARTER TO RESTRICT HIS PLAN ON HEALTH INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  President Carter's top economic advisers are seeking to dissuade him from proposing a comprehensive national health insurance program on the ground that it would be inflationary and fail to reach desired goals.

title: FORMER PROSECUTOR IN ONONDAGA INDICTED
description: SYRACUSE, June 20Jon Holcombe, a former Onondaga County District Attorney, has been indicted on charges growing out of an alleged scheme requiring assistant district attorneys to contribute part of their salaries to the Onondaga County Renublican Committee.

title: James T. Ritchie Sr., 66, Newsman Who Was With Associated Press
description: James T. Ritchie Sr., 66 years old, a retired reporter for The Associated Press, died of a heart attack yesterday in this home at 3098 Richmond Road, New Dorp, S. I.

title: For Producers, '78 Is Year of the Coat
description: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y.  Among manufacturers of women's apparel, 1978 is shaping up as the year of the coat. They are enjoying their best season in years.

title: Fatal Plunge on Park Avenue
description: A maintenance worker who fell or jumped from the 12th floor of the building at 850 Park Avenue was pronounced dead upon arrival at Bellevue Hospital yesterday afternoon. The man, whose name was withheld pending notification of his relatives, worked as a handyman in the building, which is at 77th Street.

title: Sadat Says He Is Still Optimistic On Peace Despite Israeli Response
description: CAIRO, June 20President Anwar elSadat said today that, despite the noncommittal .position adopted Sunday by the Israeli Cabinet on the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip, he was optimistic about his peace initiative and was ready to discuss directly any new plans that Israel will submit to get the stalled peace effort moving again.

title: TeenAgers on Sex: Confusion Is Clear
description: ATLANTA, June 20  Seventeenyearold Charles W. from North Carolina  or Charmin Chuck as he introduced himself during the icebreaking session  felt the pill was 90 percent effective as a means of birth control, but he had some reservations.

title: Market Place
description: THERE'S a broker who believes the shares of Pittston will move lower because the Japanese are using less American metallurgical coal than they did before a world economic downturn and the United States cut imports of Japanese steel.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Technology
description: CALVERT CLIFFS, MD. THE first visit to a nuclear power plant can be disarming, especially for the visitor who is a child of the atomic age and grew up with vivid pictures of the mushroom cloud over Hiroshima and who has seen vestiges of the horror in Nagasaki.

title: Business Records
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 20, 1978

title: Japan Will Buy 145 U.S. Planes To Expand Its Share of Defense
description: TOKYO, June 20 (AP)Japan signed a $5 billion agreement today covering the purchase of 100 F15 jet fighter planes and 45 antisubmarine patrol planes from the United states over the next 10 years, according to a spokesman for the Japanese Foreign Ministry.

title: ExChampion Beaten
description: TOKYO, June 20 (Reuters)  Guts Ishimatsu of Japan, the former World Boxing Council lightweight champion, lost a 10round split decision to Yohi Armai tonight.

title: Advertising
description: BAKER INDUSTRIES, which says it is the United States leader in smoke and fire alarm manufacture, will in September leap into the booming consumer market with all bells ringing and advertising courtesy of DKG Advertising. In 16 of the largest markets it expects to be the heaviest advertiser in its category. Spot television and regional editions of national magazines will be the primary vehicles.

title: GIFFORD WILL OPPOSE RICHMOND IN PRIMARY
description: Bernard R, Gifford, a former deputy chancellor of the New York City school system, said yesterday that he would oppose Representative Frederick W. Richmond for the Democratic nomination in the Sept. 12 primary in the 14th Congressional District in Brooklyn.

title: Rijsttafel: The Easy Feast
description: RONKONKOMA, N.Y. IT took a lady from Indonesia  a weekend resident of this town with a tonguetwisting name  to persuade me that the famed rijsttafel of her country is one of those rare and soughtafter devices for entertaining: a complete menu with dishes that are elaborately good, but most or which can be prepared a comfortable length of time before guests arrive. A menu that is not a race against time and that will, as they say in the best manuals, allow one to appear cool, calm, coherent and collected.

title: WNET Tops Goal for New Home
description: Mayor Koch visited WNET/13's future home yesterday in the Henry Hudson Hotel and expressed approval of the television house to be built with almost $13 million that the station announced yesterday that it had raised. This exceeds by $3 million the public broadcaSting station's goal under a liveyear plan begun in 1973.

title: Interning in Court
description: WASHINGTONChief Justice Warren Burger's recent proposal to establish programs at three law schools in which the third year would be devoted to an intensive course in trial ad vocacy is a useful reminder that too many lawyers cannot handle even a routine case in court.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Prices of precious metals futures eased on some late selling yesterday after a session marked by modest advanceS and retreats. One influence on the market was the Treasury's second monthly auction of 300,000 troy ounces of gold bullion. Another was the meeting of the Federal Reserve Open Market Committee, a policymaking group.

title: Earning African Friends
description: LONDON How did the Russians earn their credibility in Africa? First and foremost, because they committed themselves at an early date to the end of white supremacy in Southern Africa. When the West was still helping build up the arsenals of South Africa, Rhodesia and Portugal, the Russians provided small arms and military training for outlawed black nationalists.

title: Rs. CRITICIZES ISRAEL BUT PLANS TO PRESS FOR RENEWED TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Administration officials, after studying the Israeli Cabinet's decision on occupied territories, said today that the response to American proposals on Middle East negotiations had fallen short of American hopes and was probably inadequate to persuade President Anwar elSadat of Egypt to resume direct talks with the Israelis.

title: Kennecott Hails Final Tally
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation, fighting off a lastditch effort by the CurtissWright Corporation to vote out management, yesterday declared itself the winner in a bitter, threemonth proxy war.

title: Carter Vetoes Bill On Firefighters' Pay
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)President Carter told Congress today that he had vetoed a bill that would Increase the total hourly pay of Federal firefighters by 15 percent, far above the 5 percent pay ceiling he has recommended.

title: U.S. CRITICIZES ISRAEL BUT PLANS TO PRESS FOR RENEWED TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Administration officials, after studying the Israeli Cabinet's decision on occupied territories, said today that the response to American proposals on Middle East negotiations had fallen short of American hopes and was probably inadequate to persuade President Anwar elSadat of Egypt to resume direct talks with the Israelis.

title: VANCE CALLS POLICY ON AFRICA POSITIVE
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the Administration would not simply mirror Soviet and Cuban activities in Africa but would persist with a positive policy aimed at helping African nations resolve their problems.

title: Vietnam Attacks China on Closing Of 3 Consulates
description: HONG KONG, June 20  Vietnam charged today that China's closing of the three Vietnamese consulates in southern China was part of a disastrous policy by Peking that included support for Cambodia in its border war with Vietnam.

title: Nuclear Generation Said to Lag
description: A new study of the reliability of atomic power plants has concluded that although nuclear reactors generally performed better last year than they had before, their performance still fell significantly short of expectations. As a result, the report concluded, electricity made from nuclear fuel still tends to be more costly than electricity made from coal.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Washington

title: George H. M. Lawrence, at 67; Known Internationally as Botanist
description: Dr. George H. M. Lawrence, an internationally known botanist, died June 11 in Kent County Memorial Hospital in Warwick, R.I., at the age of 67. He lived in East Greenwich, R.I.

title: BROOKE SAYS PRESS HAS LUST FOR BLOOD
description: BOSTON, June 20Senator Edward W. Brooke lashed out today at what he called the lust for blood which has taken possession of the news media in the last weeks and appealed to Massachusetts voters to consider the details of his divorce as personal matters of no public significance.

title: Ottawa Spells Out Constitution Reform; Emphasis Is on Unity
description: OTTAWA, June 20The Federal Government made some gestures of conciliation today toward Quebec and the western provinces, Canada's most alienated regions, when it introduced a bill into the House of Commons revising the con stitution.

title: P.B.A. Drops Mailing Of Ballot on Strike
description: The mailing of ballots on the authorization of a police strike by New York City's Patrolmen's Benevolent Association has been canceled by Samuel DeMilia, the union's president.

title: Saudi Appears in Control Of Lance's Former Bank
description: ATLANTA, June 20  Ghaith R. Pharaon of Saudi Arabia apparently succeeded today in his plan to buy controlling interest in the National Bank of Georgia  the bank once headed by Bert Lance, the former Federal Budget Director.

title: 60  Minute Gourmet
description: IF I were to name the one dish that is, wherequickcooking is concerned, the most elegant and sophisticated, it would probably be the dish outlined here. It is a rack of lamb that is cooked. under the broiler to the desired degree of doneness. It is a dish that would be equally suitable at a formal dinner or at a special dinner for two or four to celebrate an occasion.

title: Miss Scanlon Eliminates Defender in Met Golf
description: COLD SPRING, L.I., June 20Youth had its fling today in the first two rounds of the 75th Women's Metropolitan Golf Association championship at Cold Spring Country Club.

title: Accounts Vary Widely on Beating Of 16YearOld Youth in Brooklyn
description: As 16yearold Victor Rhodes lay in a partial coin in Kings County Hospital yesterday, leaders of the Hasidic and black communities in Brooklyn's Crown Heights section gave widely varying accounts of the events that Jed up to his being beaten and kicked into unconsciousness last Friday.

title: Closed End Funds
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 20, 1978

title: Clergymen From New England Take a Short Course in Economics
description: STORRS, Conn.Every time the word profit mines up in that room, you can feel it, the Rev. William L. Inderstrcdt said MenGay, slowly clenching his fists as he stood outside the Eccnomic Education Comersnce for Clergy in New England, or which he is an organizer. You can feel the tension.

title: Two Researchers Held in Isolation After Exposure to Deadly Virus
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)The Army is holding two civilian researchers in total isolation on a military post after their accidental exposure to deadly lassa fever virus in a laboratory accident.

title: Hanoi Lets 25 Join Families in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The Government of Vietnam informed the Senate subcommittee on refugees today that it. would, for the first time, allow a small group of Vietnamese women and chldren who are American citizens or the spouses of American citizensto join their relatives in the United States.

title: Von Hirsch Art Sale Sets Records
description: LONDON, June 20The longawaited sale of the masterpieces collected by Robert von Hirsch began spectacularly tonight when 70 Old Master drawings and watercolors were sold for more than $5 million.

title: Pirate's Paste and Coconut Milk; Satay Ajam or Ayam (Chicken satay)
description: pound skinless, boneless chicken breast (boned weight)

title: U.S. to Study Brutality Cases
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)Attorney General Griffin B. Bell promised Hispanic members of Congress today that the Government would speed up its handling of police brutality cases against Spanishspeaking Americans. After meeting with Mr. Bell, Representative Edward R. Roybal, Democrat of California, chairman of the Congressional Hispanic caucus, said Mr. Bell's statement represented a real step forward.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 20  State investigators said today that they had filed 19 complaints against Resorts International Hotel over the way the money was being handled in its gambling casino since it opened at Atlantic City on May 26.

title: Senate Panel Told Volunteer Army Is Hurt by PoorQuality Recruits
description: WASHINGTON, June 20Two Army officers told a Congressional panel today that the allvolunteer Army was poorly equipped, badly educated, troubled by social welfare problems and often without motivation.

title: CALIFANO TO CURB DOCTORS AS BLUE CROSS DIRECTORS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)The Department of Health, Education and Welfare today proposed a regulation that would bar doctors and other health officials from dominating the boards of Blue Cross and other organizations that benefit from Government health care payments.

title: COLUMBIA PICTURES AIDE CHARGED IN EMBEZZLEMENT
description: BURBANK, Calif., June 20 (UPI)The chief accountant of Columbia Pictures' television commercialmaking division today was charged with embezzling more than $275,000 from the studio. It was the second potential financial scandal to hit the studio in recent months.

title: Dress Code Adopted
description: A dress code has been adopted. by city officials in Wildwood banning persons over the age of 12 from appearing in bahting suits in any public place except the beach.

title: Revised Figures Show No FirstQuarter Growth
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) The Government made an upward revision today in its assessment of firstquarter economic growth in the United States to a measurement showing virtually no change from 1977's final three months.

title: Litton Ends Long Fight With Navy
description: The Navy announced yesterday that it had reached a settlement with Litton Industries under which the company would absorb $200 million of the $647 million of potential losses on construction of five assault ships and 30 advanced destroyers.

title: Cartier Says It Seeks Dior
description: PARIS, June 20 (AP)  Cartier, the Internationally known jeweler, is willing to bid $65 million for the Christian Dior fashion empire, Robert Hoch, Cartier's managing director, said today.

title: U.S. Makes Loan Move
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., June 20 (AP)  The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, seeking to recover $3.7 million it will lose because of bad loans made by the defunct First Augusta Bank and Trust Company, has filed suit against 18 former directors of the bank.

title: Deaths
description: BATTCharles. The Officers and Directors of the Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America express their deep sorrow at the Passing of Charles Batt, a member of our Executive Committee and a pillar of Torah learning. May the Almighty comfort his family amono the mourners for Zion and Jerusalem.

title: RCA Head Sees a New Era for NBC
description: Edgar H. Griffiths, president of the RCA Corporation and the man who hired Fred Silverman to head the National Broadcasting Company, yesterday portrayed a new era for affiliates of NBCone in which Mr. Silverman would lead the network out of third place and in which the emerging electronic technologies that appear to be threatening the television industry would be harnessed for the industry's benefit.

title: Tulsa's Coach Is Seventh to Depart in Pro Soccer
description: For head coaches, the first half of the North American Soccer League season has been full of turbulence. Seven head coaches have resigned or been dismissed and only one of them has been hired by another of the league's 24 franchises.

title: Study Finds Foreign Executives Prefer New York
description: Foreign businessmen based in New York City prefer it over London, Paris and other American cities as their favorite place to live aind do business, according to a sampling of their opinions conducted for Touche Ross & Company, the international accounting firm.

title: I Never Met a Dollar I Didn't Like.
description: MY money problems began in the third grade. I had run up an account of $2.25 at the village soda fountain, and I had no more hope of paying it than I had of dethroning Shirley Temple.

title: Shipping/Mail
description: ARRIVING TODAY, Juno 21

title: Major Barbara At Shaw Festival
description: NIAGARAONTHELAKE, ONTARIO IN its second major production of the season, the Shaw Festival is back doing what it does best.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Gold Bids Average $187.06
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) The Government sold another 300,000 ounces of gold today at an average price of $187.06 an ounce, $6.68 an ounce higher than at the last auction.

title: Landmark Elm Felled On Capitol Grounds
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)A giant elm, which stood on the Senate side of the Capitol since at least 1868, Ras cut down and sawed into sections today, a victim of Dutch elm disease.

title: Yanks Get 7 Runs Off Torrez in 4th, Beat Red Sox, 104
description: BOSTON, June 20Mike Torrez, who treated the Yankees well by winning two World Series games for them last fall, failed to receive reciprocal treatment tonight. In fact, he suffered perhaps the ultimate indignitya grand slam home run by Fred Stanley.

title: Real Estate
description: FEW companies can afford to pay for the prestige of a Park Avenue address. Under present zoning not many sites on the avenue are left to develop, or redevelop, for office space. Under present market conditions there is little space available to rent, and there is little relief in sight from new construction.

title: Blue Cross Is Seeking to Close Hospital Beds
description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield will pay hospitals to close excess beds in a move to slash several billion dollars a year from hospital costs and the nation's medical bill, Walter J. McNerney, president of the insurance plan, said yesterday.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: A vice president of the Honda Motor Company said yesterday that the company planned to adhere to its original goal of selling 260,000 cars in this country even though the Japanese Government had asked it to limit car imports to last year's level of 223,000 to help reduce the United States trade deficit with Japan.

title: Hirschfeld Counts 75 Years and Countless Ninas
description: There's a kind of magic that takes place. I once tried to analyze it, but I'm no closer to it now than I ever was. I just keep scratching away until something happens.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY. JUNE 20. 1978

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: T. Graydon Upton, a Philadelphia banker who served as Assistant Secretary of the Treasury under President Eisenhower, and Jack Hood Vaughn, a medalwinning marine who served as Peace Corps director under President Johnson, are two of the principals of a new investment banking firm in Washington. Their firm, called Pierce International, will deal in international shortterm paper and loans, and as financial consultants to United States companies involved in the developing nations.

title: West Preparing Aid Package to Bail Our Zambia's Troubled Economy
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, June 19A Western assistance operation, less dramatic but more expensive than the recent airlifting of troops and equipment to Zaire, is being organized in this key southern African country that is being menaced by insolvency and instability.

title: Letter: On Insurance Rates
description: To the Editor:

title: 15th Body From Boat Recovered
description: WINFIELD, an., June 20 (AP)The body of 9yearold Melisa Wright was recovered today from Lake Pomona, 50 to 60 yards from where the showboat Whippoorwill capsized Saturday night after a tornado struck. Fourteen other bodies have been recovered.

title: Uses of the Telephone Pole
description: The telephone company is putting up telephone poles in New York City  wooden telephone poles! for the first time in years. Not in any flush of enthusiasm for the past, but for practicality: to prevent the theft of the copper and lead wiring that runs from underground cables into buildings which no longer have either tenants or telephones. Practical, yes, but that

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA IN THE PARKS, Verdi's II Trovatore, Van Cortlandt Park, Bronx, 8:30.

title: U.S. Sets Rules On Pollution Controls
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The Goirernment today promulgated general regulations that will require about 40,000 American industries to install technology to abate the pollution they now discharge into city sewer systems. Thousands of other industries discharge their wastes under controlled permits directly into surface waters and will not be directly affected by today's action.

title: Chess:
description: What does it mean when two specialists in an extraordinarily sharp opening such as the Najdorf variationof the Sicilian Defense slip right past the opportunities for supposedly promising piece sacrifices only to end up in a new gambit?

title: Music and Dance Conferences Slated
description: A choreographers conference and a conference of composers and librettists will be held at the O'Neill Theater Center in Waterford, Conn., this summer along with the center's 14th annual national Playwrights Conference.

title: Money Offer to Hospitals
description: The Blue CrossBlue Shield systems will pay hospitals to close their excess beds in a move to reduce national hospital costs. Page A18.

title: Patrick Grimes, 88, Irish Echo Publisher And a Hurler, Dead
description: Patrick J. Grimes, president and publisher of The Irish Echo weekly newspaper, champion hurler, and a leading figure in the IrishAmerican community in the New York City area died Monday in a nursing home in Scarsdale, N.Y., at the age of 88. His home for many years was in Yonkers.

title: Montclair Breaks Ground for 126Unit LowerIncome Housing
description: MONTCLAIR, June 20With state and local officials emphasizing a community's obligation to all of its citizens, this Essex County suburb held a groundbreaking ceremony today for a $6.2 million housing project for low and middleincome families.

title: Phillies Reactivate Sizemore
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 20 (AP)Ted Sizempre was reactivated today by the Philadelphia Phillies after spending six weeks on the disabled list with broken bones in his left hand. To make room for Sizemore, Jim Morrison, a rookie second baseman, was optioned to the Oklahoma City 89ers of the American Association.

title: P.S.C. CLEARS THE WAY FOR NEV POWER LINE
description: ALBANY, June 20The New York State Public Service Commission, ending years of legal wrangling, cleared the way today for use of a controversial 765kilovolt power line being constructed through northern New York State.

title: Cranford Woman Slain
description: An 18yearold Cranford woman was found brutally murdered yesterday, the police said. The body of Michelle DiMarzo was found lying beside a pile of leaves at the Cranford Conservation Center, a recycling plant near the edge of the town, according to Chief Matthew T. Haney. The police reported that she had been sexually attacked.

title: DECAMP SEEKS BUYER FOR COMMUTER LINES
description: CLIFTON, June 20The DeCamp Bus Lines, one of the oldest commuter bus companies in the state, has offered its routes for sale, raising the possibility that service for some or all of its 15,000 daily riders could be jeopardized some time this summer.

title: Key Nations Supporting Tariff Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The major industrial, countries advanced significantly in a series of meetings .ended here today'toward a general reduction of tariff and nontariff trade barriers that, if adopted, would be the first round of trade liberalization in a decade.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: Lighting a dark hall can be a complex, expensive project. Most people make do with one or two inadequate fixtures that cast meager pools of light into the darkness.

title: School Started in 20's
description: It might have been the Harvard Drama School  because that was where its founder, George Pierce Baker, taught playwriting to the likes of Eugene O'Neill and Philip Barry, who joined his socalled 47 Workshop.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Futures of cattle, hogs and pork bellies fell the permissible daily limit yesterday in Chicago  a welcome development for consumers. The meat complex, plays an important role in the Consumer Price Index, which has been reflecting high prices especially for beef in recent months.

title: Cubans Said to Halt Participation in Drive on Eritrea
description: PARIS, June 21A representative of the Eritrean independence movement said here today that Cubans and Southern Yemenis were no longer participating in Ethiopia's drive to crush the guerrillas.

title: Strikes, Once Repressed, Return to Brazil
description: SAO BERNARDO, Brazil  The right of workers to strike, repressed by Brazil's military regime for 14 years, has been reasserted successfully by the metalworkers of this industrial center with dramatic impact on labormanagement relations in Brazil.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: AMAX Inc., Greenwich, Conn., a diversified natural resources company, has appointed William Hill Jr. senior vice president of the iron ore, chemicals and forest products group.

title: Steel: An Industry Besieged
description: The Justice Department's approval yesterday of the proposed merger of the LTV Corporation and the Lykes Corporation comes in the midst of one of the severest retrenchments in the history of the American steel industry.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: It's ironic, Jimmy Ling said yesterday when he heard that the Lykes CorporationLTV Corporation merger had been approved by Attorney General Griffin B. Bell. We had to sell off two companies, a regulated airline [Braniff] and a small cable company [Okonite], to be allowed to keep Jones Laughlin. It would seem that the Justice Department has begun to face up to some of the economic facts of life.

title: World News Briefs
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, June 21 (UPI)President Mobutu Sese Seko defended his regime today against Western charges of corruption and reminded his critics of bribery scandals involving American companies.

title: President Is Moving to Combat Antitax Sentiment
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  President Carter is seeking to combat the antitax sentiment reflected in California's Proposition 13 by threatening to veto spending bills and by emphasizing that his taxcut plan will provide the most help to the battleground group of families earning $15,000 to $30,000 a year, the Democratic national chairman, John C. White, said today.

title: At Youngstown Sheet, Relief but No Joy
description: CAMPBELL, Ohio, June 21 Everybody breathed a sigh of relief in there, John Watt said today. At least they know now it won't go bankrupt, that their pensions are safe.

title: World Gold
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 21, 1978

title: AN ECONOMIC AGENCY TO AID STATE SOUGHT
description: TRENTON, June 21Leaders of business and industry appealed today for Cabinetlevel Department of Commerce and Economic Development to act as an advocate for business interests and to spur the economy of the state.

title: Byrne Plays Opposite Miss Loren In His Role as Film Promoter
description: CLIFTON, June 21Governor Byrne submitted today to kisses on both cheeks by Sophia Loren all for the cause, he said, of dramatizing his administration's effort to woo the motion picture industry back to New Jersey.

title: Summer Arrives
description: At exactly 2:10 P.M. yesterday, the sun reached its northernmost point and sum merwhich has been here in an informal way, on and off, for weeksarrived formally. The temperature in Central Park at that moment, according to the National Weather Service, was 72 degrees Fahrenheit. The sun rose at 4:25 A.M. and set at 7:31 P.M., making the day the longest of the year. From now until the sun reaches its southernmost pointthe first day of winterdays will get shorter and nights longer, although both are more than likely to get hotter before they get colder.

title: Closeout Sale! 42 Summonses! No Bargain!
description: With the command We're going in! Commissioner Bruce C. Ratner of the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs yesterday led a raiding party of inspectors and awes on a sweep of socalled going out of business stores on and around Fifth Avenue. He charged that they had been systematically violating the city's consumer protection ordinances.

title: Anastasio Captures Race in Central Park
description: Bob Anastasio, a 25yearold financial analyst and former Cornell outdoor halfmile champion, finished first among 950 men and women in a road race over the 3.5mile course in Central Park last night. He was clocked in 16 minutes 36.5 seconds.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridge:
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 21In numbers alone, the United States will dominate the foursession final of the World Pair Championship beginning here tonight.

title: TaxCut Bill Reduced to $15 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  In an effort to muster Democratic support in the House Ways and Means Committee, the Administration agreed today to strip its taxcut bill of socalled reform elements and to pare it to $15 billion, according to Congressional sources. They said, however, that this could be revised later.

title: Carter Starts Antitrust Study
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) President Carter, declaring that there is a great need for reform of Federal antitrust laws, inaugurated a national commission today to seek ways of making those laws more effective.

title: TKTS, in Fifth Year at the Booth, Is Still a Hit
description: Sales of halfprice theater tickets at the West 47th Street and Lower Manhattan Theater Centers have increased from 640,000 to 905,000 tickets in the last two seasons and are expected to reach 1,050,000 tickets in the current 197778, TKTS season, ending June 30, an executive of the Theater Development Fund, which runs the centers, said yesterday.

title: OPEC Assets Grow
description: ZURICH, June 21 (AP)  Total financial reserves of the 13 members of the Organization of Oil Exporting Countries climbed to $75 billion at the end of last year, the Swiss Credit Bank said today. It said the amount was five times higher than the reserves held by OPEC members at the end of 1973 when sharp oilprice increases began. The bank, one of Switzerland's top three, said total accumulated foreign assets of the group were estimated at $155 billion at the end of 1977.

title: Earthquake Testimony Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP)Testimony about possible earthquake problems at the proposed terminal site in California for shipments of liquefied ntural gas has been delayed pending a report from the United States Geological Survey, Brian Heisler, a staff counsel at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, said the survey had been asked to provide its opinion about the problem at the promo?? terminal at Point Conception, Calif.

title: New York RatControl Plan
description: New York City has applied to the Government for approval to hire 500 workers under the Comprehensive Education and Training Act to assist in the Health Department's ratcontrol program, Mayor Koch announced yesterday, The additional temporary workers would be assigned to areas targeted by the Pest Control Bureau and would be expected to clean up 29,000 premises in 75 days.

title: Autos and Livestock on 20/20
description: THE third edition of 2020 was delivered on Tuesday at 10 P.M. and, as the ABC News magazine continues to recover from its disastrous debut, troubling flaws and potential assets are becoming clearer.

title: India's Population at 625 Million
description: NEW DELHI, June 21 (Reuters) India's population crossed the 625 million mark last year, according to figures made public by the registrar general's office. Uttar Pradesh in the north is the largest state, with a population of 99 million. Calcutta remains India's largest city, with a population of 8.3 million, followed by Bombay, 7.6 million, and New Delhi, 5.3 million.

title: CloseOut Sale! 42 Summonses! No Bargain!
description: With the command We're going in! Commissioner Bruce C. Ratner of the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs yesterday led a raiding party of inspectors and aides on a sweep of socalled going out of business stores on and around Fifth Avenue. He charged that they had been systematically violating the city's consumer protection ordinances.

title: Uranium Decision
description: The New Mexico Supreme Court yesterday vacated a lower court ruling against the General Atomic Company, opening the way for a possible upset of the recent default judgment against that company in its suit with the United Nuclear Corporation over uranium contracts.

title: Judges Put Kennecott Decision Off
description: ??A threejudge Federal appeals court ??served decision here yesterday in a ??it that will determine whether the ??irtissWright Corporation will be al??wed to wage a second proxy fight for ??ntrol of the Kennecott Copper Corporation.

title: New A.M.A. Chief Calls on Physicians To Curb Fee Rises
description: ST. LOUIS, June 21 (AP)The new president of the American Medical Association called on physicians today to voluntarily restrain increases in fees.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: TOKYO, June 21  The Bank of Japan stepped into the foreign exchange market here for the first time in more than two months in an attempt to restrain wild fluctuations in currency values as the dollar dropped to another postwar low.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal judge in Manhattan has rejected a request to lift New York State's ban against heavy trucks on a stretch of Routes 9W and 340 between the New Jersey border and the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway.

title: Raped and Slain Cranford Student May Have Known Her Murderer
description: CRANFORD June 21  The police speculated today that an 18yearold high school senior who was raped and fatally bludgeoned late Monday night or early yesterday morning may have known her assailant.

title: Contracts to Foster
description: The Foster Wheeler Corporation announced yesterday that it had been awarded contracts worth more than $100 million to supply two steam generators for Empresa Nacional de Electricidad of Spain. They will be placed at the utility's Compostilla 2 station in Ponferrada Leon, Spain.

title: Bank Has 9% Prime Rate
description: The First National Bank of Jefferson Parish, Gretna, La., a small bank in a suburb of New Orleans with $222 million in assets as of the end of the year, yesterday said it had raised its prime lending rate to 9 percent from 8 percent. Most large banks remained at 8 percent, but they are closely watching monetary conditions, which are being tightened by the Federal Reserve and could, it is believed, raise the prevailing prime rate to 9 percent.

title: Fiji Helps U.N. and Itself by Sending Force to Lebanon
